built with pdoc

fitk.graphics

Submodule for plotting of Fisher objects.

See here for documentation of FisherFigure1D, FisherFigure2D, and FisherBarFigure.

   1"""
   2Submodule for plotting of Fisher objects.
   3
   4See here for documentation of ``FisherFigure1D``, ``FisherFigure2D``, and ``FisherBarFigure``.
   5"""
   6
   7# needed for compatibility with Python 3.7
   8from __future__ import annotations
   9
  10# standard library imports
  11import copy
  12import os  # pylint: disable=unused-import
  13from abc import ABC, abstractmethod
  14from collections.abc import MutableSequence, Sequence
  15from dataclasses import dataclass
  16from itertools import islice, product
  17from pathlib import Path
  18from typing import Any, Optional, Union
  19
  20# third party imports
  21import matplotlib as mpl
  22import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
  23import numpy as np
  24from matplotlib.artist import Artist
  25from matplotlib.axes import Axes
  26from matplotlib.figure import Figure
  27from matplotlib.patches import Ellipse
  28from matplotlib.patheffects import Normal, Stroke
  29from matplotlib.ticker import Formatter, Locator
  30from matplotlib.transforms import Bbox
  31from scipy.stats import chi2, norm
  32
  33# first party imports
  34from fitk.tensors import FisherMatrix
  35from fitk.utilities import (
  36    MismatchingSizeError,
  37    MismatchingValuesError,
  38    ParameterNotFoundError,
  39    float_to_latex,
  40    get_default_rcparams,
  41    is_iterable,
  42)
  43
  44
  45def _set_label_params(ax: Axes, which: str = "both", **kwargs):
  46    allowed_axis: dict[str, list[str]] = {
  47        "both": ["x", "y"],
  48        "x": ["x"],
  49        "y": ["y"],
  50    }
  51
  52    if which not in allowed_axis:
  53        raise ValueError(
  54            f"Argument `which={which}` is not one of {list(allowed_axis.keys())}"
  55        )
  56
  57    for axis in allowed_axis[which]:
  58        if getattr(ax, f"get_{axis}label")():
  59            getattr(ax, f"set_{axis}label")(
  60                getattr(ax, f"get_{axis}label")(),
  61                **kwargs,
  62            )
  63
  64
  65def _set_tick_params(ax: Axes, which: str = "both", **kwargs):
  66    allowed_axis: dict[str, list[str]] = {
  67        "both": ["x", "y"],
  68        "x": ["x"],
  69        "y": ["y"],
  70    }
  71
  72    if which not in allowed_axis:
  73        raise ValueError(
  74            f"Argument `which={which}` is not one of {list(allowed_axis.keys())}"
  75        )
  76
  77    for axis in allowed_axis[which]:
  78        for item in getattr(ax, f"get_{axis}ticklabels")():
  79            for key, value in kwargs.items():
  80                getattr(item, f"set_{key}")(value)
  81
  82    # also alter any exponential offsets
  83    for key, value in kwargs.items():
  84        for axis in allowed_axis[which]:
  85            getattr(
  86                getattr(ax, f"get_{axis}axis")().get_offset_text(),
  87                f"set_{key}",
  88            )(value)
  89
  90
  91def _set_limits_2d(*, ax, size: int):
  92    for i, j in product(range(size), repeat=2):
  93        if i == j:
  94            ax[i, i].set_yticks([])
  95            ax[i, i].set_yticklabels([])
  96            if i < size - 1:
  97                ax[i, i].get_xaxis().set_visible(False)
  98        if i > 0 and 0 < j < size - 1:
  99            ax[i, j].set_yticks([])
 100            ax[i, j].set_yticklabels([])
 101        if i > j and i != size - 1:
 102            ax[i, j].get_xaxis().set_visible(False)
 103
 104
 105def _rescale_limits_2d(
 106    *,
 107    ax,
 108    size: int,
 109):
 110    for i, j in product(range(size), repeat=2):
 111        try:
 112            ax[i, j].relim()
 113            ax[i, j].autoscale_view()
 114            if i == j:
 115                ax[i, i].autoscale()
 116                ax[i, i].set_ylim(0, ax[i, i].get_ylim()[-1])
 117                ax[i, i].set_yticks([])
 118                ax[i, i].set_yticklabels([])
 119        except AttributeError:
 120            pass
 121
 122
 123def _mark_fiducials(
 124    *,
 125    fisher: FisherMatrix,
 126    ax,
 127    size: int,
 128    mark_fiducials: Union[bool, dict] = False,
 129):
 130    for i, j in product(range(size), repeat=2):
 131        try:
 132            if i == j:
 133                # marking the fiducials (1D)
 134                if mark_fiducials is not False:
 135                    if mark_fiducials is True:
 136                        mark_fiducials_1d = dict(linestyle="--", color="black")
 137                    else:
 138                        mark_fiducials_1d = mark_fiducials
 139
 140                    _mark_fiducial_1d(
 141                        fisher,
 142                        fisher.names[i],
 143                        ax[i, i],
 144                        **mark_fiducials_1d,
 145                    )
 146
 147            else:
 148                # marking the fiducials (2D)
 149                if mark_fiducials is not False:
 150                    if mark_fiducials is True:
 151                        mark_fiducials_2d = dict(linestyle="--", color="black")
 152                    else:
 153                        mark_fiducials_2d = mark_fiducials
 154
 155                    _mark_fiducial_2d(
 156                        fisher,
 157                        fisher.names[i],
 158                        fisher.names[j],
 159                        ax[i, j],
 160                        **mark_fiducials_2d,
 161                    )
 162
 163        except AttributeError:
 164            pass
 165
 166
 167@dataclass
 168class _TempContainer:
 169    labels: Sequence[str]
 170    colors: Sequence[str]
 171    x_array: Sequence[Sequence[float]]
 172    y_array: Sequence[Sequence[float]]
 173    space_per_object: float
 174    values_label: str
 175    scale: str
 176
 177
 178class FisherBaseFigure:
 179    def __init__(
 180        self,
 181        options: Optional[dict] = None,
 182        **kwargs,
 183    ):
 184        """
 185        Create an instance.
 186
 187        Notes
 188        -----
 189        Mixin.
 190        """
 191        self._figure = None
 192        self._axes: Optional[Union[Axes, Sequence[Axes]]] = None
 193        self._handles: MutableSequence[Artist] = []
 194        self._labels: MutableSequence[str] = []
 195        self._options: dict = get_default_rcparams()
 196
 197        self.cycler = mpl.rcParams["axes.prop_cycle"].by_key()["color"]
 198        self.current_color = iter(self.cycler)
 199
 200        if options and "style" in options:
 201            style = options.pop("style")
 202            # maybe it's one of the built-in styles
 203            if style in mpl.style.available:
 204                self._options = {
 205                    **mpl.style.library[style],
 206                    **get_default_rcparams(),
 207                    **options,
 208                }
 209                # we need to reset the color cycler
 210                self.cycler = (
 211                    mpl.style.library[style]
 212                    .get(
 213                        "axes.prop_cycle",
 214                        mpl.rcParams["axes.prop_cycle"],
 215                    )
 216                    .by_key()["color"]
 217                )
 218                self.current_color = iter(self.cycler)
 219
 220            # maybe it's a file
 221            else:
 222                # we need to reset the color cycler
 223                self.cycler = (
 224                    mpl.rc_params_from_file(style)
 225                    .get(
 226                        "axes.prop_cycle",
 227                        mpl.rcParams["axes.prop_cycle"],
 228                    )
 229                    .by_key()["color"]
 230                )
 231                self.current_color = iter(self.cycler)
 232
 233                self._options = {
 234                    **mpl.rc_params_from_file(style),
 235                    **options,
 236                }
 237
 238    @property
 239    def options(self):
 240        """Return the matplotlib options which were used for plotting."""
 241        return self._options
 242
 243    @property
 244    def axes(self):
 245        """Return the axes of the figure as a numpy array."""
 246        return self._axes
 247
 248    @property
 249    def figure(self):
 250        """
 251        Return the underlying figure.
 252
 253        Returns
 254        -------
 255        fig
 256            an instance of <a
 257            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/figure_api.html#matplotlib.figure.Figure"
 258            target="_blank" rel="noreferrer
 259            noopener">``matplotlib.figure.Figure``</a>.
 260        """
 261        return self._figure
 262
 263    @property
 264    def handles(self):
 265        """Return the handles of the currently drawn artists."""
 266        return self._handles
 267
 268    @property
 269    def labels(self):
 270        """Return the legend labels of the currently drawn artists."""
 271        return self._labels
 272
 273    def savefig(
 274        self,
 275        path: Union[str, Path],
 276        dpi: float = 300,
 277        bbox_inches: Union[str, Bbox] = "tight",
 278        **kwargs,
 279    ):
 280        """
 281        Save a figure.
 282
 283        Notes
 284        -----
 285        Convenience wrapper for <a
 286        href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/figure_api.html#matplotlib.figure.Figure.savefig"
 287        target="_blank" rel="noreferrer
 288        noopener">``matplotlib.figure.Figure.savefig``</a>.
 289
 290        Parameters
 291        ----------
 292        path : Path or str
 293            the path where to save the figure
 294
 295        dpi : float, optional
 296            the resolution of the saved figure (default: 300)
 297
 298        bbox_inches : str or Bbox, optional
 299            what is the bounding box for the figure (default: 'tight')
 300
 301        **kwargs
 302            any other keyword arguments that should be passed to <a
 303            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/figure_api.html#matplotlib.figure.Figure.savefig"
 304            target="_blank" rel="noreferrer
 305            noopener">``matplotlib.figure.Figure.savefig``</a>
 306
 307        Returns
 308        -------
 309        None
 310
 311        Raises
 312        ------
 313        EmptyFigureError
 314            if ``figure`` is not set
 315        """
 316        if not self.figure:
 317            raise EmptyFigureError
 318
 319        self.figure.savefig(
 320            path,
 321            dpi=dpi,
 322            bbox_inches=bbox_inches,
 323            **kwargs,
 324        )
 325
 326
 327class EmptyFigureError(Exception):
 328    """Error raised when the figure is empty."""
 329
 330    def __init__(self):
 331        self.message = (
 332            "The figure is empty; make sure to call one of the plotting methods before"
 333        )
 334        super().__init__(self.message)
 335
 336
 337class FisherMultipleAxesFigure(FisherBaseFigure, ABC):
 338    """The abstract base class for plotting multiple axes on a figure."""
 339
 340    def __init__(
 341        self,
 342        *args,
 343        options: Optional[dict] = None,
 344        hspace: float = 0.1,
 345        wspace: float = 0.1,
 346        contour_levels: Optional[Sequence[tuple[float, float]]] = None,
 347        **kwargs,
 348    ):
 349        """
 350        Create an instance.
 351
 352        Parameters
 353        ----------
 354        *args
 355            placeholder args
 356
 357        options : dict, optional
 358            the plotting options
 359
 360        hspace : float, optional
 361            the vertical space between plots (default: 0.1)
 362
 363        wspace : float, optional
 364            the horizontal space between plots (default: 0.1)
 365
 366        contour_levels : array_like of 2-tuples, optional
 367            the contour levels which we want to plot
 368
 369        **kwargs
 370            placeholder kwargs
 371        """
 372        self._names = None
 373        self._options: dict = {}
 374        self._ndim: int = 0
 375        self._hspace = hspace
 376        self._wspace = wspace
 377
 378        super().__init__(options=options, **kwargs)
 379
 380        # parse `contour_levels`
 381        if contour_levels is None:
 382            self.contour_levels = [(1.0, 0.3), (2.0, 0.1)]
 383        else:
 384            self.contour_levels = _parse_contour_levels(contour_levels)
 385
 386    @abstractmethod
 387    def plot(self, fisher: FisherMatrix, *args, **kwargs):
 388        """Implement plotting of Fisher objects."""
 389
 390    @abstractmethod
 391    def __getitem__(self, key):
 392        """Implement element access."""
 393
 394    @property
 395    def hspace(self) -> float:
 396        """
 397        Return the vertical spacing between axes.
 398
 399        The amount of height reserved for space between subplots, expressed as
 400        a fraction of the average axis height.
 401        """
 402        return self._hspace
 403
 404    @property
 405    def wspace(self) -> float:
 406        """
 407        Return the horizontal spacing between axes.
 408
 409        The amount of width reserved for space between subplots, expressed as a
 410        fraction of the average axis width.
 411        """
 412        return self._wspace
 413
 414    @property
 415    def names(self):
 416        """Return the names of the parameters plotted."""
 417        return self._names
 418
 419    def __repr__(self):
 420        """Return the representation of the figure."""
 421        return (
 422            f"<{self.__class__.__name__}(\n"
 423            f"    names={repr(self.names)},\n"
 424            f"    figure={repr(self.figure)},\n"
 425            f"    axes={repr(self.axes)})>"
 426        )
 427
 428    def __str__(self):
 429        """Return the string representation of the figure."""
 430        return (
 431            f"{self.__class__.__name__}(\n"
 432            f"    names={str(self.names)},\n"
 433            f"    figure={str(self.figure)},\n"
 434            f"    axes={str(self.axes)})"
 435        )
 436
 437    def add_artist_to_legend(
 438        self,
 439        artist: Artist,
 440        label: str,
 441    ):
 442        r"""
 443        Add a plotted artist to the legend.
 444
 445        Parameters
 446        ----------
 447        artist
 448            the artist which we want to put on the legend
 449
 450        label : str
 451            the label for the artist
 452
 453        Returns
 454        -------
 455        None
 456
 457        Notes
 458        -----
 459        This is a convenience function for correctly updating the legend after
 460        directly plotting some artist via ``<instance>[<name(s)>].<method>``
 461
 462        Examples
 463        --------
 464        Setup the plot:
 465
 466        >>> fig = FisherFigure1D()
 467        >>> fig.plot(FisherMatrix(np.diag([1, 2]), names=["a", "b"]), label="Fisher matrix")
 468
 469        Add something to the plot that has a handle:
 470
 471        >>> handle, = fig["a"].plot([-1, 0, 1], [-1, 0, 1], color='red')
 472
 473        Finally, add the handle to the legend, and draw the legend:
 474
 475        >>> fig.add_artist_to_legend(handle, "linear function")
 476        >>> _ = fig.legend() # the artist will now be shown correctly in the legend
 477
 478        Save it to a file:
 479
 480        >>> fig.savefig(
 481        ... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure2d_add_artist_to_legend1.png",
 482        ... dpi=150)
 483
 484        <img width="100%" HjQ9pWeng6zWX89LUePHsUFF1yA+fPn480334TFYgnavn3/p3v37g3aPvWGdUx7rM/qM/pxQ/fBO5gefvhh/PGPf8QXX3zhn8ISTHL/UahXgZo5cyYA9Lry0uHDhwEA06dPV3VfaisqKsJ5552Hs88+G8uXLw9qBQQC/6fhvKpXMIVTHVMT67O6wuG4ETHNrnvvvRf//d//jTVr1igOKhs3bsTbb7/d7/388Ic/xCOPPNLjYwcPHgQAOBwOZGdnD63Ap3DOOecgNjYWO3fuhNPp7Pb4hg0bAATmL/ZlypQpGDt2LKqqqlBUVDSkfampsLAQZ599Ni688EKsWLFCUQGfffZZlJaWnnIfGzduRGZmpv9spCvf/+nEiRODU+gwFm51TE2sz+oJm+NGyBLyOuH1esVPfvITkZGRIXbt2tXt8ccee0wsXLhQcV9HR4dYunSpOP/888WxY8cUjy1cuFBMmTJFtLe3d9vXkiVLBABx2223BfUz9Ma3KtArr7yiuP/QoUPCarV2W5Fp586d4swzzxS/+tWvuu3rj3/8owAgHnzwQcX9dXV1IiUlRXcrMhUUFIi0tDRx99139ziwCV36ZdesWSPmzJkjXnzxRcXz1q5dKwCIt956q9s+9u/fLywWi7DZbGE9YG2owrmOqSmS67Nawum4EdbB2+v1iptvvlkAEKeffrr40Y9+1O1vypQp3Q4sW7Zs8Q/oePbZZxWPLVq0SAAQixcvFgUFBaKlpUWUlZWJhx9+WAAQM2fOFHV1dap8PpfLJebNmyfi4+PFu+++K1wul9ixY4eYOXOmSEhI6LYW8l133eX/XNXV1YrHPB6P+OEPfyisVqv405/+JJqbm0VRUZG44IILhM1m09VayFu2bBHJycnC4XD0+H/6ox/9qFslvPTSSwUAERcXp9jXunXrBACRkpIili1bJsrLy0VLS4tYs2aNmDRpkrBYLOIvf/mLyp/QOMK9jqkpUuuzWsLtuBHWwbuurq5fI2e7HlicTqeYM2eOGDlypNizZ4/iscrKSvHqq6+KCy+8UKSnpwur1Sri4+PF6aefLp555hnR0tKi4icUoqWlRTz++ONi/PjxIjo6WqSnp4sbb7xRHDp0qNtzv/jiC5GcnCyuvPLKHludHR0d4vnnnxfTpk0TdrtdpKSkiCuuuEJs27ZNjY/Sbz//+c8HPCL69ddfF/Hx8d2m4ni9XrF+/Xpx1113icmTJ4uYmBhhs9lEVlaWuOGGG8SWLVtU/nTGEgl1TE2RWJ/VEm7HDZMQBlkLjoiIiABE0IA1IiKicMHgTUREZDAM3kRERAbD4E1ERGQwDN5EREQGw+BNRERkMAzeREREBsPgTUREZDAM3kRERAbD4E1ERGQwDN5EREQGw+BNRGQAzz//PEwmk/9v3bp1WheJNMTgTURkAPfeey+EEMjPz9e6KKQDDN5EREQGw+BNRERkMAzeEaC1tRXLli3D5ZdfjjFjxiA6OhppaWm4/PLLsWnTJq2LR0SD9Oqrr2Lq1Kmw2+3IyMjAHXfcgaqqKq2LRSpg8I4AxcXFuPXWWxEbG4tVq1ahoaEBX375JaxWKxYsWIDPP/9c6yIS0QA99dRTOHToEFavXo2amho8/fTTWLFiBebPn4/6+nqti0chxuAdAex2O84880ysWLECubm5sNvtmDx5MlauXImUlBT84he/0LqIRDRALpcLzz33HDIyMhAbG4ulS5fi4YcfxoEDB/DII49oXTwKMQbvCJCTk4MNGzYgKipKcX9UVBQmTpyIgoICNDU1aVQ6IhqMG2+8sdt9119/PQBgxYoVaG9vV7tIpCIG7wjx7bff4pprrsHYsWMRFRXlnyv61VdfAQDq6uo0LiERDcTo0aO73Tdu3DhYrVY4nU4cOHBAg1KRWhi8I8Dbb7+NefPmYfv27fjLX/6C2tpaCCEghMDChQsBAF6vV+NSEtFAxMXFdbvPbDbDbrcDAPu9w5xV6wJQ6D366KMQQuC5557Dueeeq3VxiCgImpubu93n9XrR0tICAEhKSlK5RKQmnnlHgOLiYgBAXl5et8d8FZ2IjOXo0aPd7jt48CA8Hg/i4uIwYcIEDUpFamHwjgDZ2dkAgB07dijur62txZ49e7QoEhEN0VtvvdXtvpUrVwIA8vPzYbUysRrOGLwjwIMPPggAeOCBB/D555/D6XSisLAQ11xzDVwul8alI6LBqKurw0MPPYTKykq4XC4sX74cv/3tb5GXl4ennnpK6+JRiDF4R4Cf/OQneP/995GdnY1rr70WaWlpWLJkCa699losWLAAADBmzBgsWrRI24ISUa98VxVbsWKFfzsuLg5nnXUWkpOT8dBDD+Hmm2/G119/zf7uCGASQgitC0FERET9xzNvIiIig2HwJiIiMhgGbyIiIoNh8CYiIjIYBm8iIiKDYfAmIiIyGAZvIiIig2HwJiIiMhgGbyIiIoNh8CYiIjIYBm8iIiKDYfAmIiIyGAZvIiIig2HwJiIiMhgGbyIiIoNh8CYiIjIYBm8iIiKDYfAmIiIymP8P9EdofnYwH84AAAAASUVORK5CYII=">
 485
 486        Notes
 487        -----
 488        The limits of the plot are not updated automatically.
 489        """
 490        self.labels.append(label)
 491        self.handles.append(artist)
 492
 493    def set_label_params(
 494        self,
 495        which: str = "both",
 496        **kwargs,
 497    ):
 498        """
 499        Set both x and y label parameters on all axes.
 500
 501        Parameters
 502        ----------
 503        which : {'both', 'x', 'y'}
 504            which axis to change (default: 'both')
 505
 506        **kwargs
 507            any keyword arguments that are also valid for <a
 508            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/text_api.html#matplotlib.text.Text"
 509            target="_blank" rel="noopener
 510            noreferrer">``matplotlib.text.Text``</a>.
 511
 512        Returns
 513        -------
 514        None
 515
 516        Raises
 517        ------
 518        EmptyFigureError
 519            if ``figure`` is not set
 520
 521        ValueError
 522            if ``which`` is not one of the allowed values
 523        """
 524        if not self.figure:
 525            raise EmptyFigureError
 526
 527        for nameiter in product(self.names, repeat=self._ndim):
 528            # only set the parameters which are not empty (should this be done
 529            # for all of them instead?)
 530            if self[nameiter]:
 531                _set_label_params(self[nameiter], which=which, **kwargs)
 532
 533    def set_tick_params(
 534        self,
 535        which: str = "both",
 536        **kwargs,
 537    ):
 538        """
 539        Set both x and y tick parameters on all axes.
 540
 541        Parameters
 542        ----------
 543        which : {'both', 'x', 'y'}
 544            which axis to change (default: 'both')
 545
 546        **kwargs
 547            any keyword arguments passed to the methods for handling tick
 548            parameters (such as 'fontsize', 'rotation', etc.)
 549
 550        Returns
 551        -------
 552        None
 553
 554        Raises
 555        ------
 556        EmptyFigureError
 557            if ``figure`` is not set
 558
 559        ValueError
 560            if ``which`` is not one of the allowed values
 561        """
 562        if not self.figure:
 563            raise EmptyFigureError
 564
 565        for nameiter in product(self.names, repeat=self._ndim):
 566            if self[nameiter]:
 567                _set_tick_params(self[nameiter], which=which, **kwargs)
 568
 569    def set_major_locator(
 570        self,
 571        locator: Locator,
 572        which: str = "both",
 573    ):
 574        """
 575        Set the major locator for all axes.
 576
 577        Parameters
 578        ----------
 579        locator
 580            the instance of <a
 581            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/ticker_api.html#matplotlib.ticker.Locator"
 582            target="_blank" rel="noopener
 583            noreferrer">``matplotlib.ticker.Locator``</a> to use.
 584
 585        which : {'both', 'x', 'y'}
 586            which axis to change (default: 'both')
 587
 588        Returns
 589        -------
 590        None
 591
 592        Raises
 593        ------
 594        EmptyFigureError
 595            if ``figure`` is not set
 596        """
 597        if not self.figure:
 598            raise EmptyFigureError
 599
 600        for nameiter in product(self.names, repeat=self._ndim):
 601            # for some reason, we cannot reuse the same instance, so we just
 602            # make a deep copy of it instead
 603            if (
 604                self[nameiter]
 605                and np.any(self[nameiter].get_xticks())
 606                and which in ["both", "x"]
 607            ):
 608                xloc = copy.deepcopy(locator)
 609                self[nameiter].xaxis.set_major_locator(xloc)
 610            if (
 611                self[nameiter]
 612                and np.any(self[nameiter].get_yticks())
 613                and which in ["both", "y"]
 614            ):
 615                yloc = copy.deepcopy(locator)
 616                self[nameiter].yaxis.set_major_locator(yloc)
 617
 618    def set_minor_locator(
 619        self,
 620        locator: Locator,
 621        which: str = "both",
 622    ):
 623        """
 624        Set the minor locator for all axes.
 625
 626        Parameters
 627        ----------
 628        locator
 629            the instance of <a
 630            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/ticker_api.html#matplotlib.ticker.Locator"
 631            target="_blank" rel="noopener
 632            noreferrer">``matplotlib.ticker.Locator``</a> to use.
 633
 634        which : {'both', 'x', 'y'}
 635            which axis to change (default: 'both')
 636
 637        Returns
 638        -------
 639        None
 640
 641        Raises
 642        ------
 643        EmptyFigureError
 644            if ``figure`` is not set
 645        """
 646        if not self.figure:
 647            raise EmptyFigureError
 648
 649        for nameiter in product(self.names, repeat=self._ndim):
 650            if (
 651                self[nameiter]
 652                and np.any(self[nameiter].get_xticks())
 653                and which in ["both", "x"]
 654            ):
 655                # same reason as the major locator
 656                xloc = copy.deepcopy(locator)
 657                self[nameiter].xaxis.set_minor_locator(xloc)
 658            if (
 659                self[nameiter]
 660                and np.any(self[nameiter].get_yticks())
 661                and which in ["both", "y"]
 662            ):
 663                yloc = copy.deepcopy(locator)
 664                self[nameiter].yaxis.set_minor_locator(yloc)
 665
 666    def set_major_formatter(
 667        self,
 668        formatter: Formatter,
 669        which: str = "both",
 670    ):
 671        """
 672        Set the major formatter for all axes.
 673
 674        Parameters
 675        ----------
 676        formatter
 677            the instance of <a
 678            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/ticker_api.html#matplotlib.ticker.Formatter"
 679            target="_blank" rel="noopener
 680            noreferrer">``matplotlib.ticker.Formatter``</a> to use.
 681
 682        which : {'both', 'x', 'y'}
 683            which axis to change (default: 'both')
 684
 685        Returns
 686        -------
 687        None
 688
 689        Raises
 690        ------
 691        EmptyFigureError
 692            if ``figure`` is not set
 693        """
 694        if not self.figure:
 695            raise EmptyFigureError
 696
 697        for nameiter in product(self.names, repeat=self._ndim):
 698            if self[nameiter] and which in ["both", "x"]:
 699                self[nameiter].xaxis.set_major_formatter(formatter)
 700            if self[nameiter] and which in ["both", "y"]:
 701                self[nameiter].yaxis.set_major_formatter(formatter)
 702
 703    def set_minor_formatter(
 704        self,
 705        formatter: Formatter,
 706        which: str = "both",
 707    ):
 708        """
 709        Set the minor formatter for all axes.
 710
 711        Parameters
 712        ----------
 713        formatter
 714            the instance of <a
 715            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/ticker_api.html#matplotlib.ticker.Formatter"
 716            target="_blank" rel="noopener
 717            noreferrer">``matplotlib.ticker.Formatter``</a> to use.
 718
 719        which : {'both', 'x', 'y'}
 720            which axis to change (default: 'both')
 721
 722        Returns
 723        -------
 724        None
 725
 726        Raises
 727        ------
 728        EmptyFigureError
 729            if ``figure`` is not set
 730        """
 731        if not self.figure:
 732            raise EmptyFigureError
 733
 734        for nameiter in product(self.names, repeat=self._ndim):
 735            if self[nameiter] and which in ["both", "x"]:
 736                self[nameiter].xaxis.set_minor_formatter(formatter)
 737            if self[nameiter] and which in ["both", "y"]:
 738                self[nameiter].yaxis.set_minor_formatter(formatter)
 739
 740
 741class FisherBarFigure(FisherBaseFigure):
 742    """
 743    Container for plotting single-axis bar-like figures.
 744
 745    .. versionadded:: 0.6.0
 746    """
 747
 748    def _parse_fractional_constraints(
 749        self,
 750        args: Sequence[FisherMatrix],
 751        marginalized: bool = True,
 752        colors: Optional[Sequence[str]] = None,
 753        labels: Optional[Sequence[str]] = None,
 754        values_label: Optional[str] = None,
 755        percent: bool = False,
 756        space: float = 0.3,
 757        scale: str = "linear",
 758    ):
 759        # error handling
 760        if not 0 <= space <= 1:
 761            raise ValueError("The value of `space` must be in the open interval (0, 1)")
 762
 763        allowed_scales = ["linear", "log", "symlog"]
 764        if scale not in allowed_scales:
 765            raise ValueError(f"The value of `scale` must be one of: {allowed_scales}")
 766
 767        for arg in args:
 768            if set(args[0].names) != set(arg.names):
 769                raise MismatchingValuesError(
 770                    "parameter name",
 771                    args[0].names,
 772                    arg.names,
 773                )
 774
 775        # reordering to match the first one
 776        args = [arg.sort(key=args[0].names) for arg in args]
 777
 778        # total number of parameters in the Fisher objects
 779        size = len(args[0])
 780
 781        # the width or height of all columns for a single parameter
 782        total_space = 1 - space
 783
 784        # the width or height of a single column for a single parameter
 785        space_per_object = total_space / len(args)
 786
 787        if not colors:
 788            colors = list(islice(self.current_color, len(args)))  # type: ignore
 789        elif len(colors) != len(args):
 790            raise MismatchingSizeError(colors, args)
 791
 792        if not labels:
 793            labels = [""] * len(args)
 794        elif len(labels) != len(args):
 795            raise MismatchingSizeError(labels, args)
 796
 797        if not values_label:
 798            if percent:
 799                values_label = r"$\sigma / \theta_\mathrm{fid}\ (\%)$"
 800            else:
 801                values_label = r"$\sigma / \theta_\mathrm{fid}$"
 802
 803        return _TempContainer(
 804            labels,
 805            colors,  # type: ignore
 806            [
 807                [
 808                    _ - total_space / 2 + (2 * index + 1) * space_per_object / 2
 809                    for _ in range(size)
 810                ]
 811                for index, arg in enumerate(args)
 812            ],
 813            [
 814                np.array(
 815                    [
 816                        arg.constraints(name=_, marginalized=marginalized)[0]
 817                        for _ in arg.names
 818                    ]
 819                )
 820                / np.array(
 821                    [
 822                        np.abs(fid) if not np.isclose(fid, 0) else 1
 823                        for fid in arg.fiducials
 824                    ]
 825                )
 826                for index, arg in enumerate(args)
 827            ],
 828            space_per_object=space_per_object,
 829            values_label=values_label,
 830            scale=scale,
 831        )
 832
 833    def plot_absolute_constraints(
 834        self,
 835        args: Sequence[FisherMatrix],
 836        kind: str,
 837        marginalized: bool = True,
 838        colors: Optional[Sequence[str]] = None,
 839        labels: Optional[Sequence[str]] = None,
 840        values_label: Optional[str] = None,
 841        scale: str = "linear",
 842        space: float = 0.3,
 843        capsize: Optional[float] = None,
 844        **kwargs,
 845    ):
 846        r"""
 847        Make a plot of the constraints of the Fisher matrices.
 848
 849        Parameters
 850        ----------
 851        args : array_like of FisherMatrix
 852            the Fisher matrices for which we want to plot the constraints
 853
 854        kind : str, {'bar', 'barh', 'errorbar'}
 855            the kind of plot we want (vertical bar, horizontal bar, errorbar)
 856
 857        marginalized : bool, optional
 858            whether the marginalized or the unmarginalized constraints should
 859            be plotted (default: True)
 860
 861        colors : array_like of str, optional
 862            the colors to use for the plotting (default: default matplotlib
 863            colors)
 864
 865        labels : array_like of str, optional
 866            the labels for the Fisher matrices (default: None)
 867
 868        values_label : str, optional
 869            the label for the axis containing the constraints (default:
 870            ``$\theta_\mathrm{fid}$``)
 871
 872        scale : str, {'linear', 'log'}
 873            the scale used for the y axis (default: 'linear')
 874
 875        space : float, optional
 876            the space reserved between the bars (default: 0.3)
 877
 878        capsize : float, optional
 879            the width of the errorbars (default: none, that is, determined
 880            automatically)
 881
 882        **kwargs
 883            any keyword arguments passed to <a
 884            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/_as_gen/matplotlib.pyplot.bar.html"
 885            target="_blank" rel=noreferrer
 886            noopener>``matplotlib.pyplot.bar``</a>, or <a
 887            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/_as_gen/matplotlib.pyplot.barh.html"
 888            target="_blank" rel=noreferrer
 889            noopener>``matplotlib.pyplot.barh``</a>, or <a
 890            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/_as_gen/matplotlib.pyplot.errorbar.html"
 891            target="_blank" rel=noreferrer
 892            noopener>``matplotlib.pyplot.errorbar``</a>.
 893
 894        Returns
 895        -------
 896        None
 897
 898        Examples
 899        --------
 900        Define some Fisher matrices:
 901
 902        >>> fm1 = FisherMatrix(np.diag([1, 2, 3]) * 1e3, names=["a", "b", "c"], latex_names=[r'$\Omega_\mathrm{m}$', '$h$', "$n_s$"], fiducials=[0.3, 0.7, 0.96])
 903        >>> fm2 = FisherMatrix(np.diag([4, 5, 6]) * 1e3, names=["a", "b", "c"], latex_names=[r'$\Omega_\mathrm{m}$', '$h$', "$n_s$"], fiducials=[0.35, 0.67, 0.9])
 904
 905        Make a vertical bar plot:
 906
 907        >>> fig = FisherBarFigure()
 908        >>> fig.plot_absolute_constraints([fm1, fm2], 'bar', labels=['Fisher 1', 'Fisher 2'])
 909        >>> _ = fig.figure.legend()
 910
 911        Save it to a file:
 912
 913        >>> fig.savefig(
 914        ... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure_plot_absolute_constraints_bar.png",
 915        ... dpi=150)
 916
 917        <img width="100%" src="data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAA6kAAAK4CAYAAACWIrs5AAAAOXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBNYXRwbG90bGliIHZlcnNpb24zLjcuMSwgaHR0cHM6Ly9tYXRwbG90bGliLm9yZy/bCgiHAAAACXBIWXMAABcSAAAXEgFnn9JSAABCuElEQVR4nO3de5iXBZ3//9dwGIYZEIeDgQdUMFHHZSBXy3TXE5pr5TG1voZa6xqZloaZWhusaZrmV11TQnPV/FptflHjq6ZIULawHioFxEMKeBZFEIXhKMzvD3/MOs4gM8wMcw88HtfldTX3fX/u+/3xYq54ep9KamtrawMAAAAF0Km9BwAAAIB1RCoAAACFIVIBAAAoDJEKAABAYYhUAAAACkOkAgAAUBgiFQAAgMLo0t4DAAAA7a+2tja1tbXtPQabkZKSkpSUlDT7cyIVAAC2QLW1tVmyZEnefffdLFu2LGvWrGnvkdgMlZaWpmfPnunTp086d+7cpM+U1PrPJQAAsEVZu3Zt5s+fn3feeae9R2ELUVZWloEDBzYpVJ1JBQCALcw777xTF6i9e/dOz549061bt426NBPWZ+3atampqckbb7yRFStWZOHChdlmm202+DmRCgAAW5i33347SbLNNtukT58+7TwNm6tOnTqlV69eSZLXXnstS5YsaVKkerovAABsQWpra7Ny5cokyVZbbdXO07AlqKioSJKsWrWqSQ/nEqkAALAF+WAkNPVBNtASnTr9T3aKVAAAADoUkQoAAEBhiFQAAAAKQ6QCAABQGCIVAAAgSUlJyUf+c+CBByZJxo4dm5KSktxyyy0bfayddtqp8O+lrampyW233Zazzjorn/zkJ+vepTt27Ng2Pa73pAIAAI3a6fx723uEDXrhss+2+j5POeWURpfvttturX6sInvuuedy8sknb/LjilQAAIAP2NAZ0jPPPDNf/OIXM2DAgE0zUDvp2bNn/vmf/zl777139t5779x77735wQ9+0ObHFakAAADN0Ldv3/Tt27e9x2hzgwcPzs9//vO6nydNmrRJjuueVAAAgGZY3z2pS5cuzaWXXprq6ur06tUrPXr0yODBg3P88cfngQceWO/+fv7zn2fo0KHp3r17+vfvn6997WtZvHhxo9u+9957GTduXPbdd99stdVW6d69e4YNG5arr7467733XoPt1937Wltbm2uvvTbV1dUpLy/PsGHDWvBvoG05kwoAANBCa9asyYgRI/LII4+kb9++OfDAA1NWVpZXXnkl9913XyoqKvKZz3ymwefOO++8XHPNNTnwwAOzyy67ZNq0abnhhhvy9NNP549//GO9hystX748n/3sZzN16tT07t07n/rUp1JWVpZHHnkk55xzTqZOnZq77rornTo1PBc5atSo3HzzzTnggAOy++67Z9WqVW3676MlRCoAAEALPfTQQ3nkkUey995756GHHkpZWVndunfffTfPPfdco5+77bbbMnPmzAwZMiRJ8tZbb2XffffNn/70p0ydOjUHH3xw3bbnnntupk6dmhNPPDHjx49Pr169kiRLlizJF7/4xUycODE33HBDRo0a1eA4d955Zx5//PFUVVW15tduEy73BQAA+ID1vYLmhRdeWO9nFixYkCTZb7/96gVqkmy11VbZa6+9Gv3cD3/4w7pATd6/33VdZD700EN1y998883ceOON2WGHHXLzzTfXBWry/gOObrrpppSWlmbcuHGNHue73/1uhwjUxJlUAACAetb3CpoePXqs9zPDhg1Lp06dcvPNN2ePPfbIsccemz59+mzwWIcddliDZbvuumuS5PXXX69b9oc//CGrV6/O4Ycfnu7duzf4TP/+/fPxj388s2bNyvLlyxtsc+SRR25wlqIQqQAAAB+woVfQNGbXXXfN5ZdfngsuuCCnn356Ro0alT333DOHHHJITj311AwdOrTRz22//fYNlvXs2TNJsnLly  918
 919        Make a horizontal bar plot:
 920
 921        >>> fig = FisherBarFigure()
 922        >>> fig.plot_absolute_constraints([fm1, fm2], 'barh', labels=['Fisher 1', 'Fisher 2'])
 923        >>> _ = fig.figure.legend()
 924
 925        Save it to a file:
 926
 927        >>> fig.savefig(
 928        ... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure_plot_absolute_constraints_barh.png",
 929        ... dpi=150)

 932
 933        Make an errobar plot:
 934
 935        >>> fig = FisherBarFigure()
 936        >>> fig.plot_absolute_constraints([fm1, fm2], 'errorbar', labels=['Fisher 1', 'Fisher 2'], capsize=4)
 937        >>> _ = fig.figure.legend()
 938
 939        Save it to a file:
 940
 941        >>> fig.savefig(
 942        ... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure_plot_absolute_constraints_errorbar.png",
 943        ... dpi=150)

VmZJJk7d26T1tkcK9eszZgfPZKHFy7d5NgP9O+ViWfum85lm/5nBgAA7V1bfD9n49rtTury5ctz/fXXp7y8PGPGjKnVN3DgwBxyyCGZO3du7rrrrkatd+211+ayyy6r0967d+/06tUrSfL66683ue62cOmv5zYqoCbJwwuX5tJfz2vhigAAAOrXbkPqtGnTUlVVlaFDh6Zbt251+keNGpUkmTJlSqPW22effbLLLrvUaf/rX/+aJUuWZJdddsngwYObVnQbeGXZyvzisb9v1pxfPPa8e1QBAIA20W5D6ob7TRs6fjtgwIBa4zZHdXV1Xnnlldxxxx0ZPXp09thjj/zyl79Mp06dtrzgNnLbo89nzdrNO9G9Zm11bvvT8y1UEQAAQMO2besCttRLL72UJDVHcd+pZ8+etcZtjne/+92ZP39+kuTkk0/O+PHjN/te1A1n299p/vz5GThw4GbXtKUae8z3nR5asCTnHLhHM1cDAACwce12J3X58uVJkvLy8nr7N+x6bhi3OZ599tm8/vrrmTlzZl599dXstddeufLKK7e82Db01qq3W3UeAABAU7TbndSKiookyerVq+vtX7VqVa1xm6tHjx750Ic+lLvvvjvvf//785WvfCW9e/du9KtoGno6WEM7rC2lW6ct+794S+cBAAA0RbvdSe3Tp0+SZOnS+o+zvvbaa0mSvn37Nuk62267bf793/89SXLDDTc0aa228IH+9R+H3pQPDti+mSsBAADYtHYbUocNG5YkWbhwYb39CxYsSJIMGTKkydfacD/qokWLmrxWaztpn11TVlqyWXPKSkty0vt3baGKAAAAGtZuQ+qBBx6Yrl27Zvbs2amqqqrTP3PmzCTJ6NGjN7nWjBkz0rlz57z66qv19r/44otJku23b3+7izt275wTRtR9tc7GnDBi1/Tu3v6eZAwAALR/7TakVlRUZOzYsVm1alUmTpxYq2/BggWZOnVqKisrc+SRR9a0z5kzJ/vtt18uuuiiWuPXrVuXVatW5de//nWd61RXV9es35jAW0QXH13Z6GO/H+jfKxcf3f7eBwsAAHQM7TakJsnFF1+ckSNH5oILLsjkyZOzYsWKzJ49O8cff3wqKioyadKklJaW1oyfMGFCHnzwwYwfPz5LliypaS8pWX8c9vOf/3yuvfbaPP/881mxYkVmzZqVE044IX/4wx8yYsSIfPWrX231z9gcOpeVZuKZ++YT+/Zr8OhvWWlJPrFvv0w8c990LiutdwwAAEBLK6murq5u6yKaYuXKlbn88sszadKk/O1vf0uPHj1y6KGH5rLLLsuAAQNqjZ06dWpOOumk7L///rn99ttrwml1dXX+8Ic/5H//93/z+9//PosWLcrKlSvTo0ePVFZW5oQTTshZZ53V4OtuNseGp/s29PTflrZ42ar8+I+Lcu20Z2vazj1oj5w+cndHfAEA2Oq09fdz6mr3IbW9KcK/BG+sWJOhl95b8/Osiw9Ljy5lbVYPAAC0lSJ8P6e2dn3cFwAAgI5FSAUAAKAwhFQAAAAKQ0gFAACgMIRUAAAACkNIBQAAoDCEVAAAAApDSAUAAKAwhFQAAAAKQ0gFAACgMIRUAAAACkNIBQAAoDC2besCaDnLV7/dqPblq99OWWlJnXEV5X57AAAArUsK6cAGf+2eRo0bOX5ave2Lvn1Uc5YDAACwSY77AgAAUBh2UjuweZd9pK1LAAAA2CxCagfmnlIAAKC9cdwXAACAwhBSAQAAKAwhFQAAgMIQUgEAACgMIRUAAIDCEFIBAAAoDCEVAACAwhBSAQAAKAwhFQAAgMIQUgEAACgMIRUAAIDCEFIBAAAoDCEVAACAwhBSAQAAKAwhFQAAgMIQUgEAACgMIRUAAIDCEFIBAAAoDCEVAACAwhBSAQAAKAwhFQAAgMIoqa6urm7rIrYm3bt3z5o1azJw4MC2LgUAALZ68+fPT1lZWZYtW9bWpfD/s5Payrp27ZqysrK2LqPDmD9/fubPn9/WZQBbIX/+AG3Fnz/Nq6ysLF27dm3rMvgXdlJp1yorK5Mkc+fObeNKgK2NP3+AtuLPHzo6O6kAAAAUhpAKAABAYQipAAAAFIaQCgAAQGEIqQAAABSGp/sCAABQGHZSAQAAKAwhFQAAgMIQUgEAACgMIRUAAIDCEFIBAAAoDCEVAACAwhBSAQAAKIxt27oAAGgvli9fnj/96U959dVX8/rrr+fMM89s65IAoMMpqa6urm7rIgCgPXjmmWfy/e9/Pz/4wQ+y44475umnn27rkgCgwxFSKaS33347t956a6ZOnZqddtopnTp1SlVVVV544YUceeSROfXUU7Pttg4CAG2jb9++Ofroo/P973+/rUsBgA7Ht3wK56mnnsoxxxyT3r1751e/+lW23377mr6XX345o0ePzre//e386le/yqBBg9qwUmBr9Je//CUvvfRS9t9//7YuBQA6JDupFMrLL7+c97znPVmzZk2eeeaZ9O7du86YF154IXvvvXe6dOmSJ598st4xAC3lxhtvzNlnn52//e1v2XXXXdu6HKADuvfee/OrX/0qTz75ZK666qrssMMOufbaa7PtttvmL3/5S/r375/vfOc7KSkpaetSoUXYSaVQvvWtb+XVV1/NWWed1WD43HnnnXPCCSfk5ptvzje/+c1cffXVrVsksFWbPn16+vfvL6ACLWLt2rWZPHlyJkyYkBNOOCGf/vSnM3LkyFx++eXp1q1bXnvttfTq1Ssf/ehHc9BBB7V1udAihFQKZebMmUmSoUOHbnTc8OHDc/PNN9eMB2gN1dXV+f3vf58jjjgiV199dZ5//vmsXbs2s2bNyg9/+MMMGDCgrUsE2rmZM2fmQx/6UJL1txesXbs23/nOd9K5c+ck658yniRLlixpsxqhpQmpFMqqVasaNa60tDRJsnr16pYsB6CWJ598MosXL86jjz6az3/+83nf+96XJDniiCNyySWX5Mc//nEbVwi0d3vuuWdGjBiRl19+OXPnzs31119fE1CT5LHHHkuy6b/Qh/Zsm7YuAP7V8OHDkyTz58/f6Lhnn302STJy5MgWrwlgg+nTpydJrrnmmpqAmiTl5eV59dVX26osoAPp06dPunbtmmnTpiVJDj744Fr9P//5z7Pnnntmzz33bIvyoFUIqRTKuHHjUlpamvvuu2+j46ZNm5aysrKMGzeulSoDWP9nT2VlZQ499NBa7Y888kgqKyvbqCqgI/rd736XXXfdtdabDN58883ccccdOeWUU5L88y/tk2TGjBm57LLLct111+WSSy6JZ6PSngmpFMrQoUNz3nnnZdasWXnmmWfqHTN//vzMmjUrY8eOzbvf/e5WrhDYWq1bty4zZsyos6vx0EMP5aWXXsrhhx/eRpUBHdHvfve7On/e/PSnP01VVVXGjBmT6urqXH755UmSNWvW5KKLLsrXvva1/Pu//3tuvPHGvPXWW21RNjQLIZXCueyyy7LHHnvkpz/9ab39P/3pT7P77rvn61//eitXBmzNnnjiibz22mv1fmncYYcdsv/+++f111/3MBOgyebPn59FixblkEMOqdU+b968DB06NLvttltuvvnmnHTSSUnW77D+6U9/yje/+c0888wz+fOf/5zu3bu3RenQLIRUCmPVqlV56qmn0qVLl1x//fX52c9+Vu+4n/zkJ5kwYUK6du2ap556KqtWrcqdd96ZIUOG5LTTTsutt96a66+/Pp/4xCfy6KOP5sc//nFuuOGGnH766Xn00Udb+VMBHcW0adNSWlqa/fffv6Zt3bp1+elPf5qTTz452267bb73ve/VPHkTYEs9//zz6devX50TGmeddVY6deqUcePGZfXq1TW3Hmy//fa54oorMnHixLz3ve/NPffc0xZlQ7MRUimMsrKymneeHnbYYRkwYECdByj99a9/zcCBA3PYYYclWf/wkrKyshx11FEZO3Zspk+fng996EM555xzcuKJJ+bkk0/Ofvvtl7PPPjsf+9jHcuWVV7b2xwI6iOnTp2fEiBHp0aNHTdvrr7+exYsX57DDDsvrr7+epUuXen8q0GQHHHBAnnvuuWy//fa12vfee+889NBD+c53vpOzzjqrpv3111/P5z73ufz1r3/NpEmTcvvtt7d2ydCsvIKGwthmm23yj3/8I1deeWV69+6dnXbaKQ8++GAGDhxYM+aPf/xjdt5559xyyy1ZvHhx/vGPf2Sbbdb/XUt5eXne9a531Yzv1atXevbsWfPz9ttvn8WLF7f+BwM6hNdffz1jxoyp1darV6988YtfzA9/+MPcd999+da3vtVG1QFbq2effTZ77bVXli5dmu222y69evVyjzztnpBKoQwaNChf+cpXav38rxYvXpwJEyZkwoQJSZIvf/nLtfrfef/FO3/2pDtgS82cObPe9u985zutXAnAP/Xt2zdf/epXc9ttt+WNN97ImjVrcsEFF7R1WdAkQiqFcuWVV270SO6XvvSlfOlLX2rFigAAiqtr16659NJL27oMaFbuSQUAAKAwhFQ6hDvvvDPXXntt/vznP+eiiy7KQw89lEsuuaTBnwEAgGIqqXaTHgAAAAVhJxUAAIDCEFIBAAAoDCEVAACAwhBSAQAAKAwhFQAAgMIQUgEAACgMIRUAAIDCEFIBAAAoDCEVAACAwhBSAQAAKAwhFQAAgMIQUgEAACgMIRUAAIDCEFIBAAAoDCEVAACAwhBSAQAAKIz/D2U2C5R1QCk7AAAAAElFTkSuQmCC">
 946        """
 947        size = len(args[0])
 948        latex_names = args[0].latex_names
 949
 950        # error handling
 951        if not 0 <= space <= 1:
 952            raise ValueError("The value of `space` must be in the open interval (0, 1)")
 953
 954        allowed_scales = ["linear", "log"]
 955        if scale not in allowed_scales:
 956            raise ValueError(f"The value of `scale` must be one of: {allowed_scales}")
 957
 958        for arg in args:
 959            if set(args[0].names) != set(arg.names):
 960                raise MismatchingValuesError(
 961                    "parameter name",
 962                    args[0].names,
 963                    arg.names,
 964                )
 965
 966        # reordering to match the first one
 967        args = [arg.sort(key=args[0].names) for arg in args]
 968
 969        # the width or height of all columns for a single parameter
 970        total_space = 1 - space
 971
 972        # the width or height of a single column for a single parameter
 973        space_per_object = total_space / len(args)
 974
 975        if not colors:
 976            colors = list(islice(self.current_color, len(args)))  # type: ignore
 977        elif len(colors) != len(args):
 978            raise MismatchingSizeError(colors, args)
 979
 980        if not labels:
 981            labels = [""] * len(args)
 982        elif len(labels) != len(args):
 983            raise MismatchingSizeError(labels, args)
 984
 985        if not values_label:
 986            values_label = r"$\theta_\mathrm{fid}$"
 987
 988        x_array = [
 989            [
 990                _ - total_space / 2 + (2 * index + 1) * space_per_object / 2
 991                for _ in range(size)
 992            ]
 993            for index, arg in enumerate(args)
 994        ]
 995        y_array = [arg.fiducials for arg in args]
 996        yerr_array = [
 997            np.array(
 998                [
 999                    arg.constraints(name=_, marginalized=marginalized)[0]
1000                    for _ in arg.names
1001                ]
1002            )
1003            for index, arg in enumerate(args)
1004        ]
1005
1006        # TODO: maybe put this in a class so validation is easier
1007        options = {
1008            "bar": {
1009                "parameters_scale": "x",
1010                "values_scale": "y",
1011                "error_name": "yerr",
1012                "extra_kwargs": {
1013                    "capsize": total_space * 60 / len(args) / size,
1014                    "width": space_per_object,
1015                },
1016            },
1017            "barh": {
1018                "parameters_scale": "y",
1019                "values_scale": "x",
1020                "error_name": "xerr",
1021                "extra_kwargs": {
1022                    "capsize": total_space * 60 / len(args) / size,
1023                    "height": space_per_object,
1024                },
1025            },
1026            "errorbar": {
1027                "parameters_scale": "x",
1028                "values_scale": "y",
1029                "error_name": "yerr",
1030                "extra_kwargs": {
1031                    "capsize": total_space * 120 / len(args) / size,
1032                    "ls": kwargs.pop("ls", ""),
1033                    "marker": kwargs.pop("marker", "o"),
1034                },
1035            },
1036        }
1037
1038        if capsize is not None:
1039            options[kind]["extra_kwargs"]["capsize"] = capsize  # type: ignore
1040
1041        with plt.rc_context(self.options):
1042            fig, ax = plt.subplots()
1043            for color, label, x, y, yerr in zip(
1044                colors,  # type: ignore
1045                labels,
1046                x_array if kind != "barh" else reversed(x_array),
1047                y_array,
1048                yerr_array,
1049            ):
1050                getattr(ax, kind)(
1051                    x,
1052                    y if kind != "barh" else list(reversed(y)),
1053                    color=color,
1054                    label=label,
1055                    **{
1056                        options[kind]["error_name"]: yerr
1057                        if kind != "barh"
1058                        else list(reversed(yerr))
1059                    },
1060                    **options[kind]["extra_kwargs"],
1061                    **kwargs,
1062                )
1063
1064            ax.set_yscale(scale)
1065
1066            getattr(ax, f'set_{options[kind]["parameters_scale"]}ticks')(range(size))
1067            getattr(ax, f'set_{options[kind]["parameters_scale"]}ticklabels')(
1068                latex_names if kind != "barh" else reversed(latex_names)
1069            )
1070            getattr(ax, f'set_{options[kind]["values_scale"]}label')(values_label)
1071
1072        self._figure = fig
1073        self._axes = ax
1074
1075    def plot_relative_constraints(
1076        self,
1077        args: Sequence[FisherMatrix],
1078        kind: str,
1079        marginalized: bool = True,
1080        colors: Optional[Sequence[str]] = None,
1081        labels: Optional[Sequence[str]] = None,
1082        values_label: Optional[str] = None,
1083        scale: str = "linear",
1084        space: float = 0.3,
1085        percent: bool = False,
1086        **kwargs,
1087    ):
1088        r"""
1089        Make a plot of the constraints (relative to the fiducial) of the Fisher matrices.
1090
1091        Parameters
1092        ----------
1093        args : array_like of FisherMatrix
1094            the Fisher matrices for which we want to plot the constraints
1095
1096        kind : str, {'bar', 'barh', 'errorbar'}
1097            the kind of plot we want (vertical bar, horizontal bar, errorbar)
1098
1099        marginalized : bool, optional
1100            whether the marginalized or the unmarginalized constraints should
1101            be plotted (default: True)
1102
1103        colors : array_like of str, optional
1104            the colors to use for the plotting (default: default matplotlib
1105            colors)
1106
1107        labels : array_like of str, optional
1108            the labels for the Fisher matrices (default: None)
1109
1110        values_label : str, optional
1111            the label for the values, that is, the y axis (default: ``$\sigma / \theta_\mathrm{fid}$`` if ``percent`` is false, otherwise ``$\sigma / \theta_\mathrm{fid}\ (\%)$``
1112
1113        scale : str, {'linear', 'log'}
1114            the scale used for the y axis (default: 'linear')
1115
1116        space : float, optional
1117            the space reserved between the bars (default: 0.3)
1118
1119        percent : bool, optional
1120            whether to plot in percentage units (default: false)
1121
1122        **kwargs
1123            any keyword arguments passed to
1124            <a
1125            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/_as_gen/matplotlib.pyplot.bar.html"
1126            target="_blank" rel=noreferrer noopener>``matplotlib.pyplot.bar``</a>
1127
1128        Returns
1129        -------
1130        None
1131
1132        Examples
1133        --------
1134        Define some Fisher matrices:
1135
1136        >>> fm1 = FisherMatrix(np.diag([1, 2, 3]) * 1e3, names=["a", "b", "c"], latex_names=[r'$\Omega_\mathrm{m}$', '$h$', "$n_s$"], fiducials=[0.3, 0.7, 0.96])
1137        >>> fm2 = FisherMatrix(np.diag([4, 5, 6]) * 1e3, names=["a", "b", "c"], latex_names=[r'$\Omega_\mathrm{m}$', '$h$', "$n_s$"], fiducials=[0.35, 0.67, 0.9])
1138
1139        Make a vertical bar plot:
1140
1141        >>> fig = FisherBarFigure()
1142        >>> fig.plot_relative_constraints([fm1, fm2], 'bar', labels=['Fisher 1', 'Fisher 2'])
1143        >>> _ = fig.figure.legend()
1144
1145        Save it to a file:
1146
1147        >>> fig.savefig(
1148        ... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure_plot_relative_constraints_bar.png",
1149        ... dpi=150)
1150
1151        <img width="100%" src="data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAA8sAAAK4CAYAAABDMG90AAAAOXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBNYXRwbG90bGliIHZlcnNpb24zLjcuMSwgaHR0cHM6Ly9tYXRwbG90bGliLm9yZy/bCgiHAAAACXBIWXMAABcSAAAXEgFnn9JSAABIn0lEQVR4nO3de5yXZZ0//tcwMAwzIHEUJI+YaOMyKGWZfFPT6IDHSLAMYd1dm0zXjJY89EtWO5jaqpkiVAvmqmlfLN10rVzIA6SlKCgeQoQ0CkUQRWQ4zu8Pgy9zzyADzDAIz+fjweMh133d1/W+x/nczGuu+1BSV1dXFwAAAGCDNq1dAAAAAOxohGUAAAAoEJYBAACgQFgGAACAAmEZAAAACoRlAAAAKBCWAQAAoKBtaxcAAACwXl1dXerq6lq7DHYiJSUlKSkp2eL9hGUAAKBVrV27NosXL86yZcuyatWq1i6HnVBZWVk6deqUbt26pbS0tEn7lNT5tQ0AANBK1q5dmxdffDG1tbWtXQq7gPLy8uy1115NCsxWlgEAgFazePHi1NbWprS0NLvvvnsqKyvTpo1HK9F81q1bl+XLl+fll19ObW1tFi9enJ49e252P2EZAABoNcuWLUuS7L777uncuXMrV8POqE2bNhu+t/76179m2bJlTQrLfmUDAAC0irq6ug33KFdWVrZyNezs1n+PrVq1qkkPkROWAQCAVrFxYHHpNS1t4+8xYRkAAAC2grAMAAAABcIyAAAAFAjLAAAAUCAsAwAA7EBKSkre8c9RRx2VJBk7dmxKSkoyadKkrZ5rn332SUlJSfMU3kKWL1+em266Keecc04+9KEPpX379ikpKcnYsWNbdF7vWQYAAHZo+5x/d2uX0CTzLxvSrOONHDmy0fYDDzywWefZ0c2ZMyenn376dp9XWAYAANgBbW7F+Oyzz86pp56a3r17b5+CWkmnTp3yT//0T/ngBz+YD37wg7n77rvzzW9+s8XnFZYBAADehbp3757u3bu3dhktrm/fvvnxj3+84e+/+c1vtsu87lkGAAB4F9rUPctvvvlmvvvd76a6ujqdO3dOx44d07dv35xyyin59a9/vcnxfvzjH6d///7p0KFDevXqlS9+8YtZunRpo33XrFmTcePG5fDDD89uu+2WDh06ZMCAAbn66quzZs2aBv3X3xtdV1eXa6+9NtXV1amoqMiAAQO24SvQsqwsAwAA7CTWrl2bY489No888ki6d++eo446KuXl5fnLX/6Se+65J5WVlfnEJz7RYL8xY8bkmmuuyVFHHZX9998/06ZNy4QJE/LMM8/k/vvvr/cQsBUrVmTIkCGZOnVqunbtmg9/+MMpLy/PI488kvPOOy9Tp07NL37xi7Rp03BttqamJhMnTsyRRx6Zgw46KKtWrWrRr8e2EJYBAAB2Eg888EAeeeSRfPCDH8wDDzyQ8vLyDdveeOONzJkzp9H9brrppsyaNSv9+vVLkrz66qs5/PDD8+CDD2bq1Kn52Mc+tqHv1772tUydOjXDhw/P+PHj07lz5yTJsmXLcuqpp+auu+7KhAkTUlNT02CeO+64I48//niqqqqa87BbhMuwAQAAdkCbenXU/PnzN7nPokWLkiRHHHFEvaCcJLvttlsGDhzY6H6XXnrphqCcvH0/9Pqw+8ADD2xof+WVV/KjH/0oe+65ZyZOnLghKCdvP4jrJz/5ScrKyjJu3LhG5/n617/+rgjKiZVlAACAHdKmXh3VsWPHTe4zYMCAtGnTJhMnTsz73//+fOYzn0m3bt02O9fgwYMbtB1wwAFJkr/97W8b2n73u99l9erV+eQnP5kOHTo02KdXr1553/velyeffDIrVqxo0OeEE07YbC07CmEZAABgB7S5V0c15oADDsjll1+eCy64IGeeeWZqampy8MEH55hjjsmoUaPSv3//Rvd773vf26CtU6dOSZKVK1duaFu/q 1152
1153        Make a horizontal bar plot:
1154
1155        >>> fig = FisherBarFigure()
1156        >>> fig.plot_relative_constraints([fm1, fm2], 'barh', labels=['Fisher 1', 'Fisher 2'])
1157        >>> _ = fig.figure.legend()
1158
1159        Save it to a file:
1160
1161        >>> fig.savefig(
1162        ... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure_plot_relative_constraints_barh.png",
1163        ... dpi=150)
1164

DQ1NSVJXn311U6PP2/evCSvv+BjQxkxYkTVa2DddLf+tyH60vbbb58ka/2klOqrZH/o6rE233zz1NW9/uutu9xjqZ5q98E3s+r+tmTJkjz77LNd2ofaUe3PV+6BrAsBscrq6+vz9re/PcnrT4L+3sqVK/Pcc88lSXbeeecNVsf48ePXWEOS/OlPf9rgNbDxbYj+tyH60qq5PKuGZlE7Ktkf1uVY3eUeS/VUuw++mb+dq+ge1/NU+/OVeyDrQkDsBj74wQ8mSX7+85+vtu63v/1tli1blne+853ZaqutNlgN++yzT5qbm/PII49k8eLFq61/6KGHkiSHHnroBquB6qh0/3uj47344ouZNWtWNt988+y+++7ty3/+859nxIgR7X/F/HtPPfVUkmSnnXbqUg10H5W8t4wdOzbbbbdd5syZk5kzZ3b5WN3hHkv1dIc+eMQRR+Rf/uVfOj3mqvtb3759M2rUqDetgdrSHT5fuQey1jbeVy6yJi+99FLRv3//YtSoUcXSpUs7rPvkJz9ZJCmuv/761fY788wziz333LN49NFH3/D4EyZMKJIUU6dOfcPtzjrrrCJJ8d3vfrfD8lmzZhUNDQ3F2LFjV/tyc2pfpfvf0qVLi6233rro169f8dJLL3VYt+rLes8555wOy1d92e9111232nmefPLJor6+vujVq1fxpz/9aV0vkypa23vLI488UrznPe8pvvSlL612rIsvvrhIUnzhC1/osHzevHnFkCFDis0337xYuHBhh3Xr2sfpOardBydMmFCMHTu2WLFixWrHO/bYY4skxac//en1uUS6sUr2v7+16nfnhAkT3nA790DWloDYTfzwhz8s6uvri8MPP7x45plnioULFxbnnXdeUSqViokTJ662/Zw5c4okRZLi5JNPfsNjdzUgLlmypNhjjz2K/v37Fz/84Q+LJUuWFNOnTy/Gjx9fDBgwoJg2bdp6XCHdWaX730MPPVT06dOn2GuvvYrHH3+8WLJkSXHllVcWjY2NxX777VcsX768w/b33XdfkaQYMmRIMWXKlOLFF18sli5dWtx7773FW9/61qK+vr74/ve/v6Eunw1sbe8tJ510Unv/euWVVzqsa21tLY444oiioaGh+N73vle89tprxcyZM4v999+/6NWrV3HXXXd1WsPa9nF6lmr3wb333rtIUhx++OHFtGnTiqVLlxZ//vOfiy9/+ctFkmL8+PHFvHnzNuQ/AVVUyf73t7oaEIvCPZC1IyB2I7/4xS+KD3zgA8WgQYOKPn36FLvsskvxve99r2hra1tt27a2tuLggw8uNttss06D35QpU9pvLp39rMnSpUuLSZMmFTvssEPR2NhYbL755sXHP/7xYtasWZW8VLqhSva/oiiKxx9/vPjoRz9aDB06tGhsbCze+ta3Ft/85jdXC4erjvfAAw8UJ510UvG2t72t6NOnT9GrV69i5MiRxTHHHFP8+te/rvTlspGtzb3lnnvuKQYPHlx86EMf6rT/rVy5spg8eXLxjne8o2hqaiqGDBlSHHbYYcXvfve7N6xhbfo4PU81++DLL79cXHTRRcUBBxxQbL755kVDQ0PRv3//4t3vfndx3nnnrfZUh56nkv1v6623XuPnu7PPPnuNNbgH0lWloiiKDTR6FQAAgBriJTUAAAAkERABAAAoExABAABIIiACAABQJiACAACQREAEAACgTEAEAAAgiYAIAABAmYAIAABAEgERAACAMgERAACAJAIiAAAAZQIiAAAASQREALq5+++/P6+88kq1ywCATYKACEC39s///M/VLgEANhkN1S4AANZk2rRpectb3pKhQ4d2ur6lpSX/9m//lkWLFuWFF17IUUcdlQ9/+MMbuUoA6DkERAC6rauuuirHHntsp+tWrFiRD37wg/n85z+fD3zgA3nttdcycuTI7LXXXhk+fPhGrhQAegZDTAHollpbW3PnnXfmgx/8YKfrTz311GyxxRb5wAc+kCTp169f+vbtmx/96Ecbs0wA6FE8QQSgW7r77rvz3ve+N42Njautu//++3PppZdmxowZHZYvWLAgs2bN2lglAkCPIyACsNG0tLSkKIoOy3r37p26utUHtFx11VU5+eSTOz3Ol7/85Rx00EEZM2ZM+7I//elPWbx4cdra2ipbNABsQgwxBWCDmjFjRg4//PA0Nzenqakpffr06fBz+OGHr7bPwoULM2PGjOy5556rrfvVr36Vn//856vNTXzggQeSZJ3mHy5btiyzZ8/Os88+u9b7AkBP4gkiABvMLbfcko9//OOZOHFifvjDH2bhwoU566yzsuWWW+bf//3fkyQ77rjjavvdcMMNa3wb6Q9+8IPU1dXlsssuy5QpU9qXP/LII0mSd77zne3Lvve972XOnDm54447Mnjw4IwZMyaTJ09e7ZgPPfRQzjzzzLzjHe/IFVdcsR5XDAC1TUAEYIOYMWNGjjnmmFx44YX59Kc/3b585cqVmThxYnbZZZdO5xcmyX/913/l8ssv73TdPffck1122SU/+clP2pcVRZEtt9wyAwYMyLvf/e4kyfTp0/Of//mfefjhh/Pcc89l9OjRGTFiRKfH3HfffXPSSSe1P4UEgE2VgAjABvGFL3whu+66a4dwmCQDBw5Ma2tr5s+f3+lw0GeeeSatra3ZbrvtVlvX1taWxx57LJ/97Gc7LP/1r3+dF198Mccdd1x76Jw+fXre+ta3plQq5dJLL33TejubBwkAmxq/DQGouDlz5uSuu+7KxIkTV1v3yCOPZPDgwRk2bFin+1599dX5xCc+0em6uXPnZuXKlRk7dmyH5VdddVWS5POf/3z7sra2tpRKpSTJq6++moceeijTpk1bh6sBgE2HJ4gAVNysWbPS1taWd73rXR2WF0WR66+/Psccc8wan9jdcMMNuf/++ztd16tXryTJlltu2b5s2bJlueaaa/LRj340u+yyS5Lkpz/9af77v/87zz33XM4444wceeSR+dKXvpTtttuufY7hCy+8kG984xvtcyBnzpy5XtcMAD2BgAhAxb3lLW9JqVRKfX19h+VXXXVV5s6dm7PPPrvT/R5++OHsuOOOGTRoUKfrBw0alIEDB6Z3797tyy6++OL06dMnF1xwQfuyfffdN88991zuu+++/L//9/+SJMcff3z7HMOWlpbsv//+ufLKK9tD7JlnnpmFCxeu8zUDQE9giCkAFfeWt7wlxx13XIe5fzfccEPOOeec3H333WscXnrVVVfluOOOe8NjH3rooXnssceSvP4inG9/+9u56aab1vgCmlX+9onl//zP/2Tu3LkdnnCOGjXqTa8LAHo6TxAB2CAuv/zyfOc738nnPve5JMkOO+yQ3/zmN2lubu50+xUrVuTee+/t8CSwM+edd14++9nPZtasWXnxxRczderU7LDDDmtV28yZM7PVVlut1T4AsCkQEAHYIOrr63Pqqad2efs77rgj+++/fxoa3vhX0/Dhw3PTTTetV23bbLON4aQA0AlDTAHoFroyvLRSDj300LS2tubRRx9tX/bYY49l2bJlG+X8ANBdeYIIQNW9+uqrefrpp1d76+m6+vGPf5zJkyfn+eefzwknnJBDDz00F1xwQV588cV85zvfycknn5y77747X//617Prrrumrq4uvXv3zv3335/zzjsvX/jCFypSBwDUmlJRFEW1iwBg03bxxRdnwYIF+eIXv1jtUgBgk2aIKQBVd++99+bjH/94tcsAgE2eJ4gAAAAk8QQRAACAMgERAACAJAIiAAAAZQIiAAAASQREAAAAygREAAAAkgiIAAAAlAmIAAAAJBEQAQAAKBMQAQAASCIgAgAAUCYgAgAAkERABAAAoExABAAAIImACAAAQJmACAAAQJLk/wP3NXmDDi68PAAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==">
1166        """
1167        size = len(args[0])
1168        latex_names = args[0].latex_names
1169
1170        computed_parameters = self._parse_fractional_constraints(
1171            args,
1172            marginalized=marginalized,
1173            colors=colors,
1174            labels=labels,
1175            scale=scale,
1176            space=space,
1177            values_label=values_label,
1178            percent=percent,
1179        )
1180
1181        # TODO: maybe put this in a class so validation is easier
1182        options = {
1183            "bar": {
1184                "parameters_scale": "x",
1185                "values_scale": "y",
1186                "lines_prefix": "h",
1187                "extra_kwargs": {
1188                    "width": computed_parameters.space_per_object,
1189                },
1190            },
1191            "barh": {
1192                "parameters_scale": "y",
1193                "values_scale": "x",
1194                "lines_prefix": "v",
1195                "extra_kwargs": {
1196                    "height": computed_parameters.space_per_object,
1197                },
1198            },
1199        }
1200
1201        with plt.rc_context(self.options):
1202            fig, ax = plt.subplots()
1203            for color, label, x, y in zip(
1204                computed_parameters.colors,
1205                computed_parameters.labels,
1206                computed_parameters.x_array
1207                if kind != "barh"
1208                else reversed(computed_parameters.x_array),
1209                computed_parameters.y_array,
1210            ):
1211                getattr(ax, kind)(
1212                    x,
1213                    (y * 100 if percent else y)
1214                    if kind != "barh"
1215                    else list(reversed(y * 100 if percent else y)),
1216                    color=color,
1217                    label=label,
1218                    **options[kind]["extra_kwargs"],
1219                    **kwargs,
1220                )
1221                getattr(ax, kind)(
1222                    x,
1223                    -(y * 100 if percent else y)
1224                    if kind != "barh"
1225                    else list(reversed(-y * 100 if percent else -y)),
1226                    color=color,
1227                    label=None,
1228                    **options[kind]["extra_kwargs"],
1229                    **kwargs,
1230                )
1231
1232            limits = getattr(ax, f'get_{options[kind]["parameters_scale"]}lim')()
1233
1234            getattr(ax, f'{options[kind]["lines_prefix"]}lines')(
1235                0, limits[0], limits[-1], color="black", ls="--"
1236            )
1237            getattr(ax, f'set_{options[kind]["parameters_scale"]}lim')(*limits)
1238            getattr(ax, f'set_{options[kind]["values_scale"]}scale')(
1239                computed_parameters.scale
1240            )
1241
1242            getattr(ax, f'set_{options[kind]["parameters_scale"]}ticks')(range(size))
1243            getattr(ax, f'set_{options[kind]["parameters_scale"]}ticklabels')(
1244                latex_names if kind != "barh" else reversed(latex_names)
1245            )
1246            getattr(ax, f'set_{options[kind]["values_scale"]}label')(
1247                computed_parameters.values_label
1248            )
1249
1250        self._figure = fig
1251        self._axes = ax
1252
1253    def set_label_params(
1254        self,
1255        which: str = "both",
1256        **kwargs,
1257    ):
1258        """
1259        Set both x and y label parameters.
1260
1261        .. versionadded:: 0.10.4
1262
1263        Parameters
1264        ----------
1265        which : {'both', 'x', 'y'}
1266            which axis to change (default: 'both')
1267
1268        **kwargs
1269            any keyword arguments that are also valid for <a
1270            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/text_api.html#matplotlib.text.Text"
1271            target="_blank" rel="noopener
1272            noreferrer">``matplotlib.text.Text``</a>.
1273
1274        Returns
1275        -------
1276        None
1277
1278        Raises
1279        ------
1280        EmptyFigureError
1281            if ``figure`` is not set
1282
1283        ValueError
1284            if ``which`` is not one of the allowed values
1285        """
1286        if not self.figure:
1287            raise EmptyFigureError
1288
1289        _set_label_params(self.axes, which=which, **kwargs)
1290
1291    def set_tick_params(
1292        self,
1293        which: str = "both",
1294        **kwargs,
1295    ):
1296        """
1297        Set both x and y tick parameters.
1298
1299        .. versionadded:: 0.10.4
1300
1301        Parameters
1302        ----------
1303        which : {'both', 'x', 'y'}
1304            which axis to change (default: 'both')
1305
1306        **kwargs
1307            any keyword arguments passed to the methods for handling tick
1308            parameters (such as 'fontsize', 'rotation', etc.)
1309
1310        Returns
1311        -------
1312        None
1313
1314        Raises
1315        ------
1316        EmptyFigureError
1317            if ``figure`` is not set
1318
1319        ValueError
1320            if ``which`` is not one of the allowed values
1321        """
1322        if not self.figure:
1323            raise EmptyFigureError
1324
1325        _set_tick_params(self.axes, which=which, **kwargs)
1326
1327
1328class FisherFigure1D(FisherMultipleAxesFigure):
1329    r"""
1330    Container for easy access to elements in the 1D plot.
1331
1332    Examples
1333    --------
1334    Define some Fisher matrices:
1335
1336    >>> m1 = FisherMatrix(
1337    ... [[3, -2], [-2, 5]],
1338    ... names=['a', 'b'],
1339    ... latex_names=[r'$\mathcal{A}$', r'$\mathcal{B}$'],
1340    ... )
1341    >>> m2 = FisherMatrix(
1342    ... [[4, 1], [1, 6]],
1343    ... names=['a', 'b'],
1344    ... latex_names=[r'$\mathcal{A}$', r'$\mathcal{B}$'],
1345    ... )
1346
1347    Instantiate a figure:
1348
1349    >>> fig = FisherFigure1D()
1350
1351    Draw marginalized 1D plots with the previously defined Fisher matrix:
1352
1353    >>> fig.plot(m1, label='first')
1354
1355    Add another plot with a different color and style:
1356
1357    >>> fig.plot(m2, label='second', ls=':', color='green')
1358
1359    Draw some other stuff on it:
1360
1361    >>> artist, = fig.draw('a', 'plot', [-1, 0, 1], [-1, 0, 1], color='red', label='curve')
1362    >>> # alternatively, the below will accomplish the same thing
1363    >>> # artist, = fig['a'].plot([-1, 0, 1], [-1, 0, 1], color='red')
1364    >>> # note that in this case, due to certain limitations, you need to
1365    >>> # manually add the legend using a convenience function:
1366    >>> # fig.add_artist_to_legend(artist, label='curve')
1367
1368    Add a legend:
1369
1370    >>> _ = fig.legend(ncol=3, loc='center')
1371
1372    Add a title:
1373
1374    >>> _ = fig.set_title('Example Fisher matrix 1D plotting')
1375
1376    Save it to a file:
1377
1378    >>> fig.savefig(
1379    ... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure1d_example1.png",
1380    ... dpi=150)
1381
1382    <img width="100%"
