L7hhUKhwNq1a1t8NfHJkycxcuRIVFVVITc3F9OmTRM6JIdC551t0LksLLu5TjTpzwMBFRYWMgC1/mtpJYHKykr21ltvsTZt2jAnJyfm7+/PZsyYwa5fvy50aHbh+eefr9P3hkrg1tF5Zzt0LgvHXq4THGM0JiQhhBDiaFrkSGyEEEKIo6METgghhDggSuCEEEKIA6IETgghhDggSuCEEEKIA6IETgghhDggSuCEEEKIA6IETgghhDggSuCEEEKIA6IETgghhDggSuCEEEKIA6IETgAAL7/8Mjp16iR0GISQOigsLMRrr72G6Oho/rmDBw9iypQp8PPzg1wux6BBg3D16lUBoyRNjRI4wcqVK/Hxxx+jtLRU6FAIIbW4cOECZs6ciU8++QSurq4oLS3FrFmzsG7dOsybNw8rVqxATEwMDh48iKeeekrocEkTotnIWriKigr06NEDly5dQkREBFJSUoQOiRBSi+LiYnh6emLUqFEoLCzEnDlzMG/ePH59RkYGQkND0blzZ5w9e1bASElTohJ4C/fZZ5/hP//5D0Qi+ioQ4iiuXLkCANi5cydatWpllrxNTZs2zZZhERujEngLlp6ejjFjxuDUqVPw8PBAYGAglcAJcQBr167Fww8/DLlcjuvXryM4OJhfV1FRgRkzZsDPzw/ffPMN/ThvxiRCB0CE89xzz+G1116Dk5MTZDKZ0OEQQuro3LlzAIDZs2fzyTstLQ0//vgj/vzzT7z44ouYMmWKkCESG6CfZi3Uli1bkJmZyVexOTk5QaPRCBwVIaQuTp06BQCYN28eLly4gFGjRiEyMhJvvvkmoqOj0aZNG4EjJLZAVegtUEFBAeLi4rBt2zZ06dIFABAdHY3i4mLk5eUJHB0hpDbe3t7w8fHB1atXsWvXLuTl5SEtLQ2//vorzp49C5lMhk2bNmH8+PFCh0qaECXwFmjq1Klo1aoV3nvvPf65bt26ITExESqVChzHCRgdIaQmV65cQdu2bfHiiy/i008/NVvHGMP8+fPx+eefIyQkBDdv3hQoSmILVIXewnz//fc4c+YMXn/9dWg0Gv6fu7s7NBoNioqKhA6REFKDnTt3AoDV0jXHcfjwww/h5+eHjIwMqlFr5qgRWwty+vRpPPPMM3B1dYWbmxusVb6kpqbCy8tLgOgIIXXxzz//wMfHBwMHDrS6XiaTISoqCqWlpXQuN3OUwJsxxhhfHV5YWIj7778fjz/+OGbNmmWx7ccff4z169cjISEBcXFxNo6UEFIXVVVV2L9/Px588EGIxWKr22g0GiQnJ+M///lPtduQ5oGq0Jup9PR0DBgwAFevXkVmZibGjRuH1q1b4/PPP0ePHj0s/vXr1w8AsG/fPoEjJ4RUZ9u2bSgvL8fw4cOxatUqq7VoH374IcLDw/Hhhx8KECGxJWrE1kz98ccfuO+++/jlgQMHYvv27XBzc7O6/dGjR9GvXz84OztjypQpaN++PV599VVbhUsIqYNRo0YhLy8P169fR3FxMYYPH44nnngC/v7+SEtLw8aNGxEYGIjPPvsMCoVC6HBJE6ME3kypVCrMnj0b27dvxwMPPIDly5fXeEJrtVr07NkTWVlZWLBgAZ555hkawYkQO3Lp0iXMmTMHP/zwA7Kzs/HGG2/g9OnTkEgkiImJwfDhw/Gf//wH7dq1EzpUYiOUwAkhhBAHREUsQgghxAFRAieEEEIcECVwQgghxAFRAieEEEIcECVwQgghxAFRAieEEEIcECVwQgghxAFRAieEEEIcECVwQgghxAFRAieEEEIcECVwQgghxAFRAieEEEIcECVwQgghxAFRAieEEEIcECVwQgghxAFRAieEEEIcECVwQgghxAH9P/X/w1WEVZXqAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC">
1383    """
1384
1385    def __init__(
1386        self,
1387        options: Optional[dict] = None,
1388        max_cols: Optional[int] = None,
1389        hspace: float = 0.5,
1390        wspace: float = 0.1,
1391        contour_levels: Optional[Sequence[tuple[float, float]]] = None,
1392    ):
1393        """
1394        Create an instance.
1395
1396        Parameters
1397        ----------
1398        options : dict, optional
1399            the dictionary containing the options for plotting. If the special
1400            key 'style' is present, it attempts to use that plotting style (can
1401            be one of the outputs of <a
1402            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/style_api.html#matplotlib.style.matplotlib.style.available"
1403            target="_blank" rel="noopener
1404            noreferrer">``matplotlib.style.available``</a>, or a path to a file.
1405            If using a file, does not use the default rc parameters).
1406
1407        max_cols : int, optional
1408            the maximum number of columns in the final plot
1409
1410        hspace : float, optional
1411            The amount of height reserved for space between subplots, expressed
1412            as a fraction of the average axis height.
1413
1414        wspace : float, optional
1415            The amount of width reserved for space between subplots, expressed
1416            as a fraction of the average axis width.
1417
1418        contour_levels : array_like of 2-tuples, optional
1419            the points at which the sigma level should be shaded, along with
1420            the associated opacity (default: None). If not specified, defaults
1421            to ``[(1, 0.3), (2, 0.1)]``.
1422
1423        Notes
1424        -----
1425        For the style sheet reference, please consult <a
1426        href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/gallery/style_sheets/style_sheets_reference.html"
1427        target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">the matplotlib
1428        documentation</a>.
1429        """
1430        super().__init__(
1431            options=options,
1432            wspace=wspace,
1433            hspace=hspace,
1434            contour_levels=contour_levels,
1435        )
1436        self.max_cols = max_cols
1437        self._ndim = 1
1438        self._hspace = hspace
1439        self._wspace = wspace
1440
1441    def __getitem__(
1442        self,
1443        key: str,
1444    ):
1445        """Return the axis associated to the name ``key``."""
1446        if not self.figure:
1447            raise EmptyFigureError
1448
1449        if key not in self.names:
1450            raise ParameterNotFoundError(key, self.names)
1451
1452        return self.axes.flat[np.where(self.names == key)][0]
1453
1454    def draw(
1455        self,
1456        name: str,
1457        method: str,
1458        *args,
1459        **kwargs,
1460    ):
1461        """
1462        Implement drawing of other objects on the axis.
1463
1464        Parameters
1465        ----------
1466        name : str
1467            the name (label) of the parameter where we want to draw
1468
1469        method : str
1470            the name of the method which we want to plot (such as <a
1471            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/_as_gen/matplotlib.pyplot.plot.html"
1472            target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">``plot``</a>, <a
1473            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/_as_gen/matplotlib.pyplot.scatter.html"
1474            target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">``scatter``</a>, etc.)
1475
1476        *args
1477            any positional arguments passed to the method (usually some data)
1478
1479        **kwargs
1480            any keyword arguments passed to the method (usually styling options)
1481
1482        Returns
1483        -------
1484        Artist
1485            the artist that was drawn on the axis
1486
1487        Raises
1488        ------
1489        EmptyFigureError
1490            if ``figure`` is not set
1491
1492        AttributeError
1493            if ``method`` is not a valid plotting method
1494
1495        Notes
1496        -----
1497        The parameter ``name`` has to have already been plotted.
1498        """
1499        if not hasattr(self[name], method):
1500            raise AttributeError(
1501                f"The method `{method}` is not a valid plotting method"
1502            )
1503
1504        # get the right color
1505        if "c" not in kwargs and "color" not in kwargs:
1506            kwargs["color"] = next(self.current_color)
1507            self.current_color = iter(self.current_color)
1508
1509        # hopefully the return type should be some artist, or a collection of
1510        # artists
1511        handles = getattr(self[name], method)(*args, **kwargs)
1512        if is_iterable(handles):
1513            for handle in handles:
1514                if isinstance(handle, Artist) and kwargs.get("label"):
1515                    self.labels.append(kwargs.get("label"))
1516                    self.handles.append(handle)
1517        else:
1518            if isinstance(handles, Artist) and kwargs.get("label"):
1519                self.labels.append(kwargs.get("label"))
1520                self.handles.append(handles)
1521
1522        self[name].autoscale()
1523        self[name].relim()
1524        self[name].autoscale_view()
1525
1526        return handles
1527
1528    def plot(
1529        self,
1530        fisher: FisherMatrix,
1531        *args,
1532        mark_fiducials: Union[bool, dict] = False,
1533        **kwargs,
1534    ):
1535        """
1536        Plot the 1D curves of the Fisher objects.
1537
1538        Parameters
1539        ----------
1540        fisher
1541            the Fisher object which we want to plot
1542
1543        mark_fiducials : bool or dict, optional
1544            whether or not the fiducials should be marked on the plots
1545            (default: False). If set to ``True``, uses ``linestyle='--'`` and
1546            ``color='black'`` as the default. If a dictionary, accepts the same
1547            keyword arguments as <a
1548            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/_as_gen/matplotlib.axes.Axes.axvline.html#matplotlib.axes.Axes.axvline"
1549            target="_blank" rel="noreferrer
1550            noopener">``matplotlib.axes.Axes.axvline``</a>.  If an empty
1551            dictionary, uses the default style (determined automatically).
1552
1553            .. versionadded:: 0.6.0
1554
1555        **kwargs
1556            any keyword arguments used for plotting (same as ``plot_curve_1d``)
1557
1558        Returns
1559        -------
1560        None
1561        """
1562        size = len(fisher)
1563
1564        added = False
1565
1566        # in order to preserve colors for each object, we only use the
1567        # (default) cycler when the color is not explicitly set
1568        if "c" not in kwargs and "color" not in kwargs:
1569            kwargs["color"] = next(self.current_color)
1570            self.current_color = iter(self.current_color)
1571
1572        if self.max_cols is not None and self.max_cols <= size:
1573            full = size % self.max_cols == 0
1574            layout = (
1575                size // self.max_cols if full else size // self.max_cols + 1,
1576                self.max_cols,
1577            )
1578        else:
1579            layout = 1, size
1580            full = True
1581
1582        with plt.rc_context(self.options):
1583            # general figure setup
1584            if self.figure:
1585                fig = self.figure
1586                axes = self.axes
1587            else:
1588                fig = plt.figure(
1589                    clear=True,
1590                    figsize=(2 * layout[1], 2 * layout[0]),
1591                )
1592                gs = fig.add_gridspec(
1593                    nrows=layout[0],
1594                    ncols=layout[1],
1595                    hspace=self.hspace,
1596                    wspace=self.wspace,
1597                )
1598                axes = gs.subplots()
1599                if size == 1:
1600                    axes = np.array([axes])
1601
1602            for (index, name), latex_name in zip(
1603                enumerate(fisher.names),
1604                fisher.latex_names,
1605            ):
1606                ax = axes.flat[index]
1607
1608                bg_color = ax.get_facecolor()
1609
1610                _, __, handle = plot_curve_1d(fisher, name, ax, **kwargs)
1611
1612                if not added and kwargs.get("label"):
1613                    self.handles.append(handle)
1614                    self.labels.append(kwargs["label"])
1615                    added = True
1616
1617                for i in range(len(self.contour_levels) - 1, 0, -1):
1618                    _add_shading_1d(
1619                        fisher.fiducials[index],
1620                        fisher.constraints(name, marginalized=True),
1621                        ax,
1622                        level=self.contour_levels[i][0],
1623                        alpha=self.contour_levels[i][1],
1624                        zorder=2 - i / len(self.contour_levels),
1625                        **kwargs,
1626                    )
1627
1628                    _add_shading_1d(
1629                        fisher.fiducials[index],
1630                        fisher.constraints(name, marginalized=True),
1631                        ax,
1632                        level=self.contour_levels[i - 1][0],
1633                        alpha=1.0,
1634                        color=bg_color,
1635                        zorder=2 - i / len(self.contour_levels),
1636                    )
1637
1638                _add_shading_1d(
1639                    fisher.fiducials[index],
1640                    fisher.constraints(name, marginalized=True),
1641                    ax,
1642                    level=self.contour_levels[0][0],
1643                    alpha=self.contour_levels[0][1],
1644                    zorder=1.99,
1645                    **kwargs,
1646                )
1647
1648                ax.autoscale()
1649                ax.set_xlabel(latex_name)
1650                ax.relim()
1651                ax.autoscale_view()
1652
1653                # the y axis should start at 0 since we're plotting a PDF
1654                ax.set_ylim(0, ax.get_ylim()[-1])
1655
1656                ax.set_yticks([])
1657
1658                # marking the fiducials
1659                if not mark_fiducials is False:
1660                    if mark_fiducials is True:
1661                        mark_fiducials = dict(linestyle="--", color="black")
1662
1663                    _mark_fiducial_1d(
1664                        fisher,
1665                        fisher.names[index],
1666                        ax,
1667                        **mark_fiducials,
1668                    )
1669
1670            # remove any axes which are not drawn
1671            if not full:
1672                for index in range(
1673                    size,
1674                    layout[0] * layout[1],
1675                ):
1676                    # it's simpler to turn off the axis, than completely remove
1677                    # it
1678                    axes.flat[index].axis("off")
1679
1680        self._figure = fig
1681        self._axes = axes
1682        self._names = fisher.names
1683
1684    def legend(
1685        self,
1686        *args: Artist,
1687        overwrite: bool = False,
1688        loc: Union[str, tuple[float, float]] = "lower center",
1689        bbox_to_anchor: Any = (0.5, 1),
1690        **kwargs,
1691    ):
1692        """
1693        Create a legend on the figure.
1694
1695        Parameters
1696        ----------
1697        *args
1698            any positional arguments for the legend
1699
1700        overwrite : bool, optional
1701            whether to overwrite any "nice" options set by ``fitk`` (default:
1702            False)
1703
1704        loc : str or tuple of floats, optional
1705            which corner of the legend to use as the positioning anchor
1706            (default: 'lower center')
1707
1708        bbox_to_anchor : Any, optional
1709            the location of where to place the legend (default: ``[0.5, 1]``)
1710
1711        **kwargs
1712            any other keyword arguments for the legend
1713
1714        Returns
1715        -------
1716        Artist
1717            the legend that was drawn on the figure
1718
1719        Raises
1720        ------
1721        EmptyFigureError
1722            if ``figure`` is not set
1723        """
1724        if not self.figure:
1725            raise EmptyFigureError
1726
1727        with plt.rc_context(self.options):
1728            ax = self.axes.flat[0]
1729            if not overwrite:
1730                if ax.get_legend():
1731                    ax.get_legend().remove()
1732
1733                return ax.legend(
1734                    self.handles,
1735                    self.labels,
1736                    loc=loc,
1737                    bbox_to_anchor=bbox_to_anchor,
1738                    bbox_transform=self.figure.transFigure,
1739                    **kwargs,
1740                )
1741
1742            return ax.legend(
1743                *args,
1744                loc=loc,
1745                bbox_to_anchor=bbox_to_anchor,
1746                **kwargs,
1747            )
1748
1749    def set_title(
1750        self,
1751        *args,
1752        x: float = 0.5,
1753        y: float = 1.2,
1754        **kwargs,
1755    ):
1756        """
1757        Draw a title on the figure.
1758
1759        Parameters
1760        ----------
1761        *args
1762            any positional arguments to ``figure.suptitle``
1763
1764        x : float, optional
1765            the x position of the title (default: ``0.5``)
1766
1767        y : float, optional
1768            the y position of the title (default: ``1.2``)
1769
1770        **kwargs
1771            any keyword arguments to ``figure.suptitle``
1772
1773        Returns
1774        -------
1775        Artist
1776            the title that was drawn on the figure
1777
1778        Raises
1779        ------
1780        EmptyFigureError
1781            if ``figure`` is not set
1782        """
1783        if not self.figure:
1784            raise EmptyFigureError
1785
1786        with plt.rc_context(self.options):
1787            return self.figure.suptitle(*args, x=x, y=y, **kwargs)
1788
1789
1790class FisherFigure2D(FisherMultipleAxesFigure):
1791    r"""
1792    Container for easy access to elements in the 2D plot.
1793
1794    Examples
1795    --------
1796    Define some Fisher matrices:
1797
1798    >>> m1 = FisherMatrix(
1799    ... [[3, -2], [-2, 5]],
1800    ... names=['a', 'b'],
1801    ... latex_names=[r'$\mathcal{A}$', r'$\mathcal{B}$'],
1802    ... )
1803    >>> m2 = FisherMatrix(
1804    ... [[4, 1], [1, 6]],
1805    ... names=['a', 'b'],
1806    ... latex_names=[r'$\mathcal{A}$', r'$\mathcal{B}$'],
1807    ... )
1808
1809    Instantiate a figure:
1810
1811    >>> fig = FisherFigure2D(show_1d_curves=True)
1812
1813    Draw a "triangle plot" with the previously defined Fisher matrix:
1814
1815    >>> fig.plot(m1, label='first')
1816
1817    Add a plot with a different color and style:
1818
1819    >>> fig.plot(m2, label='second', ls=':', color='green')
1820
1821    Draw some other stuff on it:
1822
1823    >>> artist, = fig.draw('a', 'b', 'plot', [-1, 0, 1], [-1, 0, 1], color='red', label='curve')
1824    >>> # alternatively, the below will accomplish the same thing
1825    >>> # artist, = fig['a', 'b'].plot([-1, 0, 1], [-1, 0, 1], color='red')
1826    >>> # note that in this case, due to certain limitations, you need to
1827    >>> # manually add the legend using a convenience function:
1828    >>> # fig.add_artist_to_legend(artist, label='curve')
1829
1830    Add a legend:
1831
1832    >>> _ = fig.legend()
1833
1834    Add a title:
1835
1836    >>> _ = fig.set_title('Example Fisher matrix 2D plotting')
1837
1838    Save it to a file:
1839
1840    >>> fig.savefig(
1841    ... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure2d_example1.png",
1842    ... dpi=150)
1843
1844    <img width="100%" 1845    """
1846
1847    def __init__(
1848        self,
1849        options: Optional[dict] = None,
1850        hspace: float = 0,
1851        wspace: float = 0,
1852        show_1d_curves: bool = False,
1853        show_joint_dist: bool = False,
1854        contour_levels: Optional[Sequence[tuple[float, float]]] = None,
1855        contour_levels_1d: Optional[Sequence[tuple[float, float]]] = None,
1856        contour_levels_2d: Optional[Sequence[tuple[float, float]]] = None,
1857    ):
1858        """
1859        Create an instance.
1860
1861        Parameters
1862        ----------
1863        options : dict, optional
1864            the dictionary containing the options for plotting. If the special
1865            key 'style' is present, it attempts to use that plotting style (can
1866            be one of the outputs of <a
1867            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/style_api.html#matplotlib.style.matplotlib.style.available"
1868            target="_blank" rel="noopener
1869            noreferrer">``matplotlib.style.available``</a>, or a path to a file.
1870            If using a file, does not use the default rc parameters).
1871
1872        hspace : float, optional
1873            The amount of height reserved for space between subplots, expressed
1874            as a fraction of the average axis height.
1875
1876        wspace : float, optional
1877            The amount of width reserved for space between subplots, expressed
1878            as a fraction of the average axis width.
1879
1880        show_1d_curves : bool, optional
1881            whether the 1D marginalized curves should be plotted (default:
1882            False)
1883
1884        show_joint_dist : bool, optional
1885            whether to plot the isocontours of the joint distribution (default:
1886            False)
1887
1888            .. note::
1889
1890                This argument specifies whether we wish to plot the p-value of
1891                the *joint* distribution, or the p-value of the probability of
1892                a single parameter lying within the bounds projected onto a
1893                parameter axis. For more details, see <a
1894                href="https://arxiv.org/abs/0906.0664" target="_blank"
1895                rel="noopener noreferrer">arXiv:0906.0664</a>, section 2.
1896
1897        contour_levels : array_like of 2-tuples, optional
1898            the points at which the sigma level should be shaded, along with
1899            the associated opacity (default: None). If not specified, defaults
1900            to ``[(1, 0.3), (2, 0.1)]``.
1901
1902        contour_levels_1d : array_like of 2-tuples, optional
1903            the points at which the sigma level should be shaded (on the 1D
1904            plots), along with the associated opacity (default: None). If not
1905            specified, defaults to ``[(1, 0.3), (2, 0.1)]``.
1906
1907            .. versionadded:: 0.6.1
1908
1909        contour_levels_2d : array_like of 2-tuples, optional
1910            the points at which the sigma level should be shaded (on the 2D
1911            plots), along with the associated opacity (default: None). If not
1912            specified, defaults to ``[(1, 0.3), (2, 0.1)]``.
1913
1914            .. versionadded:: 0.6.1
1915
1916        Notes
1917        -----
1918        For the style sheet reference, please consult <a
1919        href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/gallery/style_sheets/style_sheets_reference.html"
1920        target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">the matplotlib
1921        documentation</a>.
1922        """
1923        super().__init__(
1924            options=options,
1925            wspace=wspace,
1926            hspace=hspace,
1927            contour_levels=contour_levels,
1928        )
1929        self.show_1d_curves = show_1d_curves
1930        self.show_joint_dist = show_joint_dist
1931        self._ndim = 2
1932
1933        if contour_levels_1d is None:
1934            self.contour_levels_1d = self.contour_levels
1935        else:
1936            self.contour_levels_1d = _parse_contour_levels(contour_levels_1d)
1937
1938        if contour_levels_2d is None:
1939            self.contour_levels_2d = self.contour_levels
1940        else:
1941            self.contour_levels_2d = _parse_contour_levels(contour_levels_2d)
1942
1943    def __getitem__(
1944        self,
1945        key: tuple[str, str],
1946    ):
1947        if not self.figure:
1948            raise EmptyFigureError
1949
1950        if not isinstance(key, tuple):
1951            raise TypeError(
1952                f"Incompatible type for element access: expected `tuple`, got `{type(key)}`"
1953            )
1954
1955        name1, name2 = key
1956
1957        if name1 not in self.names:
1958            raise ParameterNotFoundError(name1, self.names)
1959        if name2 not in self.names:
1960            raise ParameterNotFoundError(name2, self.names)
1961
1962        # edge case
1963        if not self.show_1d_curves and name1 == name2:
1964            return None
1965
1966        index1 = np.where(self.names == name1)
1967        index2 = np.where(self.names == name2)
1968
1969        if index1 < index2:
1970            index1, index2 = index2, index1
1971
1972        return self.axes[index1, index2][0, 0]
1973
1974    def legend(
1975        self,
1976        *args: Artist,
1977        overwrite: bool = False,
1978        loc: Union[str, tuple[float, float]] = "upper right",
1979        bbox_to_anchor: Optional[Any] = None,
1980        **kwargs,
1981    ):
1982        """
1983        Create a legend on the figure.
1984
1985        Parameters
1986        ----------
1987        *args
1988            any positional arguments for the legend
1989
1990        overwrite : bool, optional
1991            whether to overwrite any "nice" options set by ``fitk`` (default:
1992            False)
1993
1994        loc : str or tuple of floats, optional
1995            which corner of the legend to use as the positioning anchor
1996            (default: 'upper right')
1997
1998        bbox_to_anchor : Any, optional
1999            the location of where to place the legend (default: None, picked by
2000            ``fitk`` based on information about the plot)
2001
2002        **kwargs
2003            any other keyword arguments for the legend
2004
2005        Returns
2006        -------
2007        Artist
2008            the legend that was drawn on the figure
2009
2010        Raises
2011        ------
2012        EmptyFigureError
2013            if ``figure`` is not set
2014        """
2015        if not self.figure:
2016            raise EmptyFigureError
2017
2018        with plt.rc_context(self.options):
2019            # this will always exist since we can't plot < 2 parameters
2020            ax = self[self.names[0], self.names[1]]
2021            if not overwrite:
2022                if self.show_1d_curves:
2023                    i, j = 0, -1
2024                else:
2025                    i, j = 1, -2
2026
2027                bbox_to_anchor = (
2028                    self.axes[0, j].get_position().xmax,
2029                    self.axes[i, 0].get_position().ymax,
2030                )
2031
2032                if ax.get_legend():
2033                    ax.get_legend().remove()
2034
2035                return ax.legend(
2036                    self.handles,
2037                    self.labels,
2038                    loc=loc,
2039                    bbox_to_anchor=bbox_to_anchor,
2040                    bbox_transform=self.figure.transFigure,
2041                    **kwargs,
2042                )
2043
2044            return ax.legend(
2045                *args,
2046                loc=loc,
2047                bbox_to_anchor=bbox_to_anchor,
2048                **kwargs,
2049            )
2050
2051    def set_title(
2052        self,
2053        *args,
2054        overwrite: bool = False,
2055        xscale: float = 0.5,
2056        yscale: float = 1.08,
2057        **kwargs,
2058    ):
2059        """
2060        Draw a title on the figure.
2061
2062        Parameters
2063        ----------
2064        *args
2065            any positional arguments to ``figure.suptitle``
2066
2067        xscale : float, optional
2068            the x position of the title (default: ``0.5``)
2069
2070        yscale : float, optional
2071            the y position of the title (default: ``1.08``)
2072
2073        **kwargs
2074            any keyword arguments to ``figure.suptitle``
2075
2076        Returns
2077        -------
2078        Artist
2079            the title that was drawn on the figure
2080
2081        Raises
2082        ------
2083        EmptyFigureError
2084            if ``figure`` is not set
2085        """
2086        if not self.figure:
2087            raise EmptyFigureError
2088
2089        with plt.rc_context(self.options):
2090            if not overwrite:
2091                if self.show_1d_curves:
2092                    i, j = 0, -1
2093                else:
2094                    i, j = 1, -2
2095
2096                x, y = (
2097                    self.axes[0, j].get_position().xmax,
2098                    self.axes[i, 0].get_position().ymax,
2099                )
2100
2101                return self.figure.suptitle(
2102                    *args,
2103                    x=x * xscale,
2104                    y=y * yscale,
2105                    **kwargs,
2106                )
2107
2108            return self.figure.suptitle(*args, **kwargs)
2109
2110    def draw(
2111        self,
2112        name1: str,
2113        name2: str,
2114        method: str,
2115        *args,
2116        **kwargs,
2117    ):
2118        """
2119        Implement drawing of other objects on the axis.
2120
2121        Parameters
2122        ----------
2123        name1 : str
2124            the name (label) of the first parameter where we want to draw
2125
2126        name2 : str
2127            the name (label) of the second parameter where we want to draw
2128
2129        method : str
2130            the name of the method which we want to plot (such as ``plot``,
2131            ``scatter``, etc.)
2132
2133        *args
2134            any positional arguments passed to the method (usually some data)
2135
2136        **kwargs
2137            any keyword arguments passed to the method (usually styling options)
2138
2139        Returns
2140        -------
2141        Artist
2142            the artist that was drawn on the axis
2143
2144        Raises
2145        ------
2146        EmptyFigureError
2147            if ``figure`` is not set
2148
2149        AttributeError
2150            if ``method`` is not a valid plotting method
2151
2152        Notes
2153        -----
2154        The parameters ``name1`` and ``name2`` have to have already been plotted.
2155        """
2156        if not hasattr(self[name1, name2], method):
2157            raise AttributeError(
2158                f"The method `{method}` is not a valid plotting method"
2159            )
2160
2161        # get the right color
2162        if "c" not in kwargs and "color" not in kwargs:
2163            kwargs["color"] = next(self.current_color)
2164            self.current_color = iter(self.current_color)
2165
2166        with plt.rc_context(self.options):
2167            # hopefully the return type should be some artist, or a collection
2168            # of artists
2169            handles = getattr(self[name1, name2], method)(*args, **kwargs)
2170            if is_iterable(handles):
2171                for handle in handles:
2172                    if isinstance(handle, Artist) and kwargs.get("label"):
2173                        self.labels.append(kwargs["label"])
2174                        self.handles.append(handle)
2175            else:
2176                if isinstance(handles, Artist) and kwargs.get("label"):
2177                    self.labels.append(kwargs["label"])
2178                    self.handles.append(handles)
2179
2180        self[name1, name2].autoscale()
2181        self[name1, name2].relim()
2182        self[name1, name2].autoscale_view()
2183
2184        return handles
2185
2186    def plot(
2187        self,
2188        fisher: FisherMatrix,
2189        *args,
2190        mark_fiducials: Union[bool, dict] = False,
2191        **kwargs,
2192    ):
2193        r"""
2194        Plot the 2D contours (and optionally 1D curves) of the Fisher objects.
2195
2196        Parameters
2197        ----------
2198        fisher : FisherMatrix
2199            the Fisher object which we want to plot
2200
2201        mark_fiducials : bool or dict, optional
2202            whether or not the fiducials should be marked on the plots
2203            (default: False). If set to ``True``, uses ``linestyle='--'`` and
2204            ``color='black'`` as the default. If a dictionary, accepts the same
2205            keyword arguments as <a
2206            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/_as_gen/matplotlib.axes.Axes.axvline.html#matplotlib.axes.Axes.axvline"
2207            target="_blank" rel="noreferrer
2208            noopener">``matplotlib.axes.Axes.axvline``</a>.  If an empty
2209            dictionary, uses the default style (determined automatically).
2210
2211            .. versionadded:: 0.6.0
2212
2213        **kwargs
2214            any keyword arguments used for plotting (same as ``plot_curve_2d``)
2215
2216        Returns
2217        -------
2218        None
2219
2220        Examples
2221        --------
2222        Define a Fisher matrix:
2223
2224        >>> m = FisherMatrix([[3, -2], [-2, 5]], names=['a', 'b'], latex_names=[r'$\mathcal{A}$', r'$\mathcal{B}$'])
2225
2226        Initiate a figure:
2227
2228        >>> fig = FisherFigure2D(show_1d_curves=True)
2229
2230        Draw a "triangle plot" with the previously defined Fisher matrix:
2231
2232        >>> fig.plot(m)
2233
2234        Save it to a file:
2235
2236        >>> fig.savefig(
2237        ... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure2d_plot_example.png",
2238        ... dpi=150)
2239

0Sj809/+ctfBI1GI1RVVZ1x28MPPywAEC6//HIJRuY9fA1Jg69P/+Mvr38uw5HHzZkzB7fddtsZ1yckJGDBggUAgE2bNvl6WJLr6enB888/D41Gg1WrVrndlpubi2XLlqG4uBgbNmyQaIT+KSkpCTfddBPS09PPuG358uUAgC1btsBms/l6aF7D15Dv8fXpn/zl9c+wRB63bds2nHfeeYPeFhUV5ePR+I+tW7fCaDQiPz8f4eHhZ9y+ePFiAGBNymluvfVWrFu3btDbnP+eFAoFhADaE5yvId/j69M/+cvrn2GJfOrYsWMAgAsvvFDagUigsLAQAJCdnT3o7Tk5OW73o+E5/z0tXrwYarVa4tH4RjC/hryJr0/58eXrn2GJfObgwYM4fPgwLrzwQixZskTq4fhcfX09ACAmJmbQ2w0Gg9v9aHivvvoqFAoFfve730k9FJ8I9teQN/H1KT++fP0Hx1cxGpXrrrsOR48eHdXPvPrqq5g/f/5Zb7fb7bj33nthMBjwyiuvjHeIstTT0wMA0Gg0g96u1Wrd7kdD27hxI9avX48HHnjA72ZZ+BqSH74+5cXXr3+GJTpDeXk5jh8/PqqfGe4N5IEHHkBBQQE2b96MjIyM8QxPtvR6PQCgr69v0NvNZrPb/ejsTp48iVWrVmHFihV48sknpR7OGfgakh++PuVDitc/wxKdoaCgwKOP9/vf/x7//ve/8cknn5y1aDUYJCUlAQBaW1sHvb2trQ0AkJyc7LMxyVFlZSUuueQSLF68GG+88QZUKpXUQzoDX0Pyw9enPEj1+mdYIq969NFH8c9//hObN292nfIcrGbNmgUAZ+0EXFZWBgCYOXOmr4YkOyUlJbj44ouxZMkSrFu3zi+DkqfxNeQbfH36Pylf/yzwJq/52c9+hhdffBFbt251e5PfsWMH3n77bQlHJo2lS5ciLCwMhw4dgtFoPOP27du3AxjoHULujhw5giVLluDSSy/FK6+84vZG+dRTT6G6ulrC0XkHX0O+w9enf5P89e/1tpcUdOx2u3D33XcLiYmJQlFR0Rm3r1mzRrjgggt8PzA/4Ow4+/zzz7tdX1paKqjVanYIPouCggIhPj5euPfeewW73X7G7QCEL7/80vcD8xK+hqTB16d/8ofXP5fhyKMEQcDtt9/uOrPnj3/84xn3OXz4MOLi4iQYnfTWrFmDbdu24ZFHHkFiYiKuvPJKV7GiXq/H66+/HhRLS6Oxb98+XHrppTCbzWhqasJNN90k9ZC8iq8h6fD16X/85vXv1ShGQaetrU0AMOx/wfytuLe3V3jssceEiRMnClqtVkhISBBuueUWobS0VOqh+aX7779/RP+mAmVmia8hafH16V/85fWvEIQA2iOAiIiIyMNY4E1EREQ0BIYlIiIioiEwLBERERENgWGJiIiIaAgMS0RERERDYFgiIiIiGgLDEhEREdEQGJaIiIiIhsCwRERERDQEhiUiIiKiITAsEREREQ2BYYnIjzz44IOYMWOG1MMgClptbW149NFHkZub67pu27ZtWLlyJeLj46HT6XDBBRfg5MmTEo6SfI1hichPvPTSS3jqqafQ1dUl9VCIglJxcTFuu+02PP300wgPD0dXVxdWrVqFt956C6tXr8batWsxadIkbNu2DT/+8Y+lHi75kEIQBEHqQRAFu56eHsybNw9Hjx5FZmYmKioqpB4SUVDq6OhAdHQ0LrvsMrS1teGOO+7A6tWrXbfX1tYiLS0NM2fORGFhoYQjJV/izBKRH/jrX/+KO++8E0olX5JEUjpx4gQAYNOmTcjJyXELSmI33XSTL4dFEuPMEpHEqqurccUVV2D//v2IiopCUlISZ5aIJPL666/j1ltvhU6nQ2lpKVJSUly39fT04JZbbkF8fDxeeOEFfrkJImqpB0AU7O677z48+uij0Gq10Gg0Ug+HKKgdOnQIAHD77be7glJVVRVeffVVfPrpp/j5z3+OlStXSjlEkgBjMZGEPvroI9TV1bmm9LVaLaxWq8SjIgpe+/fvBwCsXr0axcXFuOyyy5CVlYXf/va3yM3NxcSJEyUeIUmBy3BEEmltbcWsWbPw8ccfIz8/HwCQm5uLjo4ONDc3Szw6ouAUExOD2NhYnDx5Eps3b0ZzczOqqqrw5ptvorCwEBqNBu+99x6uvvpqqYdKPsSwRCSR733ve8jJycHjjz/uum7OnDkoKipCX18fFAqFhKMjCj4nTpzA5MmT8fOf/xzPPPOM222CIOAXv/gFnn32WaSmpqKmpkaiUZIUuAxHJIF//etfOHjwIH7961/DarW6/ouMjITVakV7e7vUQyQKOps2bQKAQWeNFAoFnnzyScTHx6O2tpazv0GGBd5EPnbgwAHce++9CA8PR0REBAab3K2srITBYJBgdETBa+PGjYiNjcWSJUsGvV2j0SA7OxtdXV18fQYZhiUiLxMEwbWk1tbWhhUrVuBHP/oRVq1adcZ9n3rqKbz99tsoKCjArFmzfDxSouBlNpvx1Vdf4cYbb4RKpRr0PlarFeXl5bjzzjvPeh8KTFyGI/Ki6upqLF68GCdPnkRdXR2uuuoqTJgwAc8++yzmzZt3xn/nnXceAODLL7+UeOREweXjjz+G0WjEsmXL8PLLLw864/vkk08iIyMDTz75pAQjJCmxwJvIiz788ENcd911ruMlS5bgk08+QURExKD337lzJ8477zyEhoZi5cqVmDp1Kh5++GFfDZcoaF122WVobm5GaWkpOjo6sGzZMtx9991ISEhAVVUV3n33XSQlJeGvf/0r9Hq91MMlH2NYIvKivr4+3H777fjkk09www034LnnnhvyjdZms+Gcc85BfX09HnnkEdx7773sEkzkZUePHsUdd9yBf//732hoaMBvfvMbHDhwAGq1GpMmTcKyZctw5513YsqUKVIPlSTCsEREREQ0BH5lJSIiIhoCwxIRERHREBiWiIiIiIbAsEREREQ0BIYlIiIioiEwLBERERENgWGJiIiIaAgMS0RERERDYFgiIiIiGgLDEhEREdEQGJaIiIiIhsCwRERERDQEhiUiIiKiITAsEREREQ2BYYmIiIhoCAxLRERERENgWCIiIiIawv8HEInV5ooXfmAAAAAASUVORK5CYII=">
2241        """
2242        size = len(fisher)
2243
2244        if size < 2:
2245            raise ValueError("Unable to make a 2D plot with < 2 parameters")
2246
2247        if self.names is not None:
2248            # make sure they have the same names; if not, raise an error
2249            if set(self.names) != set(fisher.names):
2250                raise ValueError(
2251                    f"The Fisher object names ({fisher.names}) "
2252                    f"do not match those on the figure ({self.names})"
2253                )
2254
2255            # otherwise, we reshuffle them
2256            fisher = fisher.sort(key=self.names)
2257
2258        # in order to preserve colors for each object, we only use the
2259        # (default) cycler when the color is not explicitly set
2260        if "c" not in kwargs and "color" not in kwargs:
2261            kwargs["color"] = next(self.current_color)
2262            self.current_color = iter(self.current_color)
2263
2264        with plt.rc_context(self.options):
2265            # general figure setup
2266            if self.figure:
2267                fig = self.figure
2268                ax = self.axes
2269            else:
2270                fig = plt.figure(
2271                    figsize=(2 * size, 2 * size),
2272                    clear=True,
2273                )
2274                ax = fig.add_gridspec(
2275                    nrows=size,
2276                    ncols=size,
2277                    hspace=self.hspace,
2278                    wspace=self.wspace,
2279                ).subplots(
2280                    sharex="col",
2281                    sharey=False,
2282                )
2283
2284            # set automatic limits
2285            _set_limits_2d(ax=ax, size=size)
2286
2287            # flag for whether the current artist has already been added to the
2288            # legend handle
2289            added = False
2290            # loop over the parameters
2291            for i, j in product(range(len(fisher.names)), repeat=2):
2292                namey, latex_namey, namex, latex_namex = (
2293                    fisher.names[i],
2294                    fisher.latex_names[i],
2295                    fisher.names[j],
2296                    fisher.latex_names[j],
2297                )
2298
2299                # the color of the background of that axis
2300                bg_color = ax[i, j].get_facecolor()
2301
2302                # labels for 2D contours (increasing y)
2303                if i > 0 and j == 0:
2304                    ax[i, j].set_ylabel(latex_namey)
2305
2306                # labels for 2D contours (increasing x)
2307                if i == size - 1:
2308                    ax[i, j].set_xlabel(latex_namex)
2309
2310                # removing any unnecessary axes from the gridspec
2311                if i < j and self.figure is None:
2312                    # calling `remove()` is better than `axis("off")` because
2313                    # then we obtain the proper bounding box
2314                    try:
2315                        ax[i, j].remove()
2316                    except KeyError:
2317                        pass
2318
2319                # plotting the 2D contours
2320                elif i > j:
2321                    # we plot them from the largest to the smallest (excluding the top-most one)
2322                    for index in range(len(self.contour_levels_2d) - 1, 0, -1):
2323                        # the 2-sigma
2324                        plot_curve_2d(
2325                            fisher,
2326                            namex,
2327                            namey,
2328                            ax=ax[i, j],
2329                            scaling_factor=self.contour_levels_2d[index][0]
2330                            if not self.show_joint_dist
2331                            else np.sqrt(_get_chisq(self.contour_levels_2d[index][0])),
2332                            fill=False,
2333                            zorder=2,
2334                            **kwargs,
2335                        )
2336
2337                        # same thing, but shaded
2338                        plot_curve_2d(
2339                            fisher,
2340                            namex,
2341                            namey,
2342                            ax=ax[i, j],
2343                            scaling_factor=self.contour_levels_2d[index][0]
2344                            if not self.show_joint_dist
2345                            else np.sqrt(_get_chisq(self.contour_levels_2d[index][0])),
2346                            fill=True,
2347                            alpha=self.contour_levels_2d[index][1],
2348                            ec=None,
2349                            zorder=2 - i / len(self.contour_levels_2d),
2350                            **kwargs,
2351                        )
2352
2353                        # plotting the _smaller_ contour as an opaque "hole" so
2354                        # that the opacities are displayed properly
2355                        plot_curve_2d(
2356                            fisher,
2357                            namex,
2358                            namey,
2359                            ax=ax[i, j],
2360                            scaling_factor=self.contour_levels_2d[index - 1][0]
2361                            if not self.show_joint_dist
2362                            else np.sqrt(
2363                                _get_chisq(self.contour_levels_2d[index - 1][0])
2364                            ),
2365                            fill=True,
2366                            alpha=1.0,
2367                            ec=None,
2368                            fc=bg_color,
2369                            zorder=2 - i / len(self.contour_levels_2d),
2370                            **kwargs,
2371                        )
2372
2373                    # plot innermost contour (usually 1-sigma)
2374                    # NOTE this is the "68% of the probability of a
2375                    # single parameter lying within the bounds projected
2376                    # onto a parameter axis"
2377                    _, __, handle = plot_curve_2d(
2378                        fisher,
2379                        namex,
2380                        namey,
2381                        ax=ax[i, j],
2382                        scaling_factor=self.contour_levels_2d[0][0]
2383                        if not self.show_joint_dist
2384                        else np.sqrt(_get_chisq(self.contour_levels_2d[0][0])),
2385                        zorder=2,
2386                        fill=False,
2387                        **kwargs,
2388                    )
2389
2390                    if not added and kwargs.get("label"):
2391                        self.handles.append(handle)
2392                        self.labels.append(kwargs["label"])
2393                        added = True
2394
2395                    # same thing, but shaded
2396                    plot_curve_2d(
2397                        fisher,
2398                        namex,
2399                        namey,
2400                        ax=ax[i, j],
2401                        scaling_factor=self.contour_levels_2d[0][0]
2402                        if not self.show_joint_dist
2403                        else np.sqrt(_get_chisq(self.contour_levels_2d[0][0])),
2404                        fill=True,
2405                        alpha=self.contour_levels_2d[0][1],
2406                        ec=None,
2407                        zorder=1.99,
2408                        **kwargs,
2409                    )
2410
2411                if i == j:
2412                    # plotting the 1D Gaussians
2413                    if self.show_1d_curves is True:
2414                        plot_curve_1d(
2415                            fisher,
2416                            namex,
2417                            ax=ax[i, i],
2418                            **kwargs,
2419                        )
2420
2421                        for index in range(len(self.contour_levels_1d) - 1, 0, -1):
2422                            _add_shading_1d(
2423                                fisher.fiducials[i],
2424                                fisher.constraints(
2425                                    name=namex,
2426                                    marginalized=True,
2427                                )[0],
2428                                level=self.contour_levels_1d[index][0],
2429                                ax=ax[i, i],
2430                                alpha=self.contour_levels_1d[index][1],
2431                                zorder=2 - index / len(self.contour_levels_1d),
2432                                **kwargs,
2433                            )
2434
2435                            # shade the "hole" part of the previous contour
2436                            _add_shading_1d(
2437                                fisher.fiducials[i],
2438                                fisher.constraints(
2439                                    name=namex,
2440                                    marginalized=True,
2441                                )[0],
2442                                level=self.contour_levels_1d[index - 1][0],
2443                                ax=ax[i, i],
2444                                alpha=1.0,
2445                                zorder=2 - index / len(self.contour_levels_1d),
2446                                color=bg_color,
2447                            )
2448
2449                        # only the innermost contour does not have any "hole"
2450                        _add_shading_1d(
2451                            fisher.fiducials[i],
2452                            fisher.constraints(
2453                                name=namex,
2454                                marginalized=True,
2455                            )[0],
2456                            level=self.contour_levels_1d[0][0],
2457                            ax=ax[i, i],
2458                            alpha=self.contour_levels_1d[0][1],
2459                            zorder=1.99,
2460                            **kwargs,
2461                        )
2462
2463                    else:
2464                        if self.figure is None:
2465                            try:
2466                                ax[i, i].remove()
2467                            except KeyError:
2468                                pass
2469
2470            # set automatic limits
2471            _rescale_limits_2d(ax=ax, size=size)
2472
2473            # marking the fiducials
2474            _mark_fiducials(
2475                fisher=fisher,
2476                ax=ax,
2477                size=size,
2478                mark_fiducials=mark_fiducials,
2479            )
2480
2481        self._figure = fig
2482        self._axes = ax
2483        self._names = fisher.names
2484
2485
2486def _get_chisq(
2487    sigma: float = 1,
2488    df: int = 2,
2489):
2490    r"""
2491    Return :math:`\Delta \chi^2`.
2492
2493    To obtain the scaling coefficient :math:`\alpha`, just take the square root of
2494    the output.
2495
2496    Parameters
2497    ----------
2498    sigma : float = 1
2499        the error on the parameter
2500
2501    df : int = 2
2502        the number of degrees of freedom
2503
2504    Returns
2505    -------
2506    float
2507    """
2508    return chi2.ppf(norm.cdf(sigma) - norm.cdf(-sigma), df=df)
2509
2510
2511def _add_plot_1d(
2512    fiducial: float,
2513    sigma: float,
2514    ax: Optional[Axes] = None,
2515    **kwargs,
2516) -> tuple[Figure, Axes, Artist]:
2517    """
2518    Add a 1D Gaussian to axis.
2519
2520    Add a 1D Gaussian with marginalized constraints ``sigma`` close to fiducial
2521    value ``fiducial`` to axis ``ax``.
2522    """
2523    if ax is None:
2524        _, ax = plt.subplots()
2525
2526    x = np.linspace(
2527        fiducial - 4 * sigma,
2528        fiducial + 4 * sigma,
2529        100,
2530    )
2531
2532    (handle,) = ax.plot(
2533        x,
2534        [norm.pdf(_, loc=fiducial, scale=sigma) for _ in x],
2535        **kwargs,
2536    )
2537
2538    return (ax.get_figure(), ax, handle)
2539
2540
2541def _add_shading_1d(
2542    fiducial: float,
2543    sigma: float,
2544    ax: Optional[Axes] = None,
2545    level: float = 1,
2546    **kwargs,
2547) -> tuple[Figure, Axes]:
2548    """Add shading to a 1D axes."""
2549    if ax is None:
2550        _, ax = plt.subplots()
2551
2552    # keyword args which have no effect on the plotting
2553    unused_kwargs = [
2554        "lw",
2555        "linewidth",
2556        "ec",
2557        "edgecolor",
2558        "fc",
2559        "facecolor",
2560    ]
2561    for kwarg in unused_kwargs:
2562        kwargs.pop(kwarg, None)
2563
2564    # the kwarg `color` supersedes `facecolor`, hence we need to remove it from
2565    # the passed kwargs, and call `fill_between` with `facecolor=color`
2566    color = kwargs.pop("color", None)
2567
2568    x = np.ndarray.flatten(
2569        np.linspace(
2570            fiducial - level * sigma,
2571            fiducial + level * sigma,
2572            100,
2573        )
2574    )
2575
2576    ax.fill_between(
2577        x,
2578        np.ndarray.flatten(
2579            np.array([norm.pdf(_, loc=fiducial, scale=sigma) for _ in x])
2580        ),
2581        edgecolor=None,
2582        facecolor=color,
2583        **kwargs,
2584    )
2585
2586    return (ax.get_figure(), ax)
2587
2588
2589def plot_curve_1d(
2590    fisher: FisherMatrix,
2591    name: str,
2592    ax: Optional[Axes] = None,
2593    **kwargs,
2594) -> tuple[Figure, Axes, Artist]:
2595    r"""
2596    Plot a 1D curve (usually marginalized Gaussian) from a Fisher object.
2597
2598    Parameters
2599    ----------
2600    fisher : FisherMatrix
2601        the Fisher matrix which we want to plot
2602
2603    name : str
2604        the name of the parameter which we want to plot
2605
2606    ax : matplotlib.axes.Axes, optional
2607        the axis on which we want to plot the contour (default: None). If None,
2608        plots to a new figure.
2609
2610    **kwargs
2611        any keyword arguments passed to <a
2612        href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/_as_gen/matplotlib.pyplot.plot.html"
2613        target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">``matplotlib.pyplot.plot``</a>.
2614
2615    Returns
2616    -------
2617    A 3-tuple ``(Figure, Axes, Artist)``
2618        The figure and the axis on which the artist was drawn on, as well as
2619        the artist itself.
2620
2621    Examples
2622    --------
2623    Define a Fisher matrix:
2624
2625    >>> m = FisherMatrix(
2626    ... [[3, -2], [-2, 5]],
2627    ... names=['a', 'b'],
2628    ... latex_names=[r'$\mathcal{A}$', r'$\mathcal{B}$'],
2629    ... )
2630
2631    Draw the marginalized parameter ``a``:
2632
2633    >>> fig, ax, artist = plot_curve_1d(m, name='a', ls='--', color='red')
2634
2635    Save it to a file:
2636
2637    >>> fig.savefig(
2638    ... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "plot_curve_1d_example1.png",
2639    ... dpi=100)
2640
2641    <img width="100%" UpJSdHy5curTvTYuXOnwo86+7R///6aN2+e/ud//kf333+/unbtqkWLFjEGIAAAcDzHjANoA+MIAQAQevj8dsgxgAAAAKg7CiAAAIDLUAABAABchgIIAADgMhRAAAAAl6EAAgAAuAwFEAAAwGUogAAAAC5DAQQAAHAZx0wFZ4NvEpXS0lLLSQAAQF35PrfdPBkaBbARDhw4IElKSkqynAQAANTXgQMHFBcXZzuGFcwF3Agej0d79uxRTEyMwsLCbMcJSaWlpUpKStKuXbtcOx+jv/Bc+hfPp3/xfPoPz2Xjeb1eHThwQB07dlR4uDuPhmMLYCOEh4erc+fOtmM4QmxsLG9kfsJz6V88n/7F8+k/PJeN49Ytfz7urL0AAAAuRgEEAABwGQogrIqKitKECRMUFRVlO0rI47n0L55P/+L59B+eS/gDJ4EAAAC4DFsAAQAAXIYCCAAA4DIUQAAAAJehAAIAALgMBRBB4auvvtLNN9+sM844Qy1atNDPfvYzTZgwQRUVFbajhaw//OEP6t+/v1q2bKnWrVvbjhNSpk2bpuTkZEVHRystLU1r1qyxHSlkvfPOO7ryyivVsWNHhYWFadGiRbYjhay8vDz16dNHMTExSkhI0NChQ7V582bbsRCiKIAICps2bZLH49Fzzz2nzz77TE8//bSmT5+u+++/33a0kFVRUaFrrrlGo0aNsh0lpCxYsEA5OTmaMGGC1q9fr169eikzM1N79+61HS0klZWVqVevXpo2bZrtKCHv7bff1ujRo/XBBx9o5cqVOnz4sAYPHqyysjLb0RCCGAYGQeuJJ57Qn//8Z23bts12lJA2e/Zs3XXXXfr+++9tRwkJaWlp6tOnj6ZOnSrJzPmdlJSkMWPGaNy4cZbThbawsDAtXLhQQ4cOtR3FEfbt26eEhAS9/fbbuuiii2zHQYhhCyCCVklJidq2bWs7BlykoqJC69atU0ZGRtVt4eHhysjIUEFBgcVkwLFKSkokifdJNAgFEEFp69atevbZZ3XrrbfajgIXKS4uVmVlpRITE2vcnpiYqMLCQkupgGN5PB7dddddGjBggHr27Gk7DkIQBRBNaty4cQoLCzvhZdOmTTUes3v3bl1++eW65pprNHLkSEvJg1NDnk8AzjN69Gj961//0vz5821HQYhqZjsAnO2ee+7RTTfddML7dOnSpWp5z549uuSSS9S/f3/NmDGjidOFnvo+n6if+Ph4RUREqKioqMbtRUVFat++vaVUQE233367li5dqnfeeUedO3e2HQchigKIJtWuXTu1a9euTvfdvXu3LrnkEqWmpuqFF15QeDgbqH+qPs8n6i8yMlKpqanKz8+vOlHB4/EoPz9ft99+u91wcD2v16sxY8Zo4cKFWr16tc444wzbkRDCKIAICrt379bAgQN1+umn68knn9S+ffuq/o8tLw2zc+dO7d+/Xzt37lRlZaU2bNggSTrzzDPVqlUru+GCWE5OjkaMGKHevXurb9++mjJlisrKypSdnW07Wkg6ePCgtm7dWvXv7du3a8OGDWrbtq1OO+00i8lCz+jRozVv3jwtXrxYMTExVcelxsXFqUWLFpbTIdQwDAyCwuzZs4/7Acsq2jA33XST5syZc8ztb731lgYOHBj4QCFk6tSpeuKJJ1RYWKiUlBQ988wzSktLsx0rJK1evVqXXHLJMbePGDFCs2fPDnygEBYWFlbr7S+88MJJDw0BfooCCAAA4DIcZAUAAOAyFEAAAACXoQACAAC4DAUQAADAZSiAAAAALkMBBAAAcBkKIAAAgMtQAAEAAFyGAggAAOAyFEAAAACXoQACAAC4DAUQAADAZSiAAAAALkMBBAAAcBkKIAAAgMtQAAEAAFyGAggAAOAyFEAAAACXoQACAAC4DAUQAADAZSiAAAAALkMBBAAAcBkKIAAAgMtQAAEAAFyGAggAAOAyFEAAAACXoQACAAC4DAUQAADAZSiAAAAALkMBBAAAcBkKIAAAgMv8P85CP7JqleVcAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC">
2642    """
2643    if ax is None:
2644        _, ax = plt.subplots()
2645
2646    fid = fisher.fiducials[np.where(fisher.names == name)]
2647    sigma = fisher.constraints(name, marginalized=True)
2648
2649    return _add_plot_1d(fid, sigma, ax=ax, **kwargs)
2650
2651
2652def plot_curve_2d(
2653    fisher: FisherMatrix,
2654    name1: str,
2655    name2: str,
2656    ax: Optional[Axes] = None,
2657    scaling_factor: float = 1,
2658    **kwargs,
2659) -> tuple[Figure, Axes, Artist]:
2660    r"""
2661    Plot a 2D curve (usually ellipse) from two parameters of a Fisher object.
2662
2663    Parameters
2664    ----------
2665    fisher : FisherMatrix
2666        the Fisher matrix which we want to plot
2667
2668    name1 : str
2669        the name of the first parameter which we want to plot
2670
2671    name2 : str
2672        the name of the second parameter which we want to plot
2673
2674    ax : matplotlib.axes.Axes, optional
2675        the axis on which we want to plot the contour (default: None). If None,
2676        plots to a new figure.
2677
2678    **kwargs
2679        any keyword arguments passed to <a
2680        href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/_as_gen/matplotlib.patches.Ellipse.html"
2681        target="_blank" rel="noopener
2682        noreferrer">``matplotlib.patches.Ellipse``</a>.
2683
2684    Returns
2685    -------
2686    A 3-tuple ``(Figure, Axes, Artist)``
2687        The figure and the axis on which the artist was drawn on, as well as
2688        the artist itself.
2689
2690    Examples
2691    --------
2692    Define a Fisher matrix:
2693
2694    >>> m = FisherMatrix(
2695    ... [[3, -2], [-2, 5]],
2696    ... names=['a', 'b'],
2697    ... fiducials=[1, -2],
2698    ... latex_names=[r'$\mathcal{A}$', r'$\mathcal{B}$'],
2699    ... )
2700
2701    Draw the 1$\sigma$ contour of the parameter combination ``a``, ``b``:
2702
2703    >>> fig, ax, artist = plot_curve_2d(m, name1='a', name2='b', ls='--', color='red', fill=False)
2704
2705    Rescale the view a bit:
2706
2707    >>> _ = ax.autoscale()
2708    >>> _ = ax.relim()
2709    >>> _ = ax.autoscale_view()
2710
2711    Save it to a file:
2712
2713    >>> fig.savefig(
2714    ... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "plot_curve_2d_example1.png",
2715    ... dpi=100)
2716
2717    <img width="100%" hWyMZm1aknPP2/b/G3YYAt8MyYTQABx/aYLGOEgKkqqW9eOQx57zPZ7/fZbacUKO1JS7LHPP7dxhtWqWTCsXVtq0MC6lCXrVq5QwSaf+NGhz2RRUbacyvffS5s3HznatrXJNV98cWRCxqGt0s45x76Pjj7S3V6t2p+XX/njIt8AgMChBTAP+AThyObNtszMoWC4Zo0Fnc8+s5avuDhrJaxQQapSxY5x4+x21izb0q50aWv9Kl1aql7dnut5+bd+oefZER1trXBr1ki7d1u3dmqqTbjo3t2ee/fd1l17KOClpNhaes2bS3fdJY0aJRUrJlWubEf37lK/fvazvvvOWvYqV2btRQDIIa7fBMA84Q8oDGVl2VIlv/1mLYG//WbH5Mk2saF3b+nVVy0oHvLww9LQoTZbuVMnay07dJx+urRwoT3v3HOlAwdstvPBg9YNPW2atT4OGiS99JLdd+gYMMB2v1i4ULrwwqPrrFBB2rLFvu7USdq790jAq1xZuvZaC6y7dlkXbokSBDwAyCdcv+kCRqQpVEi6+OLjPz5xoi1Ds3u3hatdu6Ry5eyxhg1tkkRm5pFxhn+cldy+vQW1gwctBBYpYuPoJPudFSocCY4xMTaBRbLbL76wGbTx8VJCwpHXSbbsyvEwRg8AUABoAcwDPkEAAOA/XL+laNcFAAAAILQIgAAAAAFDAAQAAAgYAiAAAEDAEAABAAAChgAIAAAQMARAAACAgCEAAgAABAwBEAAAIGAIgAAAAAFDAAQAAAgYAiAAAEDAEAABAAACprDrAvzM8zxJUlpamuNKAABATh26bh+6jgcRATAPdu/eLUlKTEx0XAkAAMit3bt3KyEhwXUZTkR5QY6/eZSdna3k5GSVLFlSUVFRrsuRZJ9qEhMTtXHjRsXHx7suJ2xwXo6Pc3NsnJdj47wcH+fm2MLxvHiep927d+uUU05RdHQwR8PRApgH0dHRqlKliusyjik+Pj5s/kcLJ5yX4+PcHBvn5dg4L8fHuTm2cDsvQW35OySYsRcAACDACIAAAAABQwCMMLGxsRo2bJhiY2NdlxJWOC/Hx7k5Ns7LsXFejo9zc2ycl/DEJBAAAICAoQUQAAAgYAiAAAAAAUMABAAACBgCIAAAQMAQAH1o3Lhxql69uooWLaqmTZtqyZIlOXrdW2+9paioKHXq1KlgC3Qkt+dl165d6tevnypXrqzY2FjVrVtXM2fODFG1oZPb8zJmzBjVq1dPcXFxSkxM1IABA3TgwIEQVRs6n3/+ua644gqdcsopioqK0vvvv/+Xr5k/f77OOeccxcbGqnbt2po4cWKB1xlquT0v7733ntq1a6fy5csrPj5ezZs31yeffBKaYkPoZP5eDvniiy9UuHBhNWrUqMDqc+lkzk16erqGDh2qatWqKTY2VtWrV9crr7xS8MXiMAKgz7z99tsaOHCghg0bpm+//VYNGzZU+/bttXXr1hO+bt26dbr77rt14YUXhqjS0MrtecnIyFC7du20bt06TZ06VatWrdKLL76oU089NcSVF6zcnpc33nhDgwcP1rBhw7RixQq9/PLLevvtt3XPPfeEuPKCt3fvXjVs2FDjxo3L0fPXrl2rjh07qnXr1lq+fLn69++vm266KeLCTm7Py+eff6527dpp5syZWrp0qVq3bq0rrrhCy5YtK+BKQyu35+WQXbt26YYbblDbtm0LqDL3TubcdO3aVXPmzNHLL7+sVatW6c0331S9evUKsEr8iQdfadKkidevX7/D32dlZXmnnHKKN2LEiOO+5uDBg16LFi28l156yevVq5d31VVXhaDS0MrteXnuuee8mjVrehkZGaEq0Yncnpd+/fp5bdq0Oeq+gQMHeueff36B1umaJG/atGknfM6//vUv7/TTTz/qvm7dunnt27cvwMrcysl5OZYGDRp4w4cPz/+CwkRuzku3bt28e++91xs2bJjXsGHDAq0rHOTk3MyaNctLSEjwduzYEZqicEy0APpIRkaGli5dqosvvvjwfdHR0br44ou1aNGi477uwQcfVIUKFdSnT59QlBlyJ3Nepk+frubNm6tfv36qWLGizjjjDD366KPKysoKVdkF7mTOS4sWLbR06dLD3cRr1qzRzJkzddlll4Wk5nC2aNGio86lJLVv3/6E/+8FUXZ2tnbv3q0yZcq4LsW5CRMmaM2aNRo2bJjrUsLK9OnTde655+rxxx/Xqaeeqrp16+ruu+/W/v37XZcWKIVdF4Cc2759u7KyslSxYsWj7q9YsaJWrlx5zNcsXLhQL7/8spYvXx6CCt04mfOyZs0azZ07V9dff71mzpyppKQk3XbbbcrMzIyYN+uTOS89evTQ9u3bdcEFF8jzPB08eFC33HJLRHYB51ZKSsoxz2VaWpr279+vuLg4R5WFl5EjR2rPnj3q2rWr61Kc+uWXXzR48GD997//VeHCXGr/aM2aNVq4cKGKFi2qadOmafv27brtttu0Y8cOTZgwwXV5gUELYATbvXu3evbsqRdffFHlypVzXU5Yyc7OVoUKFfTCCy+ocePG6tatm4YOHarx48e7Ls2p+fPn69FHH9Wzzz6rb7/9Vu+9954++ugjPfTQQ65Lgw+88cYbGj58uN555x1VqFDBdTnOZGVlqUePHho+fLjq1q3rupywk52draioKL3++utq0qSJLrvsMo0aNUqTJk2iFTCE+FjiI+XKlVOhQoW0ZcuWo+7fsmWLKlWq9Kfn//rrr1q3bp2uuOKKw/dlZ2dLkgoXLqxVq1apVq1aBVt0COT2vEhS5cqVVaRIERUqVOjwfaeddppSUlKUkZGhmJiYAq05FE7mvNx3333q2bOnbrrpJknSmWeeqb1796pv374aOnSooqOD+5mxUqVKxzyX8fHxtP7JVhm46aabNGXKlD91lQfN7t279c0332jZsmW6/fbbJdl7r+d5Kly4sGbPnq02bdo4rtKdypUr69RTT1VCQsLh+0477TR5nqfffvtNderUcVhdcAT33dyHYmJi1LhxY82ZM+fwfdnZ2ZozZ46aN2/+p+fXr19fP/zwg5YvX374uPLKKw/PYkxMTAxl+QUmt+dFks4//3wlJSUdDsSStHr1alWuXDkiwp90cudl3759fwp5h0KyF/Btw5s3b37UuZSkTz/99LjnMkjefPNN3XjjjXrzzTfVsWNH1+U4Fx8f/6f33ltuuUX16tXT8uXL1bRpU9clOnX++ecrOTlZe/bsOXzf6tWrFR0drSpVqjisLGDczkFBbr311ltebGysN3HiRO/nn3/2+vbt65UqVcpLSUnxPM/zevbs6Q0ePPi4r4/UWcC5PS8bNmzwSpYs6d1+++3eqlWrvA8//NCrUKGC9/DDD7v6JxSI3J6XYcOGeSVLlvTefPNNb82aNd7s2bO9WrVqeV27dnX1Tygwu3fv9pYtW+YtW7bMk+SNGjXKW7Zsmbd+/XrP8zxv8ODBXs+ePQ8/f82aNV6xYsW8QYMGeStWrPDGjRvnFSpUyPv4449d/RMKRG7Py+uvv+4VLlzYGzdunLd58+bDx65du1z9EwpEbs/L/4rkWcC5PTe7d+/2qlSp4l177bXeTz/95C1YsMCrU6eOd9NNN7n6JwQSAdCHxo4d61WtWtWLiYnxmjRp4n311VeHH2vZsqXXq1ev4742UgOg5+X+vHz55Zde06ZNvdjYWK9mzZreI4884h08eDDEVRe83JyXzMxM74EHHvBq1arlFS1a1EtMTPRuu+02b+fOnaEvvIDNmzfPk/Sn49D56NWrl9eyZcs/vaZRo0ZeTEyMV7NmTW/ChAkhr7ug5fa8tGzZ8oTPjxQn8/fyR5EcAE/m3KxYscK7+OKLvbi4OK9KlSrewIEDvX379oW++ACL8ryA9+sAAAAEDGMAAQAAAoYACAAAEDAEQAAAgIAhAAIAAAQMARAAACBgCIAAAAABQwAEAAAIGAIgAABAwBAAAQAAAoYACAAAEDAEQAAAgIAhAAIAAAQMARAAACBgCIAAAAABQwAEAAAIGAIgAABAwBAAAQAAAoYACAAAEDAEQAAAgIAhAAIAAAQMARAAACBgCIAAAAABQwAEAAAIGAIgAABAwBAAAQAAAoYACAAAEDAEQAAAgIAhAAIAAAQMARAAACBgCIAAAAABQwAEAAAImP8DRx0aJ3sVAw0AAAAASUVORK5CYII=">
2718
2719    Notes
2720    -----
2721    The limits of the plot are not updated automatically.
2722    """
2723    if ax is None:
2724        _, ax = plt.subplots()
2725
2726    fidx = fisher.fiducials[np.where(fisher.names == name1)]
2727    fidy = fisher.fiducials[np.where(fisher.names == name2)]
2728
2729    a, b, angle = _get_ellipse(fisher, name1, name2)
2730
2731    patch = ax.add_patch(
2732        Ellipse(
2733            xy=(fidx, fidy),
2734            width=2 * a * scaling_factor,
2735            height=2 * b * scaling_factor,
2736            angle=angle,
2737            **kwargs,
2738        ),
2739    )
2740
2741    return (ax.get_figure(), ax, patch)
2742
2743
2744def _get_ellipse(
2745    fm: FisherMatrix,
2746    name1: str,
2747    name2: str,
2748) -> tuple[float, float, float]:
2749    """Construct parameters for a Gaussian ellipse from the names."""
2750    if name1 == name2:
2751        raise ValueError("Names must be different")
2752
2753    # the inverse
2754    inv = FisherMatrix(fm.inverse(), names=fm.names)
2755
2756    sigmax2 = inv[name1, name1]
2757    sigmay2 = inv[name2, name2]
2758    sigmaxy = inv[name1, name2]
2759
2760    # basically the eigenvalues of the submatrix
2761    a = np.sqrt(
2762        (sigmax2 + sigmay2) / 2 + np.sqrt((sigmax2 - sigmay2) ** 2 / 4 + sigmaxy**2)
2763    )
2764
2765    b = np.sqrt(
2766        (sigmax2 + sigmay2) / 2 - np.sqrt((sigmax2 - sigmay2) ** 2 / 4 + sigmaxy**2)
2767    )
2768
2769    angle = np.rad2deg(
2770        np.arctan2(
2771            2 * sigmaxy,
2772            sigmax2 - sigmay2,
2773        )
2774        / 2
2775    )
2776
2777    return a, b, angle
2778
2779
2780def _mark_fiducial_1d(
2781    fisher: FisherMatrix,
2782    name: str,
2783    ax: Axes,
2784    **kwargs,
2785):
2786    # always put the fiducials on top (unless specified otherwise)
2787    zorder = kwargs.pop("zorder", 999)
2788
2789    ax.axvline(
2790        fisher.fiducials[np.where(name == fisher.names)][0],
2791        0,
2792        1,
2793        zorder=zorder,
2794        **kwargs,
2795    )
2796
2797
2798def _mark_fiducial_2d(
2799    fisher: FisherMatrix,
2800    name1: str,
2801    name2: str,
2802    ax: Axes,
2803    **kwargs,
2804):
2805    # always put the fiducials on top (unless specified otherwise)
2806    zorder = kwargs.pop("zorder", 999)
2807
2808    index1 = np.where(fisher.names == name1)[0]
2809    index2 = np.where(fisher.names == name2)[0]
2810    fiducial1 = fisher.fiducials[index1]
2811    fiducial2 = fisher.fiducials[index2]
2812
2813    ax.axhline(
2814        fiducial1,
2815        0,
2816        1,
2817        zorder=zorder,
2818        **kwargs,
2819    )
2820
2821    ax.axvline(
2822        fiducial2,
2823        0,
2824        1,
2825        zorder=zorder,
2826        **kwargs,
2827    )
2828
2829
2830def _parse_contour_levels(contour_levels: Sequence[tuple[float, float]]):
2831    try:
2832        contour_levels = [
2833            (float(level), float(alpha)) for level, alpha in contour_levels
2834        ]
2835    except Exception as exc:
2836        raise ValueError(
2837            f"The object {contour_levels} cannot be converted to a list of 2-tuples"
2838        ) from exc
2839    for level, alpha in contour_levels:
2840        if level < 0:
2841            raise ValueError(f"Negative contour level found in: {contour_levels}")
2842        if not 0 <= alpha <= 1:
2843            raise ValueError(
2844                f"Opacity value outside of (0, 1) found in: {contour_levels}"
2845            )
2846
2847    return contour_levels
class FisherBaseFigure: 
179class FisherBaseFigure:
180    def __init__(
181        self,
182        options: Optional[dict] = None,
183        **kwargs,
184    ):
185        """
186        Create an instance.
187
188        Notes
189        -----
190        Mixin.
191        """
192        self._figure = None
193        self._axes: Optional[Union[Axes, Sequence[Axes]]] = None
194        self._handles: MutableSequence[Artist] = []
195        self._labels: MutableSequence[str] = []
196        self._options: dict = get_default_rcparams()
197
198        self.cycler = mpl.rcParams["axes.prop_cycle"].by_key()["color"]
199        self.current_color = iter(self.cycler)
200
201        if options and "style" in options:
202            style = options.pop("style")
203            # maybe it's one of the built-in styles
204            if style in mpl.style.available:
205                self._options = {
206                    **mpl.style.library[style],
207                    **get_default_rcparams(),
208                    **options,
209                }
210                # we need to reset the color cycler
211                self.cycler = (
212                    mpl.style.library[style]
213                    .get(
214                        "axes.prop_cycle",
215                        mpl.rcParams["axes.prop_cycle"],
216                    )
217                    .by_key()["color"]
218                )
219                self.current_color = iter(self.cycler)
220
221            # maybe it's a file
222            else:
223                # we need to reset the color cycler
224                self.cycler = (
225                    mpl.rc_params_from_file(style)
226                    .get(
227                        "axes.prop_cycle",
228                        mpl.rcParams["axes.prop_cycle"],
229                    )
230                    .by_key()["color"]
231                )
232                self.current_color = iter(self.cycler)
233
234                self._options = {
235                    **mpl.rc_params_from_file(style),
236                    **options,
237                }
238
239    @property
240    def options(self):
241        """Return the matplotlib options which were used for plotting."""
242        return self._options
243
244    @property
245    def axes(self):
246        """Return the axes of the figure as a numpy array."""
247        return self._axes
248
249    @property
250    def figure(self):
251        """
252        Return the underlying figure.
253
254        Returns
255        -------
256        fig
257            an instance of <a
258            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/figure_api.html#matplotlib.figure.Figure"
259            target="_blank" rel="noreferrer
260            noopener">``matplotlib.figure.Figure``</a>.
261        """
262        return self._figure
263
264    @property
265    def handles(self):
266        """Return the handles of the currently drawn artists."""
267        return self._handles
268
269    @property
270    def labels(self):
271        """Return the legend labels of the currently drawn artists."""
272        return self._labels
273
274    def savefig(
275        self,
276        path: Union[str, Path],
277        dpi: float = 300,
278        bbox_inches: Union[str, Bbox] = "tight",
279        **kwargs,
280    ):
281        """
282        Save a figure.
283
284        Notes
285        -----
286        Convenience wrapper for <a
287        href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/figure_api.html#matplotlib.figure.Figure.savefig"
288        target="_blank" rel="noreferrer
289        noopener">``matplotlib.figure.Figure.savefig``</a>.
290
291        Parameters
292        ----------
293        path : Path or str
294            the path where to save the figure
295
296        dpi : float, optional
297            the resolution of the saved figure (default: 300)
298
299        bbox_inches : str or Bbox, optional
300            what is the bounding box for the figure (default: 'tight')
301
302        **kwargs
303            any other keyword arguments that should be passed to <a
304            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/figure_api.html#matplotlib.figure.Figure.savefig"
305            target="_blank" rel="noreferrer
306            noopener">``matplotlib.figure.Figure.savefig``</a>
307
308        Returns
309        -------
310        None
311
312        Raises
313        ------
314        EmptyFigureError
315            if ``figure`` is not set
316        """
317        if not self.figure:
318            raise EmptyFigureError
319
320        self.figure.savefig(
321            path,
322            dpi=dpi,
323            bbox_inches=bbox_inches,
324            **kwargs,
325        )
FisherBaseFigure(options: Optional[dict] = None, **kwargs) 
180    def __init__(
181        self,
182        options: Optional[dict] = None,
183        **kwargs,
184    ):
185        """
186        Create an instance.
187
188        Notes
189        -----
190        Mixin.
191        """
192        self._figure = None
193        self._axes: Optional[Union[Axes, Sequence[Axes]]] = None
194        self._handles: MutableSequence[Artist] = []
195        self._labels: MutableSequence[str] = []
196        self._options: dict = get_default_rcparams()
197
198        self.cycler = mpl.rcParams["axes.prop_cycle"].by_key()["color"]
199        self.current_color = iter(self.cycler)
200
201        if options and "style" in options:
202            style = options.pop("style")
203            # maybe it's one of the built-in styles
204            if style in mpl.style.available:
205                self._options = {
206                    **mpl.style.library[style],
207                    **get_default_rcparams(),
208                    **options,
209                }
210                # we need to reset the color cycler
211                self.cycler = (
212                    mpl.style.library[style]
213                    .get(
214                        "axes.prop_cycle",
215                        mpl.rcParams["axes.prop_cycle"],
216                    )
217                    .by_key()["color"]
218                )
219                self.current_color = iter(self.cycler)
220
221            # maybe it's a file
222            else:
223                # we need to reset the color cycler
224                self.cycler = (
225                    mpl.rc_params_from_file(style)
226                    .get(
227                        "axes.prop_cycle",
228                        mpl.rcParams["axes.prop_cycle"],
229                    )
230                    .by_key()["color"]
231                )
232                self.current_color = iter(self.cycler)
233
234                self._options = {
235                    **mpl.rc_params_from_file(style),
236                    **options,
237                }

Create an instance.

Notes

Mixin.

options

Return the matplotlib options which were used for plotting.

axes

Return the axes of the figure as a numpy array.

figure

Return the underlying figure.

Returns
  • fig: an instance of matplotlib.figure.Figure.
handles

Return the handles of the currently drawn artists.

labels

Return the legend labels of the currently drawn artists.

def savefig( self, path: Union[str, pathlib.Path], dpi: float = 300, bbox_inches: Union[str, matplotlib.transforms.Bbox] = 'tight', **kwargs): 
274    def savefig(
275        self,
276        path: Union[str, Path],
277        dpi: float = 300,
278        bbox_inches: Union[str, Bbox] = "tight",
279        **kwargs,
280    ):
281        """
282        Save a figure.
283
284        Notes
285        -----
286        Convenience wrapper for <a
287        href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/figure_api.html#matplotlib.figure.Figure.savefig"
288        target="_blank" rel="noreferrer
289        noopener">``matplotlib.figure.Figure.savefig``</a>.
290
291        Parameters
292        ----------
293        path : Path or str
294            the path where to save the figure
295
296        dpi : float, optional
297            the resolution of the saved figure (default: 300)
298
299        bbox_inches : str or Bbox, optional
300            what is the bounding box for the figure (default: 'tight')
301
302        **kwargs
303            any other keyword arguments that should be passed to <a
304            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/figure_api.html#matplotlib.figure.Figure.savefig"
305            target="_blank" rel="noreferrer
306            noopener">``matplotlib.figure.Figure.savefig``</a>
307
308        Returns
309        -------
310        None
311
312        Raises
313        ------
314        EmptyFigureError
315            if ``figure`` is not set
316        """
317        if not self.figure:
318            raise EmptyFigureError
319
320        self.figure.savefig(
321            path,
322            dpi=dpi,
323            bbox_inches=bbox_inches,
324            **kwargs,
325        )

Save a figure.

Notes

Convenience wrapper for matplotlib.figure.Figure.savefig.

Parameters
  • path (Path or str): the path where to save the figure
  • dpi (float, optional): the resolution of the saved figure (default: 300)
  • bbox_inches (str or Bbox, optional): what is the bounding box for the figure (default: 'tight')
  • **kwargs: any other keyword arguments that should be passed to matplotlib.figure.Figure.savefig
Returns
  • None
Raises
  • EmptyFigureError: if figure is not set
class EmptyFigureError(builtins.Exception): 
328class EmptyFigureError(Exception):
329    """Error raised when the figure is empty."""
330
331    def __init__(self):
332        self.message = (
333            "The figure is empty; make sure to call one of the plotting methods before"
334        )
335        super().__init__(self.message)

Error raised when the figure is empty.

Inherited Members

class FisherMultipleAxesFigure(FisherBaseFigure, abc.ABC): 
338class FisherMultipleAxesFigure(FisherBaseFigure, ABC):
339    """The abstract base class for plotting multiple axes on a figure."""
340
341    def __init__(
342        self,
343        *args,
344        options: Optional[dict] = None,
345        hspace: float = 0.1,
346        wspace: float = 0.1,
347        contour_levels: Optional[Sequence[tuple[float, float]]] = None,
348        **kwargs,
349    ):
350        """
351        Create an instance.
352
353        Parameters
354        ----------
355        *args
356            placeholder args
357
358        options : dict, optional
359            the plotting options
360
361        hspace : float, optional
362            the vertical space between plots (default: 0.1)
363
364        wspace : float, optional
365            the horizontal space between plots (default: 0.1)
366
367        contour_levels : array_like of 2-tuples, optional
368            the contour levels which we want to plot
369
370        **kwargs
371            placeholder kwargs
372        """
373        self._names = None
374        self._options: dict = {}
375        self._ndim: int = 0
376        self._hspace = hspace
377        self._wspace = wspace
378
379        super().__init__(options=options, **kwargs)
380
381        # parse `contour_levels`
382        if contour_levels is None:
383            self.contour_levels = [(1.0, 0.3), (2.0, 0.1)]
384        else:
385            self.contour_levels = _parse_contour_levels(contour_levels)
386
387    @abstractmethod
388    def plot(self, fisher: FisherMatrix, *args, **kwargs):
389        """Implement plotting of Fisher objects."""
390
391    @abstractmethod
392    def __getitem__(self, key):
393        """Implement element access."""
394
395    @property
396    def hspace(self) -> float:
397        """
398        Return the vertical spacing between axes.
399
400        The amount of height reserved for space between subplots, expressed as
401        a fraction of the average axis height.
402        """
403        return self._hspace
404
405    @property
406    def wspace(self) -> float:
407        """
408        Return the horizontal spacing between axes.
409
410        The amount of width reserved for space between subplots, expressed as a
411        fraction of the average axis width.
412        """
413        return self._wspace
414
415    @property
416    def names(self):
417        """Return the names of the parameters plotted."""
418        return self._names
419
420    def __repr__(self):
421        """Return the representation of the figure."""
422        return (
423            f"<{self.__class__.__name__}(\n"
424            f"    names={repr(self.names)},\n"
425            f"    figure={repr(self.figure)},\n"
426            f"    axes={repr(self.axes)})>"
427        )
428
429    def __str__(self):
430        """Return the string representation of the figure."""
431        return (
432            f"{self.__class__.__name__}(\n"
433            f"    names={str(self.names)},\n"
434            f"    figure={str(self.figure)},\n"
435            f"    axes={str(self.axes)})"
436        )
437
438    def add_artist_to_legend(
439        self,
440        artist: Artist,
441        label: str,
442    ):
443        r"""
444        Add a plotted artist to the legend.
445
446        Parameters
447        ----------
448        artist
449            the artist which we want to put on the legend
450
451        label : str
452            the label for the artist
453
454        Returns
455        -------
456        None
457
458        Notes
459        -----
460        This is a convenience function for correctly updating the legend after
461        directly plotting some artist via ``<instance>[<name(s)>].<method>``
462
463        Examples
464        --------
465        Setup the plot:
466
467        >>> fig = FisherFigure1D()
468        >>> fig.plot(FisherMatrix(np.diag([1, 2]), names=["a", "b"]), label="Fisher matrix")
469
470        Add something to the plot that has a handle:
471
472        >>> handle, = fig["a"].plot([-1, 0, 1], [-1, 0, 1], color='red')
473
474        Finally, add the handle to the legend, and draw the legend:
475
476        >>> fig.add_artist_to_legend(handle, "linear function")
477        >>> _ = fig.legend() # the artist will now be shown correctly in the legend
478
479        Save it to a file:
480
481        >>> fig.savefig(
482        ... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure2d_add_artist_to_legend1.png",
483        ... dpi=150)
484
485        <img width="100%"
