57Dueeeq3VxiCgImpubu93n9XrR0tICAEhKSlK5RKQmnnlHgOLiYgBAXl5et8d8FZ2IjOXo0aPd7jt48CA8Hg/i4uIwYcIEDUpFamHwjgDZ2dkAgB07dijur62txZ49e7QoEhEN0VtvvdXtvpUrVwIA8vPzYbUysRrOGLwjwIMPPggAeOCBB/D555/D6XSisLAQ11xzDVwul8alI6LBqKurw0MPPYTKykq4XC4sX74cv/3tb5GXl4ennnpK6+JRiDF4R4Cf/OQneP/995GdnY1rr70WaWlpWLJkCa699losWLAAADBmzBgsWrRI24ISUa98VxVbsWKFfzsuLg5nnXUWkpOT8dBDD+Hmm2/G119/zf7uCGASQgitC0FERET9xzNvIiIig2HwJiIiMhgGbyIiIoNh8CYiIjIYBm8iIiKDYfAmIiIyGAZvIiIig2HwJiIiMhgGbyIiIoNh8CYiIjIYBm8iIiKDYfAmIiIyGAZvIiIig2HwJiIiMhgGbyIiIoNh8CYiIjIYBm8iIiKDYfAmIiIymP8P9EdofnYwH84AAAAASUVORK5CYII=">
486
487        Notes
488        -----
489        The limits of the plot are not updated automatically.
490        """
491        self.labels.append(label)
492        self.handles.append(artist)
493
494    def set_label_params(
495        self,
496        which: str = "both",
497        **kwargs,
498    ):
499        """
500        Set both x and y label parameters on all axes.
501
502        Parameters
503        ----------
504        which : {'both', 'x', 'y'}
505            which axis to change (default: 'both')
506
507        **kwargs
508            any keyword arguments that are also valid for <a
509            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/text_api.html#matplotlib.text.Text"
510            target="_blank" rel="noopener
511            noreferrer">``matplotlib.text.Text``</a>.
512
513        Returns
514        -------
515        None
516
517        Raises
518        ------
519        EmptyFigureError
520            if ``figure`` is not set
521
522        ValueError
523            if ``which`` is not one of the allowed values
524        """
525        if not self.figure:
526            raise EmptyFigureError
527
528        for nameiter in product(self.names, repeat=self._ndim):
529            # only set the parameters which are not empty (should this be done
530            # for all of them instead?)
531            if self[nameiter]:
532                _set_label_params(self[nameiter], which=which, **kwargs)
533
534    def set_tick_params(
535        self,
536        which: str = "both",
537        **kwargs,
538    ):
539        """
540        Set both x and y tick parameters on all axes.
541
542        Parameters
543        ----------
544        which : {'both', 'x', 'y'}
545            which axis to change (default: 'both')
546
547        **kwargs
548            any keyword arguments passed to the methods for handling tick
549            parameters (such as 'fontsize', 'rotation', etc.)
550
551        Returns
552        -------
553        None
554
555        Raises
556        ------
557        EmptyFigureError
558            if ``figure`` is not set
559
560        ValueError
561            if ``which`` is not one of the allowed values
562        """
563        if not self.figure:
564            raise EmptyFigureError
565
566        for nameiter in product(self.names, repeat=self._ndim):
567            if self[nameiter]:
568                _set_tick_params(self[nameiter], which=which, **kwargs)
569
570    def set_major_locator(
571        self,
572        locator: Locator,
573        which: str = "both",
574    ):
575        """
576        Set the major locator for all axes.
577
578        Parameters
579        ----------
580        locator
581            the instance of <a
582            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/ticker_api.html#matplotlib.ticker.Locator"
583            target="_blank" rel="noopener
584            noreferrer">``matplotlib.ticker.Locator``</a> to use.
585
586        which : {'both', 'x', 'y'}
587            which axis to change (default: 'both')
588
589        Returns
590        -------
591        None
592
593        Raises
594        ------
595        EmptyFigureError
596            if ``figure`` is not set
597        """
598        if not self.figure:
599            raise EmptyFigureError
600
601        for nameiter in product(self.names, repeat=self._ndim):
602            # for some reason, we cannot reuse the same instance, so we just
603            # make a deep copy of it instead
604            if (
605                self[nameiter]
606                and np.any(self[nameiter].get_xticks())
607                and which in ["both", "x"]
608            ):
609                xloc = copy.deepcopy(locator)
610                self[nameiter].xaxis.set_major_locator(xloc)
611            if (
612                self[nameiter]
613                and np.any(self[nameiter].get_yticks())
614                and which in ["both", "y"]
615            ):
616                yloc = copy.deepcopy(locator)
617                self[nameiter].yaxis.set_major_locator(yloc)
618
619    def set_minor_locator(
620        self,
621        locator: Locator,
622        which: str = "both",
623    ):
624        """
625        Set the minor locator for all axes.
626
627        Parameters
628        ----------
629        locator
630            the instance of <a
631            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/ticker_api.html#matplotlib.ticker.Locator"
632            target="_blank" rel="noopener
633            noreferrer">``matplotlib.ticker.Locator``</a> to use.
634
635        which : {'both', 'x', 'y'}
636            which axis to change (default: 'both')
637
638        Returns
639        -------
640        None
641
642        Raises
643        ------
644        EmptyFigureError
645            if ``figure`` is not set
646        """
647        if not self.figure:
648            raise EmptyFigureError
649
650        for nameiter in product(self.names, repeat=self._ndim):
651            if (
652                self[nameiter]
653                and np.any(self[nameiter].get_xticks())
654                and which in ["both", "x"]
655            ):
656                # same reason as the major locator
657                xloc = copy.deepcopy(locator)
658                self[nameiter].xaxis.set_minor_locator(xloc)
659            if (
660                self[nameiter]
661                and np.any(self[nameiter].get_yticks())
662                and which in ["both", "y"]
663            ):
664                yloc = copy.deepcopy(locator)
665                self[nameiter].yaxis.set_minor_locator(yloc)
666
667    def set_major_formatter(
668        self,
669        formatter: Formatter,
670        which: str = "both",
671    ):
672        """
673        Set the major formatter for all axes.
674
675        Parameters
676        ----------
677        formatter
678            the instance of <a
679            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/ticker_api.html#matplotlib.ticker.Formatter"
680            target="_blank" rel="noopener
681            noreferrer">``matplotlib.ticker.Formatter``</a> to use.
682
683        which : {'both', 'x', 'y'}
684            which axis to change (default: 'both')
685
686        Returns
687        -------
688        None
689
690        Raises
691        ------
692        EmptyFigureError
693            if ``figure`` is not set
694        """
695        if not self.figure:
696            raise EmptyFigureError
697
698        for nameiter in product(self.names, repeat=self._ndim):
699            if self[nameiter] and which in ["both", "x"]:
700                self[nameiter].xaxis.set_major_formatter(formatter)
701            if self[nameiter] and which in ["both", "y"]:
702                self[nameiter].yaxis.set_major_formatter(formatter)
703
704    def set_minor_formatter(
705        self,
706        formatter: Formatter,
707        which: str = "both",
708    ):
709        """
710        Set the minor formatter for all axes.
711
712        Parameters
713        ----------
714        formatter
715            the instance of <a
716            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/ticker_api.html#matplotlib.ticker.Formatter"
717            target="_blank" rel="noopener
718            noreferrer">``matplotlib.ticker.Formatter``</a> to use.
719
720        which : {'both', 'x', 'y'}
721            which axis to change (default: 'both')
722
723        Returns
724        -------
725        None
726
727        Raises
728        ------
729        EmptyFigureError
730            if ``figure`` is not set
731        """
732        if not self.figure:
733            raise EmptyFigureError
734
735        for nameiter in product(self.names, repeat=self._ndim):
736            if self[nameiter] and which in ["both", "x"]:
737                self[nameiter].xaxis.set_minor_formatter(formatter)
738            if self[nameiter] and which in ["both", "y"]:
739                self[nameiter].yaxis.set_minor_formatter(formatter)

The abstract base class for plotting multiple axes on a figure.

FisherMultipleAxesFigure( *args, options: Optional[dict] = None, hspace: float = 0.1, wspace: float = 0.1, contour_levels: Optional[collections.abc.Sequence[tuple[float, float]]] = None, **kwargs) 
341    def __init__(
342        self,
343        *args,
344        options: Optional[dict] = None,
345        hspace: float = 0.1,
346        wspace: float = 0.1,
347        contour_levels: Optional[Sequence[tuple[float, float]]] = None,
348        **kwargs,
349    ):
350        """
351        Create an instance.
352
353        Parameters
354        ----------
355        *args
356            placeholder args
357
358        options : dict, optional
359            the plotting options
360
361        hspace : float, optional
362            the vertical space between plots (default: 0.1)
363
364        wspace : float, optional
365            the horizontal space between plots (default: 0.1)
366
367        contour_levels : array_like of 2-tuples, optional
368            the contour levels which we want to plot
369
370        **kwargs
371            placeholder kwargs
372        """
373        self._names = None
374        self._options: dict = {}
375        self._ndim: int = 0
376        self._hspace = hspace
377        self._wspace = wspace
378
379        super().__init__(options=options, **kwargs)
380
381        # parse `contour_levels`
382        if contour_levels is None:
383            self.contour_levels = [(1.0, 0.3), (2.0, 0.1)]
384        else:
385            self.contour_levels = _parse_contour_levels(contour_levels)

Create an instance.

Parameters
  • *args: placeholder args
  • options (dict, optional): the plotting options
  • hspace (float, optional): the vertical space between plots (default: 0.1)
  • wspace (float, optional): the horizontal space between plots (default: 0.1)
  • contour_levels (array_like of 2-tuples, optional): the contour levels which we want to plot
  • **kwargs: placeholder kwargs
@abstractmethod
def plot(self, fisher: fitk.tensors.FisherMatrix, *args, **kwargs): 
387    @abstractmethod
388    def plot(self, fisher: FisherMatrix, *args, **kwargs):
389        """Implement plotting of Fisher objects."""

Implement plotting of Fisher objects.

hspace: float

Return the vertical spacing between axes.

The amount of height reserved for space between subplots, expressed as a fraction of the average axis height.

wspace: float

Return the horizontal spacing between axes.

The amount of width reserved for space between subplots, expressed as a fraction of the average axis width.

names

Return the names of the parameters plotted.

def add_artist_to_legend(self, artist: matplotlib.artist.Artist, label: str): 
438    def add_artist_to_legend(
439        self,
440        artist: Artist,
441        label: str,
442    ):
443        r"""
444        Add a plotted artist to the legend.
445
446        Parameters
447        ----------
448        artist
449            the artist which we want to put on the legend
450
451        label : str
452            the label for the artist
453
454        Returns
455        -------
456        None
457
458        Notes
459        -----
460        This is a convenience function for correctly updating the legend after
461        directly plotting some artist via ``<instance>[<name(s)>].<method>``
462
463        Examples
464        --------
465        Setup the plot:
466
467        >>> fig = FisherFigure1D()
468        >>> fig.plot(FisherMatrix(np.diag([1, 2]), names=["a", "b"]), label="Fisher matrix")
469
470        Add something to the plot that has a handle:
471
472        >>> handle, = fig["a"].plot([-1, 0, 1], [-1, 0, 1], color='red')
473
474        Finally, add the handle to the legend, and draw the legend:
475
476        >>> fig.add_artist_to_legend(handle, "linear function")
477        >>> _ = fig.legend() # the artist will now be shown correctly in the legend
478
479        Save it to a file:
480
481        >>> fig.savefig(
482        ... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure2d_add_artist_to_legend1.png",
483        ... dpi=150)
484

HjQ9pWeng6zWX89LUePHsUFF1yA+fPn480334TFYgnavn3/p3v37g3aPvWGdUx7rM/qM/pxQ/fBO5gefvhh/PGPf8QXX3zhn8ISTHL/UahXgZo5cyYA9Lry0uHDhwEA06dPV3VfaisqKsJ5552Hs88+G8uXLw9qBQQC/6fhvKpXMIVTHVMT67O6wuG4ETHNrnvvvRf//d//jTVr1igOKhs3bsTbb7/d7/388Ic/xCOPPNLjYwcPHgQAOBwOZGdnD63Ap3DOOecgNjYWO3fuhNPp7Pb4hg0bAATmL/ZlypQpGDt2LKqqqlBUVDSkfampsLAQZ599Ni688EKsWLFCUQGfffZZlJaWnnIfGzduRGZmpv9spCvf/+nEiRODU+gwFm51TE2sz+oJm+NGyBLyOuH1esVPfvITkZGRIXbt2tXt8ccee0wsXLhQcV9HR4dYunSpOP/888WxY8cUjy1cuFBMmTJFtLe3d9vXkiVLBABx2223BfUz9Ma3KtArr7yiuP/QoUPCarV2W5Fp586d4swzzxS/+tWvuu3rj3/8owAgHnzwQcX9dXV1IiUlRXcrMhUUFIi0tDRx99139ziwCV36ZdesWSPmzJkjXnzxRcXz1q5dKwCIt956q9s+9u/fLywWi7DZbGE9YG2owrmOqSmS67Nawum4EdbB2+v1iptvvlkAEKeffrr40Y9+1O1vypQp3Q4sW7Zs8Q/oePbZZxWPLVq0SAAQixcvFgUFBaKlpUWUlZWJhx9+WAAQM2fOFHV1dap8PpfLJebNmyfi4+PFu+++K1wul9ixY4eYOXOmSEhI6LYW8l133eX/XNXV1YrHPB6P+OEPfyisVqv405/+JJqbm0VRUZG44IILhM1m09VayFu2bBHJycnC4XD0+H/6ox/9qFslvPTSSwUAERcXp9jXunXrBACRkpIili1bJsrLy0VLS4tYs2aNmDRpkrBYLOIvf/mLyp/QOMK9jqkpUuuzWsLtuBHWwbuurq5fI2e7HlicTqeYM2eOGDlypNizZ4/iscrKSvHqq6+KCy+8UKSnpwur1Sri4+PF6aefLp555hnR0tKi4icUoqWlRTz++ONi/PjxIjo6WqSnp4sbb7xRHDp0qNtzv/jiC5GcnCyuvPLKHludHR0d4vnnnxfTpk0TdrtdpKSkiCuuuEJs27ZNjY/Sbz//+c8HPCL69ddfF/Hx8d2m4ni9XrF+/Xpx1113icmTJ4uYmBhhs9lEVlaWuOGGG8SWLVtU/nTGEgl1TE2RWJ/VEm7HDZMQBlkLjoiIiABE0IA1IiKicMHgTUREZDAM3kRERAbD4E1ERGQwDN5EREQGw+BNRERkMAzeREREBsPgTUREZDAM3kRERAbD4E1ERGQwDN5EREQGw+BNRGQAzz//PEwmk/9v3bp1WheJNMTgTURkAPfeey+EEMjPz9e6KKQDDN5EREQGw+BNRERkMAzeEaC1tRXLli3D5ZdfjjFjxiA6OhppaWm4/PLLsWnTJq2LR0SD9Oqrr2Lq1Kmw2+3IyMjAHXfcgaqqKq2LRSpg8I4AxcXFuPXWWxEbG4tVq1ahoaEBX375JaxWKxYsWIDPP/9c6yIS0QA99dRTOHToEFavXo2amho8/fTTWLFiBebPn4/6+nqti0chxuAdAex2O84880ysWLECubm5sNvtmDx5MlauXImUlBT84he/0LqIRDRALpcLzz33HDIyMhAbG4ulS5fi4YcfxoEDB/DII49oXTwKMQbvCJCTk4MNGzYgKipKcX9UVBQmTpyIgoICNDU1aVQ6IhqMG2+8sdt9119/PQBgxYoVaG9vV7tIpCIG7wjx7bff4pprrsHYsWMRFRXlnyv61VdfAQDq6uo0LiERDcTo0aO73Tdu3DhYrVY4nU4cOHBAg1KRWhi8I8Dbb7+NefPmYfv27fjLX/6C2tpaCCEghMDChQsBAF6vV+NSEtFAxMXFdbvPbDbDbrcDAPu9w5xV6wJQ6D366KMQQuC5557Dueeeq3VxiCgImpubu93n9XrR0tICAEhKSlK5RKQmnnlHgOLiYgBAXl5et8d8FZ2IjOXo0aPd7jt48CA8Hg/i4uIwYcIEDUpFamHwjgDZ2dkAgB07dijur62txZ49e7QoEhEN0VtvvdXtvpUrVwIA8vPzYbUysRrOGLwjwIMPPggAeOCBB/D555/D6XSisLAQ11xzDVwul8alI6LBqKurw0MPPYTKykq4XC4sX74cv/3tb5GXl4ennnpK6+JRiDF4R4Cf/OQneP/995GdnY1rr70WaWlpWLJkCa699losWLAAADBmzBgsWrRI24ISUa98VxVbsWKFfzsuLg5nnXUWkpOT8dBDD+Hmm2/G119/zf7uCGASQgitC0FERET9xzNvIiIig2HwJiIiMhgGbyIiIoNh8CYiIjIYBm8iIiKDYfAmIiIyGAZvIiIig2HwJiIiMhgGbyIiIoNh8CYiIjIYBm8iIiKDYfAmIiIyGAZvIiIig2HwJiIiMhgGbyIiIoNh8CYiIjIYBm8iIiKDYfAmIiIymP8P9EdofnYwH84AAAAASUVORK5CYII=">
486
487        Notes
488        -----
489        The limits of the plot are not updated automatically.
490        """
491        self.labels.append(label)
492        self.handles.append(artist)

Add a plotted artist to the legend.

Parameters
  • artist: the artist which we want to put on the legend
  • label (str): the label for the artist
Returns
  • None
Notes

This is a convenience function for correctly updating the legend after directly plotting some artist via <instance>[<name(s)>].<method>

Examples

Setup the plot:

>>> fig = FisherFigure1D()
>>> fig.plot(FisherMatrix(np.diag([1, 2]), names=["a", "b"]), label="Fisher matrix")

Add something to the plot that has a handle:

>>> handle, = fig["a"].plot([-1, 0, 1], [-1, 0, 1], color='red')

Finally, add the handle to the legend, and draw the legend:

>>> fig.add_artist_to_legend(handle, "linear function")
>>> _ = fig.legend() # the artist will now be shown correctly in the legend

Save it to a file:

>>> fig.savefig(
... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure2d_add_artist_to_legend1.png",
... dpi=150)

Notes

The limits of the plot are not updated automatically.

def set_label_params(self, which: str = 'both', **kwargs): 
494    def set_label_params(
495        self,
496        which: str = "both",
497        **kwargs,
498    ):
499        """
500        Set both x and y label parameters on all axes.
501
502        Parameters
503        ----------
504        which : {'both', 'x', 'y'}
505            which axis to change (default: 'both')
506
507        **kwargs
508            any keyword arguments that are also valid for <a
509            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/text_api.html#matplotlib.text.Text"
510            target="_blank" rel="noopener
511            noreferrer">``matplotlib.text.Text``</a>.
512
513        Returns
514        -------
515        None
516
517        Raises
518        ------
519        EmptyFigureError
520            if ``figure`` is not set
521
522        ValueError
523            if ``which`` is not one of the allowed values
524        """
525        if not self.figure:
526            raise EmptyFigureError
527
528        for nameiter in product(self.names, repeat=self._ndim):
529            # only set the parameters which are not empty (should this be done
530            # for all of them instead?)
531            if self[nameiter]:
532                _set_label_params(self[nameiter], which=which, **kwargs)

Set both x and y label parameters on all axes.

Parameters
  • which ({'both', 'x', 'y'}): which axis to change (default: 'both')
  • **kwargs: any keyword arguments that are also valid for matplotlib.text.Text.
Returns
  • None
Raises
  • EmptyFigureError: if figure is not set
  • ValueError: if which is not one of the allowed values
def set_tick_params(self, which: str = 'both', **kwargs): 
534    def set_tick_params(
535        self,
536        which: str = "both",
537        **kwargs,
538    ):
539        """
540        Set both x and y tick parameters on all axes.
541
542        Parameters
543        ----------
544        which : {'both', 'x', 'y'}
545            which axis to change (default: 'both')
546
547        **kwargs
548            any keyword arguments passed to the methods for handling tick
549            parameters (such as 'fontsize', 'rotation', etc.)
550
551        Returns
552        -------
553        None
554
555        Raises
556        ------
557        EmptyFigureError
558            if ``figure`` is not set
559
560        ValueError
561            if ``which`` is not one of the allowed values
562        """
563        if not self.figure:
564            raise EmptyFigureError
565
566        for nameiter in product(self.names, repeat=self._ndim):
567            if self[nameiter]:
568                _set_tick_params(self[nameiter], which=which, **kwargs)

Set both x and y tick parameters on all axes.

Parameters
  • which ({'both', 'x', 'y'}): which axis to change (default: 'both')
  • **kwargs: any keyword arguments passed to the methods for handling tick parameters (such as 'fontsize', 'rotation', etc.)
Returns
  • None
Raises
  • EmptyFigureError: if figure is not set
  • ValueError: if which is not one of the allowed values
def set_major_locator(self, locator: matplotlib.ticker.Locator, which: str = 'both'): 
570    def set_major_locator(
571        self,
572        locator: Locator,
573        which: str = "both",
574    ):
575        """
576        Set the major locator for all axes.
577
578        Parameters
579        ----------
580        locator
581            the instance of <a
582            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/ticker_api.html#matplotlib.ticker.Locator"
583            target="_blank" rel="noopener
584            noreferrer">``matplotlib.ticker.Locator``</a> to use.
585
586        which : {'both', 'x', 'y'}
587            which axis to change (default: 'both')
588
589        Returns
590        -------
591        None
592
593        Raises
594        ------
595        EmptyFigureError
596            if ``figure`` is not set
597        """
598        if not self.figure:
599            raise EmptyFigureError
600
601        for nameiter in product(self.names, repeat=self._ndim):
602            # for some reason, we cannot reuse the same instance, so we just
603            # make a deep copy of it instead
604            if (
605                self[nameiter]
606                and np.any(self[nameiter].get_xticks())
607                and which in ["both", "x"]
608            ):
609                xloc = copy.deepcopy(locator)
610                self[nameiter].xaxis.set_major_locator(xloc)
611            if (
612                self[nameiter]
613                and np.any(self[nameiter].get_yticks())
614                and which in ["both", "y"]
615            ):
616                yloc = copy.deepcopy(locator)
617                self[nameiter].yaxis.set_major_locator(yloc)

Set the major locator for all axes.

Parameters
  • locator: the instance of matplotlib.ticker.Locator to use.
  • which ({'both', 'x', 'y'}): which axis to change (default: 'both')
Returns
  • None
Raises
  • EmptyFigureError: if figure is not set
def set_minor_locator(self, locator: matplotlib.ticker.Locator, which: str = 'both'): 
619    def set_minor_locator(
620        self,
621        locator: Locator,
622        which: str = "both",
623    ):
624        """
625        Set the minor locator for all axes.
626
627        Parameters
628        ----------
629        locator
630            the instance of <a
631            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/ticker_api.html#matplotlib.ticker.Locator"
632            target="_blank" rel="noopener
633            noreferrer">``matplotlib.ticker.Locator``</a> to use.
634
635        which : {'both', 'x', 'y'}
636            which axis to change (default: 'both')
637
638        Returns
639        -------
640        None
641
642        Raises
643        ------
644        EmptyFigureError
645            if ``figure`` is not set
646        """
647        if not self.figure:
648            raise EmptyFigureError
649
650        for nameiter in product(self.names, repeat=self._ndim):
651            if (
652                self[nameiter]
653                and np.any(self[nameiter].get_xticks())
654                and which in ["both", "x"]
655            ):
656                # same reason as the major locator
657                xloc = copy.deepcopy(locator)
658                self[nameiter].xaxis.set_minor_locator(xloc)
659            if (
660                self[nameiter]
661                and np.any(self[nameiter].get_yticks())
662                and which in ["both", "y"]
663            ):
664                yloc = copy.deepcopy(locator)
665                self[nameiter].yaxis.set_minor_locator(yloc)

Set the minor locator for all axes.

Parameters
  • locator: the instance of matplotlib.ticker.Locator to use.
  • which ({'both', 'x', 'y'}): which axis to change (default: 'both')
Returns
  • None
Raises
  • EmptyFigureError: if figure is not set
def set_major_formatter(self, formatter: matplotlib.ticker.Formatter, which: str = 'both'): 
667    def set_major_formatter(
668        self,
669        formatter: Formatter,
670        which: str = "both",
671    ):
672        """
673        Set the major formatter for all axes.
674
675        Parameters
676        ----------
677        formatter
678            the instance of <a
679            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/ticker_api.html#matplotlib.ticker.Formatter"
680            target="_blank" rel="noopener
681            noreferrer">``matplotlib.ticker.Formatter``</a> to use.
682
683        which : {'both', 'x', 'y'}
684            which axis to change (default: 'both')
685
686        Returns
687        -------
688        None
689
690        Raises
691        ------
692        EmptyFigureError
693            if ``figure`` is not set
694        """
695        if not self.figure:
696            raise EmptyFigureError
697
698        for nameiter in product(self.names, repeat=self._ndim):
699            if self[nameiter] and which in ["both", "x"]:
700                self[nameiter].xaxis.set_major_formatter(formatter)
701            if self[nameiter] and which in ["both", "y"]:
702                self[nameiter].yaxis.set_major_formatter(formatter)

Set the major formatter for all axes.

Parameters
  • formatter: the instance of matplotlib.ticker.Formatter to use.
  • which ({'both', 'x', 'y'}): which axis to change (default: 'both')
Returns
  • None
Raises
  • EmptyFigureError: if figure is not set
def set_minor_formatter(self, formatter: matplotlib.ticker.Formatter, which: str = 'both'): 
704    def set_minor_formatter(
705        self,
706        formatter: Formatter,
707        which: str = "both",
708    ):
709        """
710        Set the minor formatter for all axes.
711
712        Parameters
713        ----------
714        formatter
715            the instance of <a
716            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/ticker_api.html#matplotlib.ticker.Formatter"
717            target="_blank" rel="noopener
718            noreferrer">``matplotlib.ticker.Formatter``</a> to use.
719
720        which : {'both', 'x', 'y'}
721            which axis to change (default: 'both')
722
723        Returns
724        -------
725        None
726
727        Raises
728        ------
729        EmptyFigureError
730            if ``figure`` is not set
731        """
732        if not self.figure:
733            raise EmptyFigureError
734
735        for nameiter in product(self.names, repeat=self._ndim):
736            if self[nameiter] and which in ["both", "x"]:
737                self[nameiter].xaxis.set_minor_formatter(formatter)
738            if self[nameiter] and which in ["both", "y"]:
739                self[nameiter].yaxis.set_minor_formatter(formatter)

Set the minor formatter for all axes.

Parameters
  • formatter: the instance of matplotlib.ticker.Formatter to use.
  • which ({'both', 'x', 'y'}): which axis to change (default: 'both')
Returns
  • None
Raises
  • EmptyFigureError: if figure is not set

class FisherBarFigure(FisherBaseFigure): 
 742class FisherBarFigure(FisherBaseFigure):
 743    """
 744    Container for plotting single-axis bar-like figures.
 745
 746    .. versionadded:: 0.6.0
 747    """
 748
 749    def _parse_fractional_constraints(
 750        self,
 751        args: Sequence[FisherMatrix],
 752        marginalized: bool = True,
 753        colors: Optional[Sequence[str]] = None,
 754        labels: Optional[Sequence[str]] = None,
 755        values_label: Optional[str] = None,
 756        percent: bool = False,
 757        space: float = 0.3,
 758        scale: str = "linear",
 759    ):
 760        # error handling
 761        if not 0 <= space <= 1:
 762            raise ValueError("The value of `space` must be in the open interval (0, 1)")
 763
 764        allowed_scales = ["linear", "log", "symlog"]
 765        if scale not in allowed_scales:
 766            raise ValueError(f"The value of `scale` must be one of: {allowed_scales}")
 767
 768        for arg in args:
 769            if set(args[0].names) != set(arg.names):
 770                raise MismatchingValuesError(
 771                    "parameter name",
 772                    args[0].names,
 773                    arg.names,
 774                )
 775
 776        # reordering to match the first one
 777        args = [arg.sort(key=args[0].names) for arg in args]
 778
 779        # total number of parameters in the Fisher objects
 780        size = len(args[0])
 781
 782        # the width or height of all columns for a single parameter
 783        total_space = 1 - space
 784
 785        # the width or height of a single column for a single parameter
 786        space_per_object = total_space / len(args)
 787
 788        if not colors:
 789            colors = list(islice(self.current_color, len(args)))  # type: ignore
 790        elif len(colors) != len(args):
 791            raise MismatchingSizeError(colors, args)
 792
 793        if not labels:
 794            labels = [""] * len(args)
 795        elif len(labels) != len(args):
 796            raise MismatchingSizeError(labels, args)
 797
 798        if not values_label:
 799            if percent:
 800                values_label = r"$\sigma / \theta_\mathrm{fid}\ (\%)$"
 801            else:
 802                values_label = r"$\sigma / \theta_\mathrm{fid}$"
 803
 804        return _TempContainer(
 805            labels,
 806            colors,  # type: ignore
 807            [
 808                [
 809                    _ - total_space / 2 + (2 * index + 1) * space_per_object / 2
 810                    for _ in range(size)
 811                ]
 812                for index, arg in enumerate(args)
 813            ],
 814            [
 815                np.array(
 816                    [
 817                        arg.constraints(name=_, marginalized=marginalized)[0]
 818                        for _ in arg.names
 819                    ]
 820                )
 821                / np.array(
 822                    [
 823                        np.abs(fid) if not np.isclose(fid, 0) else 1
 824                        for fid in arg.fiducials
 825                    ]
 826                )
 827                for index, arg in enumerate(args)
 828            ],
 829            space_per_object=space_per_object,
 830            values_label=values_label,
 831            scale=scale,
 832        )
 833
 834    def plot_absolute_constraints(
 835        self,
 836        args: Sequence[FisherMatrix],
 837        kind: str,
 838        marginalized: bool = True,
 839        colors: Optional[Sequence[str]] = None,
 840        labels: Optional[Sequence[str]] = None,
 841        values_label: Optional[str] = None,
 842        scale: str = "linear",
 843        space: float = 0.3,
 844        capsize: Optional[float] = None,
 845        **kwargs,
 846    ):
 847        r"""
 848        Make a plot of the constraints of the Fisher matrices.
 849
 850        Parameters
 851        ----------
 852        args : array_like of FisherMatrix
 853            the Fisher matrices for which we want to plot the constraints
 854
 855        kind : str, {'bar', 'barh', 'errorbar'}
 856            the kind of plot we want (vertical bar, horizontal bar, errorbar)
 857
 858        marginalized : bool, optional
 859            whether the marginalized or the unmarginalized constraints should
 860            be plotted (default: True)
 861
 862        colors : array_like of str, optional
 863            the colors to use for the plotting (default: default matplotlib
 864            colors)
 865
 866        labels : array_like of str, optional
 867            the labels for the Fisher matrices (default: None)
 868
 869        values_label : str, optional
 870            the label for the axis containing the constraints (default:
 871            ``$\theta_\mathrm{fid}$``)
 872
 873        scale : str, {'linear', 'log'}
 874            the scale used for the y axis (default: 'linear')
 875
 876        space : float, optional
 877            the space reserved between the bars (default: 0.3)
 878
 879        capsize : float, optional
 880            the width of the errorbars (default: none, that is, determined
 881            automatically)
 882
 883        **kwargs
 884            any keyword arguments passed to <a
 885            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/_as_gen/matplotlib.pyplot.bar.html"
 886            target="_blank" rel=noreferrer
 887            noopener>``matplotlib.pyplot.bar``</a>, or <a
 888            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/_as_gen/matplotlib.pyplot.barh.html"
 889            target="_blank" rel=noreferrer
 890            noopener>``matplotlib.pyplot.barh``</a>, or <a
 891            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/_as_gen/matplotlib.pyplot.errorbar.html"
 892            target="_blank" rel=noreferrer
 893            noopener>``matplotlib.pyplot.errorbar``</a>.
 894
 895        Returns
 896        -------
 897        None
 898
 899        Examples
 900        --------
 901        Define some Fisher matrices:
 902
 903        >>> fm1 = FisherMatrix(np.diag([1, 2, 3]) * 1e3, names=["a", "b", "c"], latex_names=[r'$\Omega_\mathrm{m}$', '$h$', "$n_s$"], fiducials=[0.3, 0.7, 0.96])
 904        >>> fm2 = FisherMatrix(np.diag([4, 5, 6]) * 1e3, names=["a", "b", "c"], latex_names=[r'$\Omega_\mathrm{m}$', '$h$', "$n_s$"], fiducials=[0.35, 0.67, 0.9])
 905
 906        Make a vertical bar plot:
 907
 908        >>> fig = FisherBarFigure()
 909        >>> fig.plot_absolute_constraints([fm1, fm2], 'bar', labels=['Fisher 1', 'Fisher 2'])
 910        >>> _ = fig.figure.legend()
 911
 912        Save it to a file:
 913
 914        >>> fig.savefig(
 915        ... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure_plot_absolute_constraints_bar.png",
 916        ... dpi=150)
 917
 918        <img width="100%"  919
 920        Make a horizontal bar plot:
 921
 922        >>> fig = FisherBarFigure()
 923        >>> fig.plot_absolute_constraints([fm1, fm2], 'barh', labels=['Fisher 1', 'Fisher 2'])
 924        >>> _ = fig.figure.legend()
 925
 926        Save it to a file:
 927
 928        >>> fig.savefig(
 929        ... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure_plot_absolute_constraints_barh.png",
 930        ... dpi=150)

 933
 934        Make an errobar plot:
 935
 936        >>> fig = FisherBarFigure()
 937        >>> fig.plot_absolute_constraints([fm1, fm2], 'errorbar', labels=['Fisher 1', 'Fisher 2'], capsize=4)
 938        >>> _ = fig.figure.legend()
 939
 940        Save it to a file:
 941
 942        >>> fig.savefig(
 943        ... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure_plot_absolute_constraints_errorbar.png",
 944        ... dpi=150)

VmZJJk7d26T1tkcK9eszZgfPZKHFy7d5NgP9O+ViWfum85lm/5nBgAA7V1bfD9n49rtTury5ctz/fXXp7y8PGPGjKnVN3DgwBxyyCGZO3du7rrrrkatd+211+ayyy6r0967d+/06tUrSfL66683ue62cOmv5zYqoCbJwwuX5tJfz2vhigAAAOrXbkPqtGnTUlVVlaFDh6Zbt251+keNGpUkmTJlSqPW22effbLLLrvUaf/rX/+aJUuWZJdddsngwYObVnQbeGXZyvzisb9v1pxfPPa8e1QBAIA20W5D6ob7TRs6fjtgwIBa4zZHdXV1Xnnlldxxxx0ZPXp09thjj/zyl79Mp06dtrzgNnLbo89nzdrNO9G9Zm11bvvT8y1UEQAAQMO2besCttRLL72UJDVHcd+pZ8+etcZtjne/+92ZP39+kuTkk0/O+PHjN/te1A1n299p/vz5GThw4GbXtKUae8z3nR5asCTnHLhHM1cDAACwce12J3X58uVJkvLy8nr7N+x6bhi3OZ599tm8/vrrmTlzZl599dXstddeufLKK7e82Db01qq3W3UeAABAU7TbndSKiookyerVq+vtX7VqVa1xm6tHjx750Ic+lLvvvjvvf//785WvfCW9e/du9KtoGno6WEM7rC2lW6ct+794S+cBAAA0RbvdSe3Tp0+SZOnS+o+zvvbaa0mSvn37Nuk62267bf793/89SXLDDTc0aa228IH+9R+H3pQPDti+mSsBAADYtHYbUocNG5YkWbhwYb39CxYsSJIMGTKkydfacD/qokWLmrxWaztpn11TVlqyWXPKSkty0vt3baGKAAAAGtZuQ+qBBx6Yrl27Zvbs2amqqqrTP3PmzCTJ6NGjN7nWjBkz0rlz57z66qv19r/44otJku23b3+7izt275wTRtR9tc7GnDBi1/Tu3v6eZAwAALR/7TakVlRUZOzYsVm1alUmTpxYq2/BggWZOnVqKisrc+SRR9a0z5kzJ/vtt18uuuiiWuPXrVuXVatW5de//nWd61RXV9es35jAW0QXH13Z6GO/H+jfKxcf3f7eBwsAAHQM7TakJsnFF1+ckSNH5oILLsjkyZOzYsWKzJ49O8cff3wqKioyadKklJaW1oyfMGFCHnzwwYwfPz5LliypaS8pWX8c9vOf/3yuvfbaPP/881mxYkVmzZqVE044IX/4wx8yYsSIfPWrX231z9gcOpeVZuKZ++YT+/Zr8OhvWWlJPrFvv0w8c990LiutdwwAAEBLK6murq5u6yKaYuXKlbn88sszadKk/O1vf0uPHj1y6KGH5rLLLsuAAQNqjZ06dWpOOumk7L///rn99ttrwml1dXX+8Ic/5H//93/z+9//PosWLcrKlSvTo0ePVFZW5oQTTshZZ53V4OtuNseGp/s29PTflrZ42ar8+I+Lcu20Z2vazj1oj5w+cndHfAEA2Oq09fdz6mr3IbW9KcK/BG+sWJOhl95b8/Osiw9Ljy5lbVYPAAC0lSJ8P6e2dn3cFwAAgI5FSAUAAKAwhFQAAAAKQ0gFAACgMIRUAAAACkNIBQAAoDCEVAAAAApDSAUAAKAwhFQAAAAKQ0gFAACgMIRUAAAACkNIBQAAoDC2besCaDnLV7/dqPblq99OWWlJnXEV5X57AAAArUsK6cAGf+2eRo0bOX5ave2Lvn1Uc5YDAACwSY77AgAAUBh2UjuweZd9pK1LAAAA2CxCagfmnlIAAKC9cdwXAACAwhBSAQAAKAwhFQAAgMIQUgEAACgMIRUAAIDCEFIBAAAoDCEVAACAwhBSAQAAKAwhFQAAgMIQUgEAACgMIRUAAIDCEFIBAAAoDCEVAACAwhBSAQAAKAwhFQAAgMIQUgEAACgMIRUAAIDCEFIBAAAoDCEVAACAwhBSAQAAKAwhFQAAgMIoqa6urm7rIrYm3bt3z5o1azJw4MC2LgUAALZ68+fPT1lZWZYtW9bWpfD/s5Payrp27ZqysrK2LqPDmD9/fubPn9/WZQBbIX/+AG3Fnz/Nq6ysLF27dm3rMvgXdlJp1yorK5Mkc+fObeNKgK2NP3+AtuLPHzo6O6kAAAAUhpAKAABAYQipAAAAFIaQCgAAQGEIqQAAABSGp/sCAABQGHZSAQAAKAwhFQAAgMIQUgEAACgMIRUAAIDCEFIBAAAoDCEVAACAwhBSAQAAKIxt27oAAGgvli9fnj/96U959dVX8/rrr+fMM89s65IAoMMpqa6urm7rIgCgPXjmmWfy/e9/Pz/4wQ+y44475umnn27rkgCgwxFSKaS33347t956a6ZOnZqddtopnTp1SlVVVV544YUceeSROfXUU7Pttg4CAG2jb9++Ofroo/P973+/rUsBgA7Ht3wK56mnnsoxxxyT3r1751e/+lW23377mr6XX345o0ePzre//e386le/yqBBg9qwUmBr9Je//CUvvfRS9t9//7YuBQA6JDupFMrLL7+c97znPVmzZk2eeeaZ9O7du86YF154IXvvvXe6dOmSJ598st4xAC3lxhtvzNlnn52//e1v2XXXXdu6HKADuvfee/OrX/0qTz75ZK666qrssMMOufbaa7PtttvmL3/5S/r375/vfOc7KSkpaetSoUXYSaVQvvWtb+XVV1/NWWed1WD43HnnnXPCCSfk5ptvzje/+c1cffXVrVsksFWbPn16+vfvL6ACLWLt2rWZPHlyJkyYkBNOOCGf/vSnM3LkyFx++eXp1q1bXnvttfTq1Ssf/ehHc9BBB7V1udAihFQKZebMmUmSoUOHbnTc8OHDc/PNN9eMB2gN1dXV+f3vf58jjjgiV199dZ5//vmsXbs2s2bNyg9/+MMMGDCgrUsE2rmZM2fmQx/6UJL1txesXbs23/nOd9K5c+ck658yniRLlixpsxqhpQmpFMqqVasaNa60tDRJsnr16pYsB6CWJ598MosXL86jjz6az3/+83nf+96XJDniiCNyySWX5Mc//nEbVwi0d3vuuWdGjBiRl19+OXPnzs31119fE1CT5LHHHkuy6b/Qh/Zsm7YuAP7V8OHDkyTz58/f6Lhnn302STJy5MgWrwlgg+nTpydJrrnmmpqAmiTl5eV59dVX26osoAPp06dPunbtmmnTpiVJDj744Fr9P//5z7Pnnntmzz33bIvyoFUIqRTKuHHjUlpamvvuu2+j46ZNm5aysrKMGzeulSoDWP9nT2VlZQ499NBa7Y888kgqKyvbqCqgI/rd736XXXfdtdabDN58883ccccdOeWUU5L88y/tk2TGjBm57LLLct111+WSSy6JZ6PSngmpFMrQoUNz3nnnZdasWXnmmWfqHTN//vzMmjUrY8eOzbvf/e5WrhDYWq1bty4zZsyos6vx0EMP5aWXXsrhhx/eRpUBHdHvfve7On/e/PSnP01VVVXGjBmT6urqXH755UmSNWvW5KKLLsrXvva1/Pu//3tuvPHGvPXWW21RNjQLIZXCueyyy7LHHnvkpz/9ab39P/3pT7P77rvn61//eitXBmzNnnjiibz22mv1fmncYYcdsv/+++f111/3MBOgyebPn59FixblkEMOqdU+b968DB06NLvttltuvvnmnHTSSUnW77D+6U9/yje/+c0888wz+fOf/5zu3bu3RenQLIRUCmPVqlV56qmn0qVLl1x//fX52c9+Vu+4n/zkJ5kwYUK6du2ap556KqtWrcqdd96ZIUOG5LTTTsutt96a66+/Pp/4xCfy6KOP5sc//nFuuOGGnH766Xn00Udb+VMBHcW0adNSWlqa/fffv6Zt3bp1+elPf5qTTz452267bb73ve/VPHkTYEs9//zz6devX50TGmeddVY6deqUcePGZfXq1TW3Hmy//fa54oorMnHixLz3ve/NPffc0xZlQ7MRUimMsrKymneeHnbYYRkwYECdByj99a9/zcCBA3PYYYclWf/wkrKyshx11FEZO3Zspk+fng996EM555xzcuKJJ+bkk0/Ofvvtl7PPPjsf+9jHcuWVV7b2xwI6iOnTp2fEiBHp0aNHTdvrr7+exYsX57DDDsvrr7+epUuXen8q0GQHHHBAnnvuuWy//fa12vfee+889NBD+c53vpOzzjqrpv3111/P5z73ufz1r3/NpEmTcvvtt7d2ydCsvIKGwthmm23yj3/8I1deeWV69+6dnXbaKQ8++GAGDhxYM+aPf/xjdt5559xyyy1ZvHhx/vGPf2Sbbdb/XUt5eXne9a531Yzv1atXevbsWfPz9ttvn8WLF7f+BwM6hNdffz1jxoyp1darV6988YtfzA9/+MPcd999+da3vtVG1QFbq2effTZ77bVXli5dmu222y69evVyjzztnpBKoQwaNChf+cpXav38rxYvXpwJEyZkwoQJSZIvf/nLtfrfef/FO3/2pDtgS82cObPe9u985zutXAnAP/Xt2zdf/epXc9ttt+WNN97ImjVrcsEFF7R1WdAkQiqFcuWVV270SO6XvvSlfOlLX2rFigAAiqtr16659NJL27oMaFbuSQUAAKAwhFQ6hDvvvDPXXntt/vznP+eiiy7KQw89lEsuuaTBnwEAgGIqqXaTHgAAAAVhJxUAAIDCEFIBAAAoDCEVAACAwhBSAQAAKAwhFQAAgMIQUgEAACgMIRUAAIDCEFIBAAAoDCEVAACAwhBSAQAAKAwhFQAAgMIQUgEAACgMIRUAAIDCEFIBAAAoDCEVAACAwhBSAQAAKIz/D2U2C5R1QCk7AAAAAElFTkSuQmCC">
 947        """
 948        size = len(args[0])
 949        latex_names = args[0].latex_names
 950
 951        # error handling
 952        if not 0 <= space <= 1:
 953            raise ValueError("The value of `space` must be in the open interval (0, 1)")
 954
 955        allowed_scales = ["linear", "log"]
 956        if scale not in allowed_scales:
 957            raise ValueError(f"The value of `scale` must be one of: {allowed_scales}")
 958
 959        for arg in args:
 960            if set(args[0].names) != set(arg.names):
 961                raise MismatchingValuesError(
 962                    "parameter name",
 963                    args[0].names,
 964                    arg.names,
 965                )
 966
 967        # reordering to match the first one
 968        args = [arg.sort(key=args[0].names) for arg in args]
 969
 970        # the width or height of all columns for a single parameter
 971        total_space = 1 - space
 972
 973        # the width or height of a single column for a single parameter
 974        space_per_object = total_space / len(args)
 975
 976        if not colors:
 977            colors = list(islice(self.current_color, len(args)))  # type: ignore
 978        elif len(colors) != len(args):
 979            raise MismatchingSizeError(colors, args)
 980
 981        if not labels:
 982            labels = [""] * len(args)
 983        elif len(labels) != len(args):
 984            raise MismatchingSizeError(labels, args)
 985
 986        if not values_label:
 987            values_label = r"$\theta_\mathrm{fid}$"
 988
 989        x_array = [
 990            [
 991                _ - total_space / 2 + (2 * index + 1) * space_per_object / 2
 992                for _ in range(size)
 993            ]
 994            for index, arg in enumerate(args)
 995        ]
 996        y_array = [arg.fiducials for arg in args]
 997        yerr_array = [
 998            np.array(
 999                [
1000                    arg.constraints(name=_, marginalized=marginalized)[0]
1001                    for _ in arg.names
1002                ]
1003            )
1004            for index, arg in enumerate(args)
1005        ]
1006
1007        # TODO: maybe put this in a class so validation is easier
1008        options = {
1009            "bar": {
1010                "parameters_scale": "x",
1011                "values_scale": "y",
1012                "error_name": "yerr",
1013                "extra_kwargs": {
1014                    "capsize": total_space * 60 / len(args) / size,
1015                    "width": space_per_object,
1016                },
1017            },
1018            "barh": {
1019                "parameters_scale": "y",
1020                "values_scale": "x",
1021                "error_name": "xerr",
1022                "extra_kwargs": {
1023                    "capsize": total_space * 60 / len(args) / size,
1024                    "height": space_per_object,
1025                },
1026            },
1027            "errorbar": {
1028                "parameters_scale": "x",
1029                "values_scale": "y",
1030                "error_name": "yerr",
1031                "extra_kwargs": {
1032                    "capsize": total_space * 120 / len(args) / size,
1033                    "ls": kwargs.pop("ls", ""),
1034                    "marker": kwargs.pop("marker", "o"),
1035                },
1036            },
1037        }
1038
1039        if capsize is not None:
1040            options[kind]["extra_kwargs"]["capsize"] = capsize  # type: ignore
1041
1042        with plt.rc_context(self.options):
1043            fig, ax = plt.subplots()
1044            for color, label, x, y, yerr in zip(
1045                colors,  # type: ignore
1046                labels,
1047                x_array if kind != "barh" else reversed(x_array),
1048                y_array,
1049                yerr_array,
1050            ):
1051                getattr(ax, kind)(
1052                    x,
1053                    y if kind != "barh" else list(reversed(y)),
1054                    color=color,
1055                    label=label,
1056                    **{
1057                        options[kind]["error_name"]: yerr
1058                        if kind != "barh"
1059                        else list(reversed(yerr))
1060                    },
1061                    **options[kind]["extra_kwargs"],
1062                    **kwargs,
1063                )
1064
1065            ax.set_yscale(scale)
1066
1067            getattr(ax, f'set_{options[kind]["parameters_scale"]}ticks')(range(size))
1068            getattr(ax, f'set_{options[kind]["parameters_scale"]}ticklabels')(
1069                latex_names if kind != "barh" else reversed(latex_names)
1070            )
1071            getattr(ax, f'set_{options[kind]["values_scale"]}label')(values_label)
1072
1073        self._figure = fig
1074        self._axes = ax
1075
1076    def plot_relative_constraints(
1077        self,
1078        args: Sequence[FisherMatrix],
1079        kind: str,
1080        marginalized: bool = True,
1081        colors: Optional[Sequence[str]] = None,
1082        labels: Optional[Sequence[str]] = None,
1083        values_label: Optional[str] = None,
1084        scale: str = "linear",
1085        space: float = 0.3,
1086        percent: bool = False,
1087        **kwargs,
1088    ):
1089        r"""
1090        Make a plot of the constraints (relative to the fiducial) of the Fisher matrices.
1091
1092        Parameters
1093        ----------
1094        args : array_like of FisherMatrix
1095            the Fisher matrices for which we want to plot the constraints
1096
1097        kind : str, {'bar', 'barh', 'errorbar'}
1098            the kind of plot we want (vertical bar, horizontal bar, errorbar)
1099
1100        marginalized : bool, optional
1101            whether the marginalized or the unmarginalized constraints should
1102            be plotted (default: True)
1103
1104        colors : array_like of str, optional
1105            the colors to use for the plotting (default: default matplotlib
1106            colors)
1107
1108        labels : array_like of str, optional
1109            the labels for the Fisher matrices (default: None)
1110
1111        values_label : str, optional
1112            the label for the values, that is, the y axis (default: ``$\sigma / \theta_\mathrm{fid}$`` if ``percent`` is false, otherwise ``$\sigma / \theta_\mathrm{fid}\ (\%)$``
1113
1114        scale : str, {'linear', 'log'}
1115            the scale used for the y axis (default: 'linear')
1116
1117        space : float, optional
1118            the space reserved between the bars (default: 0.3)
1119
1120        percent : bool, optional
1121            whether to plot in percentage units (default: false)
1122
1123        **kwargs
1124            any keyword arguments passed to
1125            <a
1126            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/_as_gen/matplotlib.pyplot.bar.html"
1127            target="_blank" rel=noreferrer noopener>``matplotlib.pyplot.bar``</a>
1128
1129        Returns
1130        -------
1131        None
1132
1133        Examples
1134        --------
1135        Define some Fisher matrices:
1136
1137        >>> fm1 = FisherMatrix(np.diag([1, 2, 3]) * 1e3, names=["a", "b", "c"], latex_names=[r'$\Omega_\mathrm{m}$', '$h$', "$n_s$"], fiducials=[0.3, 0.7, 0.96])
1138        >>> fm2 = FisherMatrix(np.diag([4, 5, 6]) * 1e3, names=["a", "b", "c"], latex_names=[r'$\Omega_\mathrm{m}$', '$h$', "$n_s$"], fiducials=[0.35, 0.67, 0.9])
1139
1140        Make a vertical bar plot:
1141
1142        >>> fig = FisherBarFigure()
1143        >>> fig.plot_relative_constraints([fm1, fm2], 'bar', labels=['Fisher 1', 'Fisher 2'])
1144        >>> _ = fig.figure.legend()
1145
1146        Save it to a file:
1147
1148        >>> fig.savefig(
1149        ... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure_plot_relative_constraints_bar.png",
1150        ... dpi=150)
1151
1152        <img width="100%" src="data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAA8sAAAK4CAYAAABDMG90AAAAOXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBNYXRwbG90bGliIHZlcnNpb24zLjcuMSwgaHR0cHM6Ly9tYXRwbG90bGliLm9yZy/bCgiHAAAACXBIWXMAABcSAAAXEgFnn9JSAABIn0lEQVR4nO3de5yXZZ0//tcwMAwzIHEUJI+YaOMyKGWZfFPT6IDHSLAMYd1dm0zXjJY89EtWO5jaqpkiVAvmqmlfLN10rVzIA6SlKCgeQoQ0CkUQRWQ4zu8Pgy9zzyADzDAIz+fjweMh133d1/W+x/nczGuu+1BSV1dXFwAAAGCDNq1dAAAAAOxohGUAAAAoEJYBAACgQFgGAACAAmEZAAAACoRlAAAAKBCWAQAAoKBtaxcAAACwXl1dXerq6lq7DHYiJSUlKSkp2eL9hGUAAKBVrV27NosXL86yZcuyatWq1i6HnVBZWVk6deqUbt26pbS0tEn7lNT5tQ0AANBK1q5dmxdffDG1tbWtXQq7gPLy8uy1115NCsxWlgEAgFazePHi1NbWprS0NLvvvnsqKyvTpo1HK9F81q1bl+XLl+fll19ObW1tFi9enJ49e252P2EZAABoNcuWLUuS7L777uncuXMrV8POqE2bNhu+t/76179m2bJlTQrLfmUDAAC0irq6ug33KFdWVrZyNezs1n+PrVq1qkkPkROWAQCAVrFxYHHpNS1t4+8xYRkAAAC2grAMAAAABcIyAAAAFAjLAAAAUCAsAwAA7EBKSkre8c9RRx2VJBk7dmxKSkoyadKkrZ5rn332SUlJSfMU3kKWL1+em266Keecc04+9KEPpX379ikpKcnYsWNbdF7vWQYAAHZo+5x/d2uX0CTzLxvSrOONHDmy0fYDDzywWefZ0c2ZMyenn376dp9XWAYAANgBbW7F+Oyzz86pp56a3r17b5+CWkmnTp3yT//0T/ngBz+YD37wg7n77rvzzW9+s8XnFZYBAADehbp3757u3bu3dhktrm/fvvnxj3+84e+/+c1vtsu87lkGAAB4F9rUPctvvvlmvvvd76a6ujqdO3dOx44d07dv35xyyin59a9/vcnxfvzjH6d///7p0KFDevXqlS9+8YtZunRpo33XrFmTcePG5fDDD89uu+2WDh06ZMCAAbn66quzZs2aBv3X3xtdV1eXa6+9NtXV1amoqMiAAQO24SvQsqwsAwAA7CTWrl2bY489No888ki6d++eo446KuXl5fnLX/6Se+65J5WVlfnEJz7RYL8xY8bkmmuuyVFHHZX9998/06ZNy4QJE/LMM8/k/vvvr/cQsBUrVmTIkCGZOnVqunbtmg9/+MMpLy/PI488kvPOOy9Tp07NL37xi7Rp03BttqamJhMnTsyRRx6Zgw46KKtWrWrRr8e2EJYBAAB2Eg888EAeeeSRfPCDH8wDDzyQ8vLyDdveeOONzJkzp9H9brrppsyaNSv9+vVLkrz66qs5/PDD8+CDD2bq1Kn52Mc+tqHv1772tUydOjXDhw/P+PHj07lz5yTJsmXLcuqpp+auu+7KhAkTUlNT02CeO+64I48//niqqqqa87BbhMuwAQAAdkCbenXU/PnzN7nPokWLkiRHHHFEvaCcJLvttlsGDhzY6H6XXnrphqCcvH0/9Pqw+8ADD2xof+WVV/KjH/0oe+65ZyZOnLghKCdvP4jrJz/5ScrKyjJu3LhG5/n617/+rgjKiZVlAACAHdKmXh3VsWPHTe4zYMCAtGnTJhMnTsz73//+fOYzn0m3bt02O9fgwYMbtB1wwAFJkr/97W8b2n73u99l9erV+eQnP5kOHTo02KdXr1553/velyeffDIrVqxo0OeEE07YbC07CmEZAABgB7S5V0c15oADDsjll1+eCy64IGeeeWZqampy8MEH55hjjsmoUaPSv3//Rvd773vf26CtU6dOSZKVK1duaFu/q 1153
1154        Make a horizontal bar plot:
1155
1156        >>> fig = FisherBarFigure()
1157        >>> fig.plot_relative_constraints([fm1, fm2], 'barh', labels=['Fisher 1', 'Fisher 2'])
1158        >>> _ = fig.figure.legend()
1159
1160        Save it to a file:
1161
1162        >>> fig.savefig(
1163        ... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure_plot_relative_constraints_barh.png",
1164        ... dpi=150)
1165

69f+vbtmx/96Ecbs0wA6FE8QQSgW7r77rvz3ve+N42Njautu//++3PppZdmxowZHZYvWLAgs2bN2lglAkCPIyACsNG0tLSkKIoOy3r37p26utUHtFx11VU5+eSTOz3Ol7/85Rx00EEZM2ZM+7I//elPWbx4cdra2ipbNABsQgwxBWCDmjFjRg4//PA0Nzenqakpffr06fBz+OGHr7bPwoULM2PGjOy5556rrfvVr36Vn//856vNTXzggQeSZJ3mHy5btiyzZ8/Os88+u9b7AkBP4gkiABvMLbfcko9//OOZOHFifvjDH2bhwoU566yzsuWWW+bf//3fkyQ77rjjavvdcMMNa3wb6Q9+8IPU1dXlsssuy5QpU9qXP/LII0mSd77zne3Lvve972XOnDm54447Mnjw4IwZMyaTJ09e7ZgPPfRQzjzzzLzjHe/IFVdcsR5XDAC1TUAEYIOYMWNGjjnmmFx44YX59Kc/3b585cqVmThxYnbZZZdO5xcmyX/913/l8ssv73TdPffck1122SU/+clP2pcVRZEtt9wyAwYMyLvf/e4kyfTp0/Of//mfefjhh/Pcc89l9OjRGTFiRKfH3HfffXPSSSe1P4UEgE2VgAjABvGFL3whu+66a4dwmCQDBw5Ma2tr5s+f3+lw0GeeeSatra3ZbrvtVlvX1taWxx57LJ/97Gc7LP/1r3+dF198Mccdd1x76Jw+fXre+ta3plQq5dJLL33TejubBwkAmxq/DQGouDlz5uSuu+7KxIkTV1v3yCOPZPDgwRk2bFin+1599dX5xCc+0em6uXPnZuXKlRk7dmyH5VdddVWS5POf/3z7sra2tpRKpSTJq6++moceeijTpk1bh6sBgE2HJ4gAVNysWbPS1taWd73rXR2WF0WR66+/Psccc8wan9jdcMMNuf/++ztd16tXryTJlltu2b5s2bJlueaaa/LRj340u+yyS5Lkpz/9af77v/87zz33XM4444wceeSR+dKXvpTtttuufY7hCy+8kG984xvtcyBnzpy5XtcMAD2BgAhAxb3lLW9JqVRKfX19h+VXXXVV5s6dm7PPPrvT/R5++OHsuOOOGTRoUKfrBw0alIEDB6Z3797tyy6++OL06dMnF1xwQfuyfffdN88991zuu+++/L//9/+SJMcff3z7HMOWlpbsv//+ufLKK9tD7JlnnpmFCxeu8zUDQE9giCkAFfeWt7wlxx13XIe5fzfccEPOOeec3H333WscXnrVVVfluOOOe8NjH3rooXnssceSvP4inG9/+9u56aab1vgCmlX+9onl//zP/2Tu3LkdnnCOGjXqTa8LAHo6TxAB2CAuv/zyfOc738nnPve5JMkOO+yQ3/zmN2lubu50+xUrVuTee+/t8CSwM+edd14++9nPZtasWXnxxRczderU7LDDDmtV28yZM7PVVlut1T4AsCkQEAHYIOrr63Pqqad2efs77rgj+++/fxoa3vhX0/Dhw3PTTTetV23bbLON4aQA0AlDTAHoFroyvLRSDj300LS2tubRRx9tX/bYY49l2bJlG+X8ANBdeYIIQNW9+uqrefrpp1d76+m6+vGPf5zJkyfn+eefzwknnJBDDz00F1xwQV588cV85zvfycknn5y77747X//617Prrrumrq4uvXv3zv3335/zzjsvX/jCFypSBwDUmlJRFEW1iwBg03bxxRdnwYIF+eIXv1jtUgBgk2aIKQBVd++99+bjH/94tcsAgE2eJ4gAAAAk8QQRAACAMgERAACAJAIiAAAAZQIiAAAASQREAAAAygREAAAAkgiIAAAAlAmIAAAAJBEQAQAAKBMQAQAASCIgAgAAUCYgAgAAkERABAAAoExABAAAIImACAAAQJmACAAAQJLk/wP3NXmDDi68PAAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==">
1167        """
1168        size = len(args[0])
1169        latex_names = args[0].latex_names
1170
1171        computed_parameters = self._parse_fractional_constraints(
1172            args,
1173            marginalized=marginalized,
1174            colors=colors,
1175            labels=labels,
1176            scale=scale,
1177            space=space,
1178            values_label=values_label,
1179            percent=percent,
1180        )
1181
1182        # TODO: maybe put this in a class so validation is easier
1183        options = {
1184            "bar": {
1185                "parameters_scale": "x",
1186                "values_scale": "y",
1187                "lines_prefix": "h",
1188                "extra_kwargs": {
1189                    "width": computed_parameters.space_per_object,
1190                },
1191            },
1192            "barh": {
1193                "parameters_scale": "y",
1194                "values_scale": "x",
1195                "lines_prefix": "v",
1196                "extra_kwargs": {
1197                    "height": computed_parameters.space_per_object,
1198                },
1199            },
1200        }
1201
1202        with plt.rc_context(self.options):
1203            fig, ax = plt.subplots()
1204            for color, label, x, y in zip(
1205                computed_parameters.colors,
1206                computed_parameters.labels,
1207                computed_parameters.x_array
1208                if kind != "barh"
1209                else reversed(computed_parameters.x_array),
1210                computed_parameters.y_array,
1211            ):
1212                getattr(ax, kind)(
1213                    x,
1214                    (y * 100 if percent else y)
1215                    if kind != "barh"
1216                    else list(reversed(y * 100 if percent else y)),
1217                    color=color,
1218                    label=label,
1219                    **options[kind]["extra_kwargs"],
1220                    **kwargs,
1221                )
1222                getattr(ax, kind)(
1223                    x,
1224                    -(y * 100 if percent else y)
1225                    if kind != "barh"
1226                    else list(reversed(-y * 100 if percent else -y)),
1227                    color=color,
1228                    label=None,
1229                    **options[kind]["extra_kwargs"],
1230                    **kwargs,
1231                )
1232
1233            limits = getattr(ax, f'get_{options[kind]["parameters_scale"]}lim')()
1234
1235            getattr(ax, f'{options[kind]["lines_prefix"]}lines')(
1236                0, limits[0], limits[-1], color="black", ls="--"
1237            )
1238            getattr(ax, f'set_{options[kind]["parameters_scale"]}lim')(*limits)
1239            getattr(ax, f'set_{options[kind]["values_scale"]}scale')(
1240                computed_parameters.scale
1241            )
1242
1243            getattr(ax, f'set_{options[kind]["parameters_scale"]}ticks')(range(size))
1244            getattr(ax, f'set_{options[kind]["parameters_scale"]}ticklabels')(
1245                latex_names if kind != "barh" else reversed(latex_names)
1246            )
1247            getattr(ax, f'set_{options[kind]["values_scale"]}label')(
1248                computed_parameters.values_label
1249            )
1250
1251        self._figure = fig
1252        self._axes = ax
1253
1254    def set_label_params(
1255        self,
1256        which: str = "both",
1257        **kwargs,
1258    ):
1259        """
1260        Set both x and y label parameters.
1261
1262        .. versionadded:: 0.10.4
1263
1264        Parameters
1265        ----------
1266        which : {'both', 'x', 'y'}
1267            which axis to change (default: 'both')
1268
1269        **kwargs
1270            any keyword arguments that are also valid for <a
1271            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/text_api.html#matplotlib.text.Text"
1272            target="_blank" rel="noopener
1273            noreferrer">``matplotlib.text.Text``</a>.
1274
1275        Returns
1276        -------
1277        None
1278
1279        Raises
1280        ------
1281        EmptyFigureError
1282            if ``figure`` is not set
1283
1284        ValueError
1285            if ``which`` is not one of the allowed values
1286        """
1287        if not self.figure:
1288            raise EmptyFigureError
1289
1290        _set_label_params(self.axes, which=which, **kwargs)
1291
1292    def set_tick_params(
1293        self,
1294        which: str = "both",
1295        **kwargs,
1296    ):
1297        """
1298        Set both x and y tick parameters.
1299
1300        .. versionadded:: 0.10.4
1301
1302        Parameters
1303        ----------
1304        which : {'both', 'x', 'y'}
1305            which axis to change (default: 'both')
1306
1307        **kwargs
1308            any keyword arguments passed to the methods for handling tick
1309            parameters (such as 'fontsize', 'rotation', etc.)
1310
1311        Returns
1312        -------
1313        None
1314
1315        Raises
1316        ------
1317        EmptyFigureError
1318            if ``figure`` is not set
1319
1320        ValueError
1321            if ``which`` is not one of the allowed values
1322        """
1323        if not self.figure:
1324            raise EmptyFigureError
1325
1326        _set_tick_params(self.axes, which=which, **kwargs)

Container for plotting single-axis bar-like figures.

New in version 0.6.0.

def plot_absolute_constraints( self, args: collections.abc.Sequence[fitk.tensors.FisherMatrix], kind: str, marginalized: bool = True, colors: Optional[collections.abc.Sequence[str]] = None, labels: Optional[collections.abc.Sequence[str]] = None, values_label: Optional[str] = None, scale: str = 'linear', space: float = 0.3, capsize: Optional[float] = None, **kwargs): 
 834    def plot_absolute_constraints(
 835        self,
 836        args: Sequence[FisherMatrix],
 837        kind: str,
 838        marginalized: bool = True,
 839        colors: Optional[Sequence[str]] = None,
 840        labels: Optional[Sequence[str]] = None,
 841        values_label: Optional[str] = None,
 842        scale: str = "linear",
 843        space: float = 0.3,
 844        capsize: Optional[float] = None,
 845        **kwargs,
 846    ):
 847        r"""
 848        Make a plot of the constraints of the Fisher matrices.
 849
 850        Parameters
 851        ----------
 852        args : array_like of FisherMatrix
 853            the Fisher matrices for which we want to plot the constraints
 854
 855        kind : str, {'bar', 'barh', 'errorbar'}
 856            the kind of plot we want (vertical bar, horizontal bar, errorbar)
 857
 858        marginalized : bool, optional
 859            whether the marginalized or the unmarginalized constraints should
 860            be plotted (default: True)
 861
 862        colors : array_like of str, optional
 863            the colors to use for the plotting (default: default matplotlib
 864            colors)
 865
 866        labels : array_like of str, optional
 867            the labels for the Fisher matrices (default: None)
 868
 869        values_label : str, optional
 870            the label for the axis containing the constraints (default:
 871            ``$\theta_\mathrm{fid}$``)
 872
 873        scale : str, {'linear', 'log'}
 874            the scale used for the y axis (default: 'linear')
 875
 876        space : float, optional
 877            the space reserved between the bars (default: 0.3)
 878
 879        capsize : float, optional
 880            the width of the errorbars (default: none, that is, determined
 881            automatically)
 882
 883        **kwargs
 884            any keyword arguments passed to <a
 885            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/_as_gen/matplotlib.pyplot.bar.html"
 886            target="_blank" rel=noreferrer
 887            noopener>``matplotlib.pyplot.bar``</a>, or <a
 888            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/_as_gen/matplotlib.pyplot.barh.html"
 889            target="_blank" rel=noreferrer
 890            noopener>``matplotlib.pyplot.barh``</a>, or <a
 891            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/_as_gen/matplotlib.pyplot.errorbar.html"
 892            target="_blank" rel=noreferrer
 893            noopener>``matplotlib.pyplot.errorbar``</a>.
 894
 895        Returns
 896        -------
 897        None
 898
 899        Examples
 900        --------
 901        Define some Fisher matrices:
 902
 903        >>> fm1 = FisherMatrix(np.diag([1, 2, 3]) * 1e3, names=["a", "b", "c"], latex_names=[r'$\Omega_\mathrm{m}$', '$h$', "$n_s$"], fiducials=[0.3, 0.7, 0.96])
 904        >>> fm2 = FisherMatrix(np.diag([4, 5, 6]) * 1e3, names=["a", "b", "c"], latex_names=[r'$\Omega_\mathrm{m}$', '$h$', "$n_s$"], fiducials=[0.35, 0.67, 0.9])
 905
 906        Make a vertical bar plot:
 907
 908        >>> fig = FisherBarFigure()
 909        >>> fig.plot_absolute_constraints([fm1, fm2], 'bar', labels=['Fisher 1', 'Fisher 2'])
 910        >>> _ = fig.figure.legend()
 911
 912        Save it to a file:
 913
 914        >>> fig.savefig(
 915        ... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure_plot_absolute_constraints_bar.png",
 916        ... dpi=150)
 917

 919
 920        Make a horizontal bar plot:
 921
 922        >>> fig = FisherBarFigure()
 923        >>> fig.plot_absolute_constraints([fm1, fm2], 'barh', labels=['Fisher 1', 'Fisher 2'])
 924        >>> _ = fig.figure.legend()
 925
 926        Save it to a file:
 927
 928        >>> fig.savefig(
 929        ... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure_plot_absolute_constraints_barh.png",
 930        ... dpi=150)

 933
 934        Make an errobar plot:
 935
 936        >>> fig = FisherBarFigure()
 937        >>> fig.plot_absolute_constraints([fm1, fm2], 'errorbar', labels=['Fisher 1', 'Fisher 2'], capsize=4)
 938        >>> _ = fig.figure.legend()
 939
 940        Save it to a file:
 941
 942        >>> fig.savefig(
 943        ... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure_plot_absolute_constraints_errorbar.png",
 944        ... dpi=150)

VmZJJk7d26T1tkcK9eszZgfPZKHFy7d5NgP9O+ViWfum85lm/5nBgAA7V1bfD9n49rtTury5ctz/fXXp7y8PGPGjKnVN3DgwBxyyCGZO3du7rrrrkatd+211+ayyy6r0967d+/06tUrSfL66683ue62cOmv5zYqoCbJwwuX5tJfz2vhigAAAOrXbkPqtGnTUlVVlaFDh6Zbt251+keNGpUkmTJlSqPW22effbLLLrvUaf/rX/+aJUuWZJdddsngwYObVnQbeGXZyvzisb9v1pxfPPa8e1QBAIA20W5D6ob7TRs6fjtgwIBa4zZHdXV1Xnnlldxxxx0ZPXp09thjj/zyl79Mp06dtrzgNnLbo89nzdrNO9G9Zm11bvvT8y1UEQAAQMO2besCttRLL72UJDVHcd+pZ8+etcZtjne/+92ZP39+kuTkk0/O+PHjN/te1A1n299p/vz5GThw4GbXtKUae8z3nR5asCTnHLhHM1cDAACwce12J3X58uVJkvLy8nr7N+x6bhi3OZ599tm8/vrrmTlzZl599dXstddeufLKK7e82Db01qq3W3UeAABAU7TbndSKiookyerVq+vtX7VqVa1xm6tHjx750Ic+lLvvvjvvf//785WvfCW9e/du9KtoGno6WEM7rC2lW6ct+794S+cBAAA0RbvdSe3Tp0+SZOnS+o+zvvbaa0mSvn37Nuk62267bf793/89SXLDDTc0aa228IH+9R+H3pQPDti+mSsBAADYtHYbUocNG5YkWbhwYb39CxYsSJIMGTKkydfacD/qokWLmrxWaztpn11TVlqyWXPKSkty0vt3baGKAAAAGtZuQ+qBBx6Yrl27Zvbs2amqqqrTP3PmzCTJ6NGjN7nWjBkz0rlz57z66qv19r/44otJku23b3+7izt275wTRtR9tc7GnDBi1/Tu3v6eZAwAALR/7TakVlRUZOzYsVm1alUmTpxYq2/BggWZOnVqKisrc+SRR9a0z5kzJ/vtt18uuuiiWuPXrVuXVatW5de//nWd61RXV9es35jAW0QXH13Z6GO/H+jfKxcf3f7eBwsAAHQM7TakJsnFF1+ckSNH5oILLsjkyZOzYsWKzJ49O8cff3wqKioyadKklJaW1oyfMGFCHnzwwYwfPz5LliypaS8pWX8c9vOf/3yuvfbaPP/881mxYkVmzZqVE044IX/4wx8yYsSIfPWrX231z9gcOpeVZuKZ++YT+/Zr8OhvWWlJPrFvv0w8c990LiutdwwAAEBLK6murq5u6yKaYuXKlbn88sszadKk/O1vf0uPHj1y6KGH5rLLLsuAAQNqjZ06dWpOOumk7L///rn99ttrwml1dXX+8Ic/5H//93/z+9//PosWLcrKlSvTo0ePVFZW5oQTTshZZ53V4OtuNseGp/s29PTflrZ42ar8+I+Lcu20Z2vazj1oj5w+cndHfAEA2Oq09fdz6mr3IbW9KcK/BG+sWJOhl95b8/Osiw9Ljy5lbVYPAAC0lSJ8P6e2dn3cFwAAgI5FSAUAAKAwhFQAAAAKQ0gFAACgMIRUAAAACkNIBQAAoDCEVAAAAApDSAUAAKAwhFQAAAAKQ0gFAACgMIRUAAAACkNIBQAAoDC2besCaDnLV7/dqPblq99OWWlJnXEV5X57AAAArUsK6cAGf+2eRo0bOX5ave2Lvn1Uc5YDAACwSY77AgAAUBh2UjuweZd9pK1LAAAA2CxCagfmnlIAAKC9cdwXAACAwhBSAQAAKAwhFQAAgMIQUgEAACgMIRUAAIDCEFIBAAAoDCEVAACAwhBSAQAAKAwhFQAAgMIQUgEAACgMIRUAAIDCEFIBAAAoDCEVAACAwhBSAQAAKAwhFQAAgMIQUgEAACgMIRUAAIDCEFIBAAAoDCEVAACAwhBSAQAAKAwhFQAAgMIoqa6urm7rIrYm3bt3z5o1azJw4MC2LgUAALZ68+fPT1lZWZYtW9bWpfD/s5Payrp27ZqysrK2LqPDmD9/fubPn9/WZQBbIX/+AG3Fnz/Nq6ysLF27dm3rMvgXdlJp1yorK5Mkc+fObeNKgK2NP3+AtuLPHzo6O6kAAAAUhpAKAABAYQipAAAAFIaQCgAAQGEIqQAAABSGp/sCAABQGHZSAQAAKAwhFQAAgMIQUgEAACgMIRUAAIDCEFIBAAAoDCEVAACAwhBSAQAAKIxt27oAAGgvli9fnj/96U959dVX8/rrr+fMM89s65IAoMMpqa6urm7rIgCgPXjmmWfy/e9/Pz/4wQ+y44475umnn27rkgCgwxFSKaS33347t956a6ZOnZqddtopnTp1SlVVVV544YUceeSROfXUU7Pttg4CAG2jb9++Ofroo/P973+/rUsBgA7Ht3wK56mnnsoxxxyT3r1751e/+lW23377mr6XX345o0ePzre//e386le/yqBBg9qwUmBr9Je//CUvvfRS9t9//7YuBQA6JDupFMrLL7+c97znPVmzZk2eeeaZ9O7du86YF154IXvvvXe6dOmSJ598st4xAC3lxhtvzNlnn52//e1v2XXXXdu6HKADuvfee/OrX/0qTz75ZK666qrssMMOufbaa7PtttvmL3/5S/r375/vfOc7KSkpaetSoUXYSaVQvvWtb+XVV1/NWWed1WD43HnnnXPCCSfk5ptvzje/+c1cffXVrVsksFWbPn16+vfvL6ACLWLt2rWZPHlyJkyYkBNOOCGf/vSnM3LkyFx++eXp1q1bXnvttfTq1Ssf/ehHc9BBB7V1udAihFQKZebMmUmSoUOHbnTc8OHDc/PNN9eMB2gN1dXV+f3vf58jjjgiV199dZ5//vmsXbs2s2bNyg9/+MMMGDCgrUsE2rmZM2fmQx/6UJL1txesXbs23/nOd9K5c+ck658yniRLlixpsxqhpQmpFMqqVasaNa60tDRJsnr16pYsB6CWJ598MosXL86jjz6az3/+83nf+96XJDniiCNyySWX5Mc//nEbVwi0d3vuuWdGjBiRl19+OXPnzs31119fE1CT5LHHHkuy6b/Qh/Zsm7YuAP7V8OHDkyTz58/f6Lhnn302STJy5MgWrwlgg+nTpydJrrnmmpqAmiTl5eV59dVX26osoAPp06dPunbtmmnTpiVJDj744Fr9P//5z7Pnnntmzz33bIvyoFUIqRTKuHHjUlpamvvuu2+j46ZNm5aysrKMGzeulSoDWP9nT2VlZQ499NBa7Y888kgqKyvbqCqgI/rd736XXXfdtdabDN58883ccccdOeWUU5L88y/tk2TGjBm57LLLct111+WSSy6JZ6PSngmpFMrQoUNz3nnnZdasWXnmmWfqHTN//vzMmjUrY8eOzbvf/e5WrhDYWq1bty4zZsyos6vx0EMP5aWXXsrhhx/eRpUBHdHvfve7On/e/PSnP01VVVXGjBmT6urqXH755UmSNWvW5KKLLsrXvva1/Pu//3tuvPHGvPXWW21RNjQLIZXCueyyy7LHHnvkpz/9ab39P/3pT7P77rvn61//eitXBmzNnnjiibz22mv1fmncYYcdsv/+++f111/3MBOgyebPn59FixblkEMOqdU+b968DB06NLvttltuvvnmnHTSSUnW77D+6U9/yje/+c0888wz+fOf/5zu3bu3RenQLIRUCmPVqlV56qmn0qVLl1x//fX52c9+Vu+4n/zkJ5kwYUK6du2ap556KqtWrcqdd96ZIUOG5LTTTsutt96a66+/Pp/4xCfy6KOP5sc//nFuuOGGnH766Xn00Udb+VMBHcW0adNSWlqa/fffv6Zt3bp1+elPf5qTTz452267bb73ve/VPHkTYEs9//zz6devX50TGmeddVY6deqUcePGZfXq1TW3Hmy//fa54oorMnHixLz3ve/NPffc0xZlQ7MRUimMsrKymneeHnbYYRkwYECdByj99a9/zcCBA3PYYYclWf/wkrKyshx11FEZO3Zspk+fng996EM555xzcuKJJ+bkk0/Ofvvtl7PPPjsf+9jHcuWVV7b2xwI6iOnTp2fEiBHp0aNHTdvrr7+exYsX57DDDsvrr7+epUuXen8q0GQHHHBAnnvuuWy//fa12vfee+889NBD+c53vpOzzjqrpv3111/P5z73ufz1r3/NpEmTcvvtt7d2ydCsvIKGwthmm23yj3/8I1deeWV69+6dnXbaKQ8++GAGDhxYM+aPf/xjdt5559xyyy1ZvHhx/vGPf2Sbbdb/XUt5eXne9a531Yzv1atXevbsWfPz9ttvn8WLF7f+BwM6hNdffz1jxoyp1darV6988YtfzA9/+MPcd999+da3vtVG1QFbq2effTZ77bVXli5dmu222y69evVyjzztnpBKoQwaNChf+cpXav38rxYvXpwJEyZkwoQJSZIvf/nLtfrfef/FO3/2pDtgS82cObPe9u985zutXAnAP/Xt2zdf/epXc9ttt+WNN97ImjVrcsEFF7R1WdAkQiqFcuWVV270SO6XvvSlfOlLX2rFigAAiqtr16659NJL27oMaFbuSQUAAKAwhFQ6hDvvvDPXXntt/vznP+eiiy7KQw89lEsuuaTBnwEAgGIqqXaTHgAAAAVhJxUAAIDCEFIBAAAoDCEVAACAwhBSAQAAKAwhFQAAgMIQUgEAACgMIRUAAIDCEFIBAAAoDCEVAACAwhBSAQAAKAwhFQAAgMIQUgEAACgMIRUAAIDCEFIBAAAoDCEVAACAwhBSAQAAKIz/D2U2C5R1QCk7AAAAAElFTkSuQmCC">
 947        """
 948        size = len(args[0])
 949        latex_names = args[0].latex_names
 950
 951        # error handling
 952        if not 0 <= space <= 1:
 953            raise ValueError("The value of `space` must be in the open interval (0, 1)")
 954
 955        allowed_scales = ["linear", "log"]
 956        if scale not in allowed_scales:
 957            raise ValueError(f"The value of `scale` must be one of: {allowed_scales}")
 958
 959        for arg in args:
 960            if set(args[0].names) != set(arg.names):
 961                raise MismatchingValuesError(
 962                    "parameter name",
 963                    args[0].names,
 964                    arg.names,
 965                )
 966
 967        # reordering to match the first one
 968        args = [arg.sort(key=args[0].names) for arg in args]
 969
 970        # the width or height of all columns for a single parameter
 971        total_space = 1 - space
 972
 973        # the width or height of a single column for a single parameter
 974        space_per_object = total_space / len(args)
 975
 976        if not colors:
 977            colors = list(islice(self.current_color, len(args)))  # type: ignore
 978        elif len(colors) != len(args):
 979            raise MismatchingSizeError(colors, args)
 980
 981        if not labels:
 982            labels = [""] * len(args)
 983        elif len(labels) != len(args):
 984            raise MismatchingSizeError(labels, args)
 985
 986        if not values_label:
 987            values_label = r"$\theta_\mathrm{fid}$"
 988
 989        x_array = [
 990            [
 991                _ - total_space / 2 + (2 * index + 1) * space_per_object / 2
 992                for _ in range(size)
 993            ]
 994            for index, arg in enumerate(args)
 995        ]
 996        y_array = [arg.fiducials for arg in args]
 997        yerr_array = [
 998            np.array(
 999                [
1000                    arg.constraints(name=_, marginalized=marginalized)[0]
1001                    for _ in arg.names
1002                ]
1003            )
1004            for index, arg in enumerate(args)
1005        ]
1006
1007        # TODO: maybe put this in a class so validation is easier
1008        options = {
1009            "bar": {
1010                "parameters_scale": "x",
1011                "values_scale": "y",
1012                "error_name": "yerr",
1013                "extra_kwargs": {
1014                    "capsize": total_space * 60 / len(args) / size,
1015                    "width": space_per_object,
1016                },
1017            },
1018            "barh": {
1019                "parameters_scale": "y",
1020                "values_scale": "x",
1021                "error_name": "xerr",
1022                "extra_kwargs": {
1023                    "capsize": total_space * 60 / len(args) / size,
1024                    "height": space_per_object,
1025                },
1026            },
1027            "errorbar": {
1028                "parameters_scale": "x",
1029                "values_scale": "y",
1030                "error_name": "yerr",
1031                "extra_kwargs": {
1032                    "capsize": total_space * 120 / len(args) / size,
1033                    "ls": kwargs.pop("ls", ""),
1034                    "marker": kwargs.pop("marker", "o"),
1035                },
1036            },
1037        }
1038
1039        if capsize is not None:
1040            options[kind]["extra_kwargs"]["capsize"] = capsize  # type: ignore
1041
1042        with plt.rc_context(self.options):
1043            fig, ax = plt.subplots()
1044            for color, label, x, y, yerr in zip(
1045                colors,  # type: ignore
1046                labels,
1047                x_array if kind != "barh" else reversed(x_array),
1048                y_array,
1049                yerr_array,
1050            ):
1051                getattr(ax, kind)(
1052                    x,
1053                    y if kind != "barh" else list(reversed(y)),
1054                    color=color,
1055                    label=label,
1056                    **{
1057                        options[kind]["error_name"]: yerr
1058                        if kind != "barh"
1059                        else list(reversed(yerr))
1060                    },
1061                    **options[kind]["extra_kwargs"],
1062                    **kwargs,
1063                )
1064
1065            ax.set_yscale(scale)
1066
1067            getattr(ax, f'set_{options[kind]["parameters_scale"]}ticks')(range(size))
1068            getattr(ax, f'set_{options[kind]["parameters_scale"]}ticklabels')(
1069                latex_names if kind != "barh" else reversed(latex_names)
1070            )
1071            getattr(ax, f'set_{options[kind]["values_scale"]}label')(values_label)
1072
1073        self._figure = fig
1074        self._axes = ax

Make a plot of the constraints of the Fisher matrices.

Parameters
  • args (array_like of FisherMatrix): the Fisher matrices for which we want to plot the constraints
  • kind (str, {'bar', 'barh', 'errorbar'}): the kind of plot we want (vertical bar, horizontal bar, errorbar)
  • marginalized (bool, optional): whether the marginalized or the unmarginalized constraints should be plotted (default: True)
  • colors (array_like of str, optional): the colors to use for the plotting (default: default matplotlib colors)
  • labels (array_like of str, optional): the labels for the Fisher matrices (default: None)
  • values_label (str, optional): the label for the axis containing the constraints (default: $\theta_\mathrm{fid}$)
  • scale (str, {'linear', 'log'}): the scale used for the y axis (default: 'linear')
  • space (float, optional): the space reserved between the bars (default: 0.3)
  • capsize (float, optional): the width of the errorbars (default: none, that is, determined automatically)
  • **kwargs: any keyword arguments passed to matplotlib.pyplot.bar, or matplotlib.pyplot.barh, or matplotlib.pyplot.errorbar.
Returns
  • None
Examples

Define some Fisher matrices:

>>> fm1 = FisherMatrix(np.diag([1, 2, 3]) * 1e3, names=["a", "b", "c"], latex_names=[r'$\Omega_\mathrm{m}$', '$h$', "$n_s$"], fiducials=[0.3, 0.7, 0.96])
>>> fm2 = FisherMatrix(np.diag([4, 5, 6]) * 1e3, names=["a", "b", "c"], latex_names=[r'$\Omega_\mathrm{m}$', '$h$', "$n_s$"], fiducials=[0.35, 0.67, 0.9])

Make a vertical bar plot:

>>> fig = FisherBarFigure()
>>> fig.plot_absolute_constraints([fm1, fm2], 'bar', labels=['Fisher 1', 'Fisher 2'])
>>> _ = fig.figure.legend()

Save it to a file:

>>> fig.savefig(
... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure_plot_absolute_constraints_bar.png",
... dpi=150)

Make a horizontal bar plot:

>>> fig = FisherBarFigure()
>>> fig.plot_absolute_constraints([fm1, fm2], 'barh', labels=['Fisher 1', 'Fisher 2'])
>>> _ = fig.figure.legend()

Save it to a file:

>>> fig.savefig(
... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure_plot_absolute_constraints_barh.png",
... dpi=150)

Make an errobar plot:

>>> fig = FisherBarFigure()
>>> fig.plot_absolute_constraints([fm1, fm2], 'errorbar', labels=['Fisher 1', 'Fisher 2'], capsize=4)
>>> _ = fig.figure.legend()

Save it to a file:

>>> fig.savefig(
... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure_plot_absolute_constraints_errorbar.png",
... dpi=150)

def plot_relative_constraints( self, args: collections.abc.Sequence[fitk.tensors.FisherMatrix], kind: str, marginalized: bool = True, colors: Optional[collections.abc.Sequence[str]] = None, labels: Optional[collections.abc.Sequence[str]] = None, values_label: Optional[str] = None, scale: str = 'linear', space: float = 0.3, percent: bool = False, **kwargs): 
1076    def plot_relative_constraints(
1077        self,
1078        args: Sequence[FisherMatrix],
1079        kind: str,
1080        marginalized: bool = True,
1081        colors: Optional[Sequence[str]] = None,
1082        labels: Optional[Sequence[str]] = None,
1083        values_label: Optional[str] = None,
1084        scale: str = "linear",
1085        space: float = 0.3,
1086        percent: bool = False,
1087        **kwargs,
1088    ):
1089        r"""
1090        Make a plot of the constraints (relative to the fiducial) of the Fisher matrices.
1091
1092        Parameters
1093        ----------
1094        args : array_like of FisherMatrix
1095            the Fisher matrices for which we want to plot the constraints
1096
1097        kind : str, {'bar', 'barh', 'errorbar'}
1098            the kind of plot we want (vertical bar, horizontal bar, errorbar)
1099
1100        marginalized : bool, optional
1101            whether the marginalized or the unmarginalized constraints should
1102            be plotted (default: True)
1103
1104        colors : array_like of str, optional
1105            the colors to use for the plotting (default: default matplotlib
1106            colors)
1107
1108        labels : array_like of str, optional
1109            the labels for the Fisher matrices (default: None)
1110
1111        values_label : str, optional
1112            the label for the values, that is, the y axis (default: ``$\sigma / \theta_\mathrm{fid}$`` if ``percent`` is false, otherwise ``$\sigma / \theta_\mathrm{fid}\ (\%)$``
1113
1114        scale : str, {'linear', 'log'}
1115            the scale used for the y axis (default: 'linear')
1116
1117        space : float, optional
1118            the space reserved between the bars (default: 0.3)
1119
1120        percent : bool, optional
1121            whether to plot in percentage units (default: false)
1122
1123        **kwargs
1124            any keyword arguments passed to
1125            <a
1126            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/_as_gen/matplotlib.pyplot.bar.html"
1127            target="_blank" rel=noreferrer noopener>``matplotlib.pyplot.bar``</a>
1128
1129        Returns
1130        -------
1131        None
1132
1133        Examples
1134        --------
1135        Define some Fisher matrices:
1136
1137        >>> fm1 = FisherMatrix(np.diag([1, 2, 3]) * 1e3, names=["a", "b", "c"], latex_names=[r'$\Omega_\mathrm{m}$', '$h$', "$n_s$"], fiducials=[0.3, 0.7, 0.96])
1138        >>> fm2 = FisherMatrix(np.diag([4, 5, 6]) * 1e3, names=["a", "b", "c"], latex_names=[r'$\Omega_\mathrm{m}$', '$h$', "$n_s$"], fiducials=[0.35, 0.67, 0.9])
1139
1140        Make a vertical bar plot:
1141
1142        >>> fig = FisherBarFigure()
1143        >>> fig.plot_relative_constraints([fm1, fm2], 'bar', labels=['Fisher 1', 'Fisher 2'])
1144        >>> _ = fig.figure.legend()
1145
1146        Save it to a file:
1147
1148        >>> fig.savefig(
1149        ... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure_plot_relative_constraints_bar.png",
1150        ... dpi=150)
1151
1152        <img width="100%" 1153
1154        Make a horizontal bar plot:
1155
1156        >>> fig = FisherBarFigure()
1157        >>> fig.plot_relative_constraints([fm1, fm2], 'barh', labels=['Fisher 1', 'Fisher 2'])
1158        >>> _ = fig.figure.legend()
1159
1160        Save it to a file:
1161
1162        >>> fig.savefig(
1163        ... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure_plot_relative_constraints_barh.png",
1164        ... dpi=150)
