69f+vbtmx/96Ecbs0wA6FE8QQSgW7r77rvz3ve+N42Njautu//++3PppZdmxowZHZYvWLAgs2bN2lglAkCPIyACsNG0tLSkKIoOy3r37p26utUHtFx11VU5+eSTOz3Ol7/85Rx00EEZM2ZM+7I//elPWbx4cdra2ipbNABsQgwxBWCDmjFjRg4//PA0Nzenqakpffr06fBz+OGHr7bPwoULM2PGjOy5556rrfvVr36Vn//856vNTXzggQeSZJ3mHy5btiyzZ8/Os88+u9b7AkBP4gkiABvMLbfcko9//OOZOHFifvjDH2bhwoU566yzsuWWW+bf//3fkyQ77rjjavvdcMMNa3wb6Q9+8IPU1dXlsssuy5QpU9qXP/LII0mSd77zne3Lvve972XOnDm54447Mnjw4IwZMyaTJ09e7ZgPPfRQzjzzzLzjHe/IFVdcsR5XDAC1TUAEYIOYMWNGjjnmmFx44YX59Kc/3b585cqVmThxYnbZZZdO5xcmyX/913/l8ssv73TdPffck1122SU/+clP2pcVRZEtt9wyAwYMyLvf/e4kyfTp0/Of//mfefjhh/Pcc89l9OjRGTFiRKfH3HfffXPSSSe1P4UEgE2VgAjABvGFL3whu+66a4dwmCQDBw5Ma2tr5s+f3+lw0GeeeSatra3ZbrvtVlvX1taWxx57LJ/97Gc7LP/1r3+dF198Mccdd1x76Jw+fXre+ta3plQq5dJLL33TejubBwkAmxq/DQGouDlz5uSuu+7KxIkTV1v3yCOPZPDgwRk2bFin+1599dX5xCc+0em6uXPnZuXKlRk7dmyH5VdddVWS5POf/3z7sra2tpRKpSTJq6++moceeijTpk1bh6sBgE2HJ4gAVNysWbPS1taWd73rXR2WF0WR66+/Psccc8wan9jdcMMNuf/++ztd16tXryTJlltu2b5s2bJlueaaa/LRj340u+yyS5Lkpz/9af77v/87zz33XM4444wceeSR+dKXvpTtttuufY7hCy+8kG984xvtcyBnzpy5XtcMAD2BgAhAxb3lLW9JqVRKfX19h+VXXXVV5s6dm7PPPrvT/R5++OHsuOOOGTRoUKfrBw0alIEDB6Z3797tyy6++OL06dMnF1xwQfuyfffdN88991zuu+++/L//9/+SJMcff3z7HMOWlpbsv//+ufLKK9tD7JlnnpmFCxeu8zUDQE9giCkAFfeWt7wlxx13XIe5fzfccEPOOeec3H333WscXnrVVVfluOOOe8NjH3rooXnssceSvP4inG9/+9u56aab1vgCmlX+9onl//zP/2Tu3LkdnnCOGjXqTa8LAHo6TxAB2CAuv/zyfOc738nnPve5JMkOO+yQ3/zmN2lubu50+xUrVuTee+/t8CSwM+edd14++9nPZtasWXnxxRczderU7LDDDmtV28yZM7PVVlut1T4AsCkQEAHYIOrr63Pqqad2efs77rgj+++/fxoa3vhX0/Dhw3PTTTetV23bbLON4aQA0AlDTAHoFroyvLRSDj300LS2tubRRx9tX/bYY49l2bJlG+X8ANBdeYIIQNW9+uqrefrpp1d76+m6+vGPf5zJkyfn+eefzwknnJBDDz00F1xwQV588cV85zvfycknn5y77747X//617Prrrumrq4uvXv3zv3335/zzjsvX/jCFypSBwDUmlJRFEW1iwBg03bxxRdnwYIF+eIXv1jtUgBgk2aIKQBVd++99+bjH/94tcsAgE2eJ4gAAAAk8QQRAACAMgERAACAJAIiAAAAZQIiAAAASQREAAAAygREAAAAkgiIAAAAlAmIAAAAJBEQAQAAKBMQAQAASCIgAgAAUCYgAgAAkERABAAAoExABAAAIImACAAAQJmACAAAQJLk/wP3NXmDDi68PAAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==">
1167        """
1168        size = len(args[0])
1169        latex_names = args[0].latex_names
1170
1171        computed_parameters = self._parse_fractional_constraints(
1172            args,
1173            marginalized=marginalized,
1174            colors=colors,
1175            labels=labels,
1176            scale=scale,
1177            space=space,
1178            values_label=values_label,
1179            percent=percent,
1180        )
1181
1182        # TODO: maybe put this in a class so validation is easier
1183        options = {
1184            "bar": {
1185                "parameters_scale": "x",
1186                "values_scale": "y",
1187                "lines_prefix": "h",
1188                "extra_kwargs": {
1189                    "width": computed_parameters.space_per_object,
1190                },
1191            },
1192            "barh": {
1193                "parameters_scale": "y",
1194                "values_scale": "x",
1195                "lines_prefix": "v",
1196                "extra_kwargs": {
1197                    "height": computed_parameters.space_per_object,
1198                },
1199            },
1200        }
1201
1202        with plt.rc_context(self.options):
1203            fig, ax = plt.subplots()
1204            for color, label, x, y in zip(
1205                computed_parameters.colors,
1206                computed_parameters.labels,
1207                computed_parameters.x_array
1208                if kind != "barh"
1209                else reversed(computed_parameters.x_array),
1210                computed_parameters.y_array,
1211            ):
1212                getattr(ax, kind)(
1213                    x,
1214                    (y * 100 if percent else y)
1215                    if kind != "barh"
1216                    else list(reversed(y * 100 if percent else y)),
1217                    color=color,
1218                    label=label,
1219                    **options[kind]["extra_kwargs"],
1220                    **kwargs,
1221                )
1222                getattr(ax, kind)(
1223                    x,
1224                    -(y * 100 if percent else y)
1225                    if kind != "barh"
1226                    else list(reversed(-y * 100 if percent else -y)),
1227                    color=color,
1228                    label=None,
1229                    **options[kind]["extra_kwargs"],
1230                    **kwargs,
1231                )
1232
1233            limits = getattr(ax, f'get_{options[kind]["parameters_scale"]}lim')()
1234
1235            getattr(ax, f'{options[kind]["lines_prefix"]}lines')(
1236                0, limits[0], limits[-1], color="black", ls="--"
1237            )
1238            getattr(ax, f'set_{options[kind]["parameters_scale"]}lim')(*limits)
1239            getattr(ax, f'set_{options[kind]["values_scale"]}scale')(
1240                computed_parameters.scale
1241            )
1242
1243            getattr(ax, f'set_{options[kind]["parameters_scale"]}ticks')(range(size))
1244            getattr(ax, f'set_{options[kind]["parameters_scale"]}ticklabels')(
1245                latex_names if kind != "barh" else reversed(latex_names)
1246            )
1247            getattr(ax, f'set_{options[kind]["values_scale"]}label')(
1248                computed_parameters.values_label
1249            )
1250
1251        self._figure = fig
1252        self._axes = ax

Make a plot of the constraints (relative to the fiducial) of the Fisher matrices.

Parameters
  • args (array_like of FisherMatrix): the Fisher matrices for which we want to plot the constraints
  • kind (str, {'bar', 'barh', 'errorbar'}): the kind of plot we want (vertical bar, horizontal bar, errorbar)
  • marginalized (bool, optional): whether the marginalized or the unmarginalized constraints should be plotted (default: True)
  • colors (array_like of str, optional): the colors to use for the plotting (default: default matplotlib colors)
  • labels (array_like of str, optional): the labels for the Fisher matrices (default: None)
  • values_label (str, optional): the label for the values, that is, the y axis (default: $\sigma / \theta_\mathrm{fid}$ if percent is false, otherwise $\sigma / \theta_\mathrm{fid}\ (\%)$
  • scale (str, {'linear', 'log'}): the scale used for the y axis (default: 'linear')
  • space (float, optional): the space reserved between the bars (default: 0.3)
  • percent (bool, optional): whether to plot in percentage units (default: false)
  • **kwargs: any keyword arguments passed to matplotlib.pyplot.bar
Returns
  • None
Examples

Define some Fisher matrices:

>>> fm1 = FisherMatrix(np.diag([1, 2, 3]) * 1e3, names=["a", "b", "c"], latex_names=[r'$\Omega_\mathrm{m}$', '$h$', "$n_s$"], fiducials=[0.3, 0.7, 0.96])
>>> fm2 = FisherMatrix(np.diag([4, 5, 6]) * 1e3, names=["a", "b", "c"], latex_names=[r'$\Omega_\mathrm{m}$', '$h$', "$n_s$"], fiducials=[0.35, 0.67, 0.9])

Make a vertical bar plot:

>>> fig = FisherBarFigure()
>>> fig.plot_relative_constraints([fm1, fm2], 'bar', labels=['Fisher 1', 'Fisher 2'])
>>> _ = fig.figure.legend()

Save it to a file:

>>> fig.savefig(
... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure_plot_relative_constraints_bar.png",
... dpi=150)

Make a horizontal bar plot:

>>> fig = FisherBarFigure()
>>> fig.plot_relative_constraints([fm1, fm2], 'barh', labels=['Fisher 1', 'Fisher 2'])
>>> _ = fig.figure.legend()

Save it to a file:

>>> fig.savefig(
... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure_plot_relative_constraints_barh.png",
... dpi=150)

def set_label_params(self, which: str = 'both', **kwargs): 
1254    def set_label_params(
1255        self,
1256        which: str = "both",
1257        **kwargs,
1258    ):
1259        """
1260        Set both x and y label parameters.
1261
1262        .. versionadded:: 0.10.4
1263
1264        Parameters
1265        ----------
1266        which : {'both', 'x', 'y'}
1267            which axis to change (default: 'both')
1268
1269        **kwargs
1270            any keyword arguments that are also valid for <a
1271            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/text_api.html#matplotlib.text.Text"
1272            target="_blank" rel="noopener
1273            noreferrer">``matplotlib.text.Text``</a>.
1274
1275        Returns
1276        -------
1277        None
1278
1279        Raises
1280        ------
1281        EmptyFigureError
1282            if ``figure`` is not set
1283
1284        ValueError
1285            if ``which`` is not one of the allowed values
1286        """
1287        if not self.figure:
1288            raise EmptyFigureError
1289
1290        _set_label_params(self.axes, which=which, **kwargs)

Set both x and y label parameters.

New in version 0.10.4.

Parameters
  • which ({'both', 'x', 'y'}): which axis to change (default: 'both')
  • **kwargs: any keyword arguments that are also valid for matplotlib.text.Text.
Returns
  • None
Raises
  • EmptyFigureError: if figure is not set
  • ValueError: if which is not one of the allowed values
def set_tick_params(self, which: str = 'both', **kwargs): 
1292    def set_tick_params(
1293        self,
1294        which: str = "both",
1295        **kwargs,
1296    ):
1297        """
1298        Set both x and y tick parameters.
1299
1300        .. versionadded:: 0.10.4
1301
1302        Parameters
1303        ----------
1304        which : {'both', 'x', 'y'}
1305            which axis to change (default: 'both')
1306
1307        **kwargs
1308            any keyword arguments passed to the methods for handling tick
1309            parameters (such as 'fontsize', 'rotation', etc.)
1310
1311        Returns
1312        -------
1313        None
1314
1315        Raises
1316        ------
1317        EmptyFigureError
1318            if ``figure`` is not set
1319
1320        ValueError
1321            if ``which`` is not one of the allowed values
1322        """
1323        if not self.figure:
1324            raise EmptyFigureError
1325
1326        _set_tick_params(self.axes, which=which, **kwargs)

Set both x and y tick parameters.

New in version 0.10.4.

Parameters
  • which ({'both', 'x', 'y'}): which axis to change (default: 'both')
  • **kwargs: any keyword arguments passed to the methods for handling tick parameters (such as 'fontsize', 'rotation', etc.)
Returns
  • None
Raises
  • EmptyFigureError: if figure is not set
  • ValueError: if which is not one of the allowed values
Inherited Members
FisherBaseFigure
FisherBaseFigure
options
axes
figure
handles
labels
savefig
class FisherFigure1D(FisherMultipleAxesFigure): 
1329class FisherFigure1D(FisherMultipleAxesFigure):
1330    r"""
1331    Container for easy access to elements in the 1D plot.
1332
1333    Examples
1334    --------
1335    Define some Fisher matrices:
1336
1337    >>> m1 = FisherMatrix(
1338    ... [[3, -2], [-2, 5]],
1339    ... names=['a', 'b'],
1340    ... latex_names=[r'$\mathcal{A}$', r'$\mathcal{B}$'],
1341    ... )
1342    >>> m2 = FisherMatrix(
1343    ... [[4, 1], [1, 6]],
1344    ... names=['a', 'b'],
1345    ... latex_names=[r'$\mathcal{A}$', r'$\mathcal{B}$'],
1346    ... )
1347
1348    Instantiate a figure:
1349
1350    >>> fig = FisherFigure1D()
1351
1352    Draw marginalized 1D plots with the previously defined Fisher matrix:
1353
1354    >>> fig.plot(m1, label='first')
1355
1356    Add another plot with a different color and style:
1357
1358    >>> fig.plot(m2, label='second', ls=':', color='green')
1359
1360    Draw some other stuff on it:
1361
1362    >>> artist, = fig.draw('a', 'plot', [-1, 0, 1], [-1, 0, 1], color='red', label='curve')
1363    >>> # alternatively, the below will accomplish the same thing
1364    >>> # artist, = fig['a'].plot([-1, 0, 1], [-1, 0, 1], color='red')
1365    >>> # note that in this case, due to certain limitations, you need to
1366    >>> # manually add the legend using a convenience function:
1367    >>> # fig.add_artist_to_legend(artist, label='curve')
1368
1369    Add a legend:
1370
1371    >>> _ = fig.legend(ncol=3, loc='center')
1372
1373    Add a title:
1374
1375    >>> _ = fig.set_title('Example Fisher matrix 1D plotting')
1376
1377    Save it to a file:
1378
1379    >>> fig.savefig(
1380    ... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure1d_example1.png",
1381    ... dpi=150)
1382
1383    <img width="100%" L7hhUKhwNq1a1t8NfHJkycxcuRIVFVVITc3F9OmTRM6JIdC551t0LksLLu5TjTpzwMBFRYWMgC1/mtpJYHKykr21ltvsTZt2jAnJyfm7+/PZsyYwa5fvy50aHbh+eefr9P3hkrg1tF5Zzt0LgvHXq4THGM0JiQhhBDiaFrkSGyEEEKIo6METgghhDggSuCEEEKIA6IETgghhDggSuCEEEKIA6IETgghhDggSuCEEEKIA6IETgghhDggSuCEEEKIA6IETgghhDggSuCEEEKIA6IETgAAL7/8Mjp16iR0GISQOigsLMRrr72G6Oho/rmDBw9iypQp8PPzg1wux6BBg3D16lUBoyRNjRI4wcqVK/Hxxx+jtLRU6FAIIbW4cOECZs6ciU8++QSurq4oLS3FrFmzsG7dOsybNw8rVqxATEwMDh48iKeeekrocEkTotnIWriKigr06NEDly5dQkREBFJSUoQOiRBSi+LiYnh6emLUqFEoLCzEnDlzMG/ePH59RkYGQkND0blzZ5w9e1bASElTohJ4C/fZZ5/hP//5D0Qi+ioQ4iiuXLkCANi5cydatWpllrxNTZs2zZZhERujEngLlp6ejjFjxuDUqVPw8PBAYGAglcAJcQBr167Fww8/DLlcjuvXryM4OJhfV1FRgRkzZsDPzw/ffPMN/ThvxiRCB0CE89xzz+G1116Dk5MTZDKZ0OEQQuro3LlzAIDZs2fzyTstLQ0//vgj/vzzT7z44ouYMmWKkCESG6CfZi3Uli1bkJmZyVexOTk5QaPRCBwVIaQuTp06BQCYN28eLly4gFGjRiEyMhJvvvkmoqOj0aZNG4EjJLZAVegtUEFBAeLi4rBt2zZ06dIFABAdHY3i4mLk5eUJHB0hpDbe3t7w8fHB1atXsWvXLuTl5SEtLQ2//vorzp49C5lMhk2bNmH8+PFCh0qaECXwFmjq1Klo1aoV3nvvPf65bt26ITExESqVChzHCRgdIaQmV65cQdu2bfHiiy/i008/NVvHGMP8+fPx+eefIyQkBDdv3hQoSmILVIXewnz//fc4c+YMXn/9dWg0Gv6fu7s7NBoNioqKhA6REFKDnTt3AoDV0jXHcfjwww/h5+eHjIwMqlFr5qgRWwty+vRpPPPMM3B1dYWbmxusVb6kpqbCy8tLgOgIIXXxzz//wMfHBwMHDrS6XiaTISoqCqWlpXQuN3OUwJsxxhhfHV5YWIj7778fjz/+OGbNmmWx7ccff4z169cjISEBcXFxNo6UEFIXVVVV2L9/Px588EGIxWKr22g0GiQnJ+M///lPtduQ5oGq0Jup9PR0DBgwAFevXkVmZibGjRuH1q1b4/PPP0ePHj0s/vXr1w8AsG/fPoEjJ4RUZ9u2bSgvL8fw4cOxatUqq7VoH374IcLDw/Hhhx8KECGxJWrE1kz98ccfuO+++/jlgQMHYvv27XBzc7O6/dGjR9GvXz84OztjypQpaN++PV599VVbhUsIqYNRo0YhLy8P169fR3FxMYYPH44nnngC/v7+SEtLw8aNGxEYGIjPPvsMCoVC6HBJE6ME3kypVCrMnj0b27dvxwMPPIDly5fXeEJrtVr07NkTWVlZWLBgAZ555hkawYkQO3Lp0iXMmTMHP/zwA7Kzs/HGG2/g9OnTkEgkiImJwfDhw/Gf//wH7dq1EzpUYiOUwAkhhBAHREUsQgghxAFRAieEEEIcECVwQgghxAFRAieEEEIcECVwQgghxAFRAieEEEIcECVwQgghxAFRAieEEEIcECVwQgghxAFRAieEEEIcECVwQgghxAFRAieEEEIcECVwQgghxAFRAieEEEIcECVwQgghxAFRAieEEEIcECVwQgghxAH9P/X/w1WEVZXqAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC">
1384    """
1385
1386    def __init__(
1387        self,
1388        options: Optional[dict] = None,
1389        max_cols: Optional[int] = None,
1390        hspace: float = 0.5,
1391        wspace: float = 0.1,
1392        contour_levels: Optional[Sequence[tuple[float, float]]] = None,
1393    ):
1394        """
1395        Create an instance.
1396
1397        Parameters
1398        ----------
1399        options : dict, optional
1400            the dictionary containing the options for plotting. If the special
1401            key 'style' is present, it attempts to use that plotting style (can
1402            be one of the outputs of <a
1403            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/style_api.html#matplotlib.style.matplotlib.style.available"
1404            target="_blank" rel="noopener
1405            noreferrer">``matplotlib.style.available``</a>, or a path to a file.
1406            If using a file, does not use the default rc parameters).
1407
1408        max_cols : int, optional
1409            the maximum number of columns in the final plot
1410
1411        hspace : float, optional
1412            The amount of height reserved for space between subplots, expressed
1413            as a fraction of the average axis height.
1414
1415        wspace : float, optional
1416            The amount of width reserved for space between subplots, expressed
1417            as a fraction of the average axis width.
1418
1419        contour_levels : array_like of 2-tuples, optional
1420            the points at which the sigma level should be shaded, along with
1421            the associated opacity (default: None). If not specified, defaults
1422            to ``[(1, 0.3), (2, 0.1)]``.
1423
1424        Notes
1425        -----
1426        For the style sheet reference, please consult <a
1427        href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/gallery/style_sheets/style_sheets_reference.html"
1428        target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">the matplotlib
1429        documentation</a>.
1430        """
1431        super().__init__(
1432            options=options,
1433            wspace=wspace,
1434            hspace=hspace,
1435            contour_levels=contour_levels,
1436        )
1437        self.max_cols = max_cols
1438        self._ndim = 1
1439        self._hspace = hspace
1440        self._wspace = wspace
1441
1442    def __getitem__(
1443        self,
1444        key: str,
1445    ):
1446        """Return the axis associated to the name ``key``."""
1447        if not self.figure:
1448            raise EmptyFigureError
1449
1450        if key not in self.names:
1451            raise ParameterNotFoundError(key, self.names)
1452
1453        return self.axes.flat[np.where(self.names == key)][0]
1454
1455    def draw(
1456        self,
1457        name: str,
1458        method: str,
1459        *args,
1460        **kwargs,
1461    ):
1462        """
1463        Implement drawing of other objects on the axis.
1464
1465        Parameters
1466        ----------
1467        name : str
1468            the name (label) of the parameter where we want to draw
1469
1470        method : str
1471            the name of the method which we want to plot (such as <a
1472            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/_as_gen/matplotlib.pyplot.plot.html"
1473            target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">``plot``</a>, <a
1474            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/_as_gen/matplotlib.pyplot.scatter.html"
1475            target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">``scatter``</a>, etc.)
1476
1477        *args
1478            any positional arguments passed to the method (usually some data)
1479
1480        **kwargs
1481            any keyword arguments passed to the method (usually styling options)
1482
1483        Returns
1484        -------
1485        Artist
1486            the artist that was drawn on the axis
1487
1488        Raises
1489        ------
1490        EmptyFigureError
1491            if ``figure`` is not set
1492
1493        AttributeError
1494            if ``method`` is not a valid plotting method
1495
1496        Notes
1497        -----
1498        The parameter ``name`` has to have already been plotted.
1499        """
1500        if not hasattr(self[name], method):
1501            raise AttributeError(
1502                f"The method `{method}` is not a valid plotting method"
1503            )
1504
1505        # get the right color
1506        if "c" not in kwargs and "color" not in kwargs:
1507            kwargs["color"] = next(self.current_color)
1508            self.current_color = iter(self.current_color)
1509
1510        # hopefully the return type should be some artist, or a collection of
1511        # artists
1512        handles = getattr(self[name], method)(*args, **kwargs)
1513        if is_iterable(handles):
1514            for handle in handles:
1515                if isinstance(handle, Artist) and kwargs.get("label"):
1516                    self.labels.append(kwargs.get("label"))
1517                    self.handles.append(handle)
1518        else:
1519            if isinstance(handles, Artist) and kwargs.get("label"):
1520                self.labels.append(kwargs.get("label"))
1521                self.handles.append(handles)
1522
1523        self[name].autoscale()
1524        self[name].relim()
1525        self[name].autoscale_view()
1526
1527        return handles
1528
1529    def plot(
1530        self,
1531        fisher: FisherMatrix,
1532        *args,
1533        mark_fiducials: Union[bool, dict] = False,
1534        **kwargs,
1535    ):
1536        """
1537        Plot the 1D curves of the Fisher objects.
1538
1539        Parameters
1540        ----------
1541        fisher
1542            the Fisher object which we want to plot
1543
1544        mark_fiducials : bool or dict, optional
1545            whether or not the fiducials should be marked on the plots
1546            (default: False). If set to ``True``, uses ``linestyle='--'`` and
1547            ``color='black'`` as the default. If a dictionary, accepts the same
1548            keyword arguments as <a
1549            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/_as_gen/matplotlib.axes.Axes.axvline.html#matplotlib.axes.Axes.axvline"
1550            target="_blank" rel="noreferrer
1551            noopener">``matplotlib.axes.Axes.axvline``</a>.  If an empty
1552            dictionary, uses the default style (determined automatically).
1553
1554            .. versionadded:: 0.6.0
1555
1556        **kwargs
1557            any keyword arguments used for plotting (same as ``plot_curve_1d``)
1558
1559        Returns
1560        -------
1561        None
1562        """
1563        size = len(fisher)
1564
1565        added = False
1566
1567        # in order to preserve colors for each object, we only use the
1568        # (default) cycler when the color is not explicitly set
1569        if "c" not in kwargs and "color" not in kwargs:
1570            kwargs["color"] = next(self.current_color)
1571            self.current_color = iter(self.current_color)
1572
1573        if self.max_cols is not None and self.max_cols <= size:
1574            full = size % self.max_cols == 0
1575            layout = (
1576                size // self.max_cols if full else size // self.max_cols + 1,
1577                self.max_cols,
1578            )
1579        else:
1580            layout = 1, size
1581            full = True
1582
1583        with plt.rc_context(self.options):
1584            # general figure setup
1585            if self.figure:
1586                fig = self.figure
1587                axes = self.axes
1588            else:
1589                fig = plt.figure(
1590                    clear=True,
1591                    figsize=(2 * layout[1], 2 * layout[0]),
1592                )
1593                gs = fig.add_gridspec(
1594                    nrows=layout[0],
1595                    ncols=layout[1],
1596                    hspace=self.hspace,
1597                    wspace=self.wspace,
1598                )
1599                axes = gs.subplots()
1600                if size == 1:
1601                    axes = np.array([axes])
1602
1603            for (index, name), latex_name in zip(
1604                enumerate(fisher.names),
1605                fisher.latex_names,
1606            ):
1607                ax = axes.flat[index]
1608
1609                bg_color = ax.get_facecolor()
1610
1611                _, __, handle = plot_curve_1d(fisher, name, ax, **kwargs)
1612
1613                if not added and kwargs.get("label"):
1614                    self.handles.append(handle)
1615                    self.labels.append(kwargs["label"])
1616                    added = True
1617
1618                for i in range(len(self.contour_levels) - 1, 0, -1):
1619                    _add_shading_1d(
1620                        fisher.fiducials[index],
1621                        fisher.constraints(name, marginalized=True),
1622                        ax,
1623                        level=self.contour_levels[i][0],
1624                        alpha=self.contour_levels[i][1],
1625                        zorder=2 - i / len(self.contour_levels),
1626                        **kwargs,
1627                    )
1628
1629                    _add_shading_1d(
1630                        fisher.fiducials[index],
1631                        fisher.constraints(name, marginalized=True),
1632                        ax,
1633                        level=self.contour_levels[i - 1][0],
1634                        alpha=1.0,
1635                        color=bg_color,
1636                        zorder=2 - i / len(self.contour_levels),
1637                    )
1638
1639                _add_shading_1d(
1640                    fisher.fiducials[index],
1641                    fisher.constraints(name, marginalized=True),
1642                    ax,
1643                    level=self.contour_levels[0][0],
1644                    alpha=self.contour_levels[0][1],
1645                    zorder=1.99,
1646                    **kwargs,
1647                )
1648
1649                ax.autoscale()
1650                ax.set_xlabel(latex_name)
1651                ax.relim()
1652                ax.autoscale_view()
1653
1654                # the y axis should start at 0 since we're plotting a PDF
1655                ax.set_ylim(0, ax.get_ylim()[-1])
1656
1657                ax.set_yticks([])
1658
1659                # marking the fiducials
1660                if not mark_fiducials is False:
1661                    if mark_fiducials is True:
1662                        mark_fiducials = dict(linestyle="--", color="black")
1663
1664                    _mark_fiducial_1d(
1665                        fisher,
1666                        fisher.names[index],
1667                        ax,
1668                        **mark_fiducials,
1669                    )
1670
1671            # remove any axes which are not drawn
1672            if not full:
1673                for index in range(
1674                    size,
1675                    layout[0] * layout[1],
1676                ):
1677                    # it's simpler to turn off the axis, than completely remove
1678                    # it
1679                    axes.flat[index].axis("off")
1680
1681        self._figure = fig
1682        self._axes = axes
1683        self._names = fisher.names
1684
1685    def legend(
1686        self,
1687        *args: Artist,
1688        overwrite: bool = False,
1689        loc: Union[str, tuple[float, float]] = "lower center",
1690        bbox_to_anchor: Any = (0.5, 1),
1691        **kwargs,
1692    ):
1693        """
1694        Create a legend on the figure.
1695
1696        Parameters
1697        ----------
1698        *args
1699            any positional arguments for the legend
1700
1701        overwrite : bool, optional
1702            whether to overwrite any "nice" options set by ``fitk`` (default:
1703            False)
1704
1705        loc : str or tuple of floats, optional
1706            which corner of the legend to use as the positioning anchor
1707            (default: 'lower center')
1708
1709        bbox_to_anchor : Any, optional
1710            the location of where to place the legend (default: ``[0.5, 1]``)
1711
1712        **kwargs
1713            any other keyword arguments for the legend
1714
1715        Returns
1716        -------
1717        Artist
1718            the legend that was drawn on the figure
1719
1720        Raises
1721        ------
1722        EmptyFigureError
1723            if ``figure`` is not set
1724        """
1725        if not self.figure:
1726            raise EmptyFigureError
1727
1728        with plt.rc_context(self.options):
1729            ax = self.axes.flat[0]
1730            if not overwrite:
1731                if ax.get_legend():
1732                    ax.get_legend().remove()
1733
1734                return ax.legend(
1735                    self.handles,
1736                    self.labels,
1737                    loc=loc,
1738                    bbox_to_anchor=bbox_to_anchor,
1739                    bbox_transform=self.figure.transFigure,
1740                    **kwargs,
1741                )
1742
1743            return ax.legend(
1744                *args,
1745                loc=loc,
1746                bbox_to_anchor=bbox_to_anchor,
1747                **kwargs,
1748            )
1749
1750    def set_title(
1751        self,
1752        *args,
1753        x: float = 0.5,
1754        y: float = 1.2,
1755        **kwargs,
1756    ):
1757        """
1758        Draw a title on the figure.
1759
1760        Parameters
1761        ----------
1762        *args
1763            any positional arguments to ``figure.suptitle``
1764
1765        x : float, optional
1766            the x position of the title (default: ``0.5``)
1767
1768        y : float, optional
1769            the y position of the title (default: ``1.2``)
1770
1771        **kwargs
1772            any keyword arguments to ``figure.suptitle``
1773
1774        Returns
1775        -------
1776        Artist
1777            the title that was drawn on the figure
1778
1779        Raises
1780        ------
1781        EmptyFigureError
1782            if ``figure`` is not set
1783        """
1784        if not self.figure:
1785            raise EmptyFigureError
1786
1787        with plt.rc_context(self.options):
1788            return self.figure.suptitle(*args, x=x, y=y, **kwargs)

Container for easy access to elements in the 1D plot.

Examples

Define some Fisher matrices:

>>> m1 = FisherMatrix(
... [[3, -2], [-2, 5]],
... names=['a', 'b'],
... latex_names=[r'$\mathcal{A}$', r'$\mathcal{B}$'],
... )
>>> m2 = FisherMatrix(
... [[4, 1], [1, 6]],
... names=['a', 'b'],
... latex_names=[r'$\mathcal{A}$', r'$\mathcal{B}$'],
... )

Instantiate a figure:

>>> fig = FisherFigure1D()

Draw marginalized 1D plots with the previously defined Fisher matrix:

>>> fig.plot(m1, label='first')

Add another plot with a different color and style:

>>> fig.plot(m2, label='second', ls=':', color='green')

Draw some other stuff on it:

>>> artist, = fig.draw('a', 'plot', [-1, 0, 1], [-1, 0, 1], color='red', label='curve')
>>> # alternatively, the below will accomplish the same thing
>>> # artist, = fig['a'].plot([-1, 0, 1], [-1, 0, 1], color='red')
>>> # note that in this case, due to certain limitations, you need to
>>> # manually add the legend using a convenience function:
>>> # fig.add_artist_to_legend(artist, label='curve')

Add a legend:

>>> _ = fig.legend(ncol=3, loc='center')

Add a title:

>>> _ = fig.set_title('Example Fisher matrix 1D plotting')

Save it to a file:

>>> fig.savefig(
... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure1d_example1.png",
... dpi=150)

FisherFigure1D( options: Optional[dict] = None, max_cols: Optional[int] = None, hspace: float = 0.5, wspace: float = 0.1, contour_levels: Optional[collections.abc.Sequence[tuple[float, float]]] = None) 
1386    def __init__(
1387        self,
1388        options: Optional[dict] = None,
1389        max_cols: Optional[int] = None,
1390        hspace: float = 0.5,
1391        wspace: float = 0.1,
1392        contour_levels: Optional[Sequence[tuple[float, float]]] = None,
1393    ):
1394        """
1395        Create an instance.
1396
1397        Parameters
1398        ----------
1399        options : dict, optional
1400            the dictionary containing the options for plotting. If the special
1401            key 'style' is present, it attempts to use that plotting style (can
1402            be one of the outputs of <a
1403            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/style_api.html#matplotlib.style.matplotlib.style.available"
1404            target="_blank" rel="noopener
1405            noreferrer">``matplotlib.style.available``</a>, or a path to a file.
1406            If using a file, does not use the default rc parameters).
1407
1408        max_cols : int, optional
1409            the maximum number of columns in the final plot
1410
1411        hspace : float, optional
1412            The amount of height reserved for space between subplots, expressed
1413            as a fraction of the average axis height.
1414
1415        wspace : float, optional
1416            The amount of width reserved for space between subplots, expressed
1417            as a fraction of the average axis width.
1418
1419        contour_levels : array_like of 2-tuples, optional
1420            the points at which the sigma level should be shaded, along with
1421            the associated opacity (default: None). If not specified, defaults
1422            to ``[(1, 0.3), (2, 0.1)]``.
1423
1424        Notes
1425        -----
1426        For the style sheet reference, please consult <a
1427        href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/gallery/style_sheets/style_sheets_reference.html"
1428        target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">the matplotlib
1429        documentation</a>.
1430        """
1431        super().__init__(
1432            options=options,
1433            wspace=wspace,
1434            hspace=hspace,
1435            contour_levels=contour_levels,
1436        )
1437        self.max_cols = max_cols
1438        self._ndim = 1
1439        self._hspace = hspace
1440        self._wspace = wspace

Create an instance.

Parameters
  • options (dict, optional): the dictionary containing the options for plotting. If the special key 'style' is present, it attempts to use that plotting style (can be one of the outputs of matplotlib.style.available, or a path to a file. If using a file, does not use the default rc parameters).
  • max_cols (int, optional): the maximum number of columns in the final plot
  • hspace (float, optional): The amount of height reserved for space between subplots, expressed as a fraction of the average axis height.
  • wspace (float, optional): The amount of width reserved for space between subplots, expressed as a fraction of the average axis width.
  • contour_levels (array_like of 2-tuples, optional): the points at which the sigma level should be shaded, along with the associated opacity (default: None). If not specified, defaults to [(1, 0.3), (2, 0.1)].
Notes

For the style sheet reference, please consult the matplotlib documentation.

def draw(self, name: str, method: str, *args, **kwargs): 
1455    def draw(
1456        self,
1457        name: str,
1458        method: str,
1459        *args,
1460        **kwargs,
1461    ):
1462        """
1463        Implement drawing of other objects on the axis.
1464
1465        Parameters
1466        ----------
1467        name : str
1468            the name (label) of the parameter where we want to draw
1469
1470        method : str
1471            the name of the method which we want to plot (such as <a
1472            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/_as_gen/matplotlib.pyplot.plot.html"
1473            target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">``plot``</a>, <a
1474            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/_as_gen/matplotlib.pyplot.scatter.html"
1475            target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">``scatter``</a>, etc.)
1476
1477        *args
1478            any positional arguments passed to the method (usually some data)
1479
1480        **kwargs
1481            any keyword arguments passed to the method (usually styling options)
1482
1483        Returns
1484        -------
1485        Artist
1486            the artist that was drawn on the axis
1487
1488        Raises
1489        ------
1490        EmptyFigureError
1491            if ``figure`` is not set
1492
1493        AttributeError
1494            if ``method`` is not a valid plotting method
1495
1496        Notes
1497        -----
1498        The parameter ``name`` has to have already been plotted.
1499        """
1500        if not hasattr(self[name], method):
1501            raise AttributeError(
1502                f"The method `{method}` is not a valid plotting method"
1503            )
1504
1505        # get the right color
1506        if "c" not in kwargs and "color" not in kwargs:
1507            kwargs["color"] = next(self.current_color)
1508            self.current_color = iter(self.current_color)
1509
1510        # hopefully the return type should be some artist, or a collection of
1511        # artists
1512        handles = getattr(self[name], method)(*args, **kwargs)
1513        if is_iterable(handles):
1514            for handle in handles:
1515                if isinstance(handle, Artist) and kwargs.get("label"):
1516                    self.labels.append(kwargs.get("label"))
1517                    self.handles.append(handle)
1518        else:
1519            if isinstance(handles, Artist) and kwargs.get("label"):
1520                self.labels.append(kwargs.get("label"))
1521                self.handles.append(handles)
1522
1523        self[name].autoscale()
1524        self[name].relim()
1525        self[name].autoscale_view()
1526
1527        return handles

Implement drawing of other objects on the axis.

Parameters
  • name (str): the name (label) of the parameter where we want to draw
  • method (str): the name of the method which we want to plot (such as plot, scatter, etc.)
  • *args: any positional arguments passed to the method (usually some data)
  • **kwargs: any keyword arguments passed to the method (usually styling options)
Returns
  • Artist: the artist that was drawn on the axis
Raises
  • EmptyFigureError: if figure is not set
  • AttributeError: if method is not a valid plotting method
Notes

The parameter name has to have already been plotted.

def plot( self, fisher: fitk.tensors.FisherMatrix, *args, mark_fiducials: Union[bool, dict] = False, **kwargs): 
1529    def plot(
1530        self,
1531        fisher: FisherMatrix,
1532        *args,
1533        mark_fiducials: Union[bool, dict] = False,
1534        **kwargs,
1535    ):
1536        """
1537        Plot the 1D curves of the Fisher objects.
1538
1539        Parameters
1540        ----------
1541        fisher
1542            the Fisher object which we want to plot
1543
1544        mark_fiducials : bool or dict, optional
1545            whether or not the fiducials should be marked on the plots
1546            (default: False). If set to ``True``, uses ``linestyle='--'`` and
1547            ``color='black'`` as the default. If a dictionary, accepts the same
1548            keyword arguments as <a
1549            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/_as_gen/matplotlib.axes.Axes.axvline.html#matplotlib.axes.Axes.axvline"
1550            target="_blank" rel="noreferrer
1551            noopener">``matplotlib.axes.Axes.axvline``</a>.  If an empty
1552            dictionary, uses the default style (determined automatically).
1553
1554            .. versionadded:: 0.6.0
1555
1556        **kwargs
1557            any keyword arguments used for plotting (same as ``plot_curve_1d``)
1558
1559        Returns
1560        -------
1561        None
1562        """
1563        size = len(fisher)
1564
1565        added = False
1566
1567        # in order to preserve colors for each object, we only use the
1568        # (default) cycler when the color is not explicitly set
1569        if "c" not in kwargs and "color" not in kwargs:
1570            kwargs["color"] = next(self.current_color)
1571            self.current_color = iter(self.current_color)
1572
1573        if self.max_cols is not None and self.max_cols <= size:
1574            full = size % self.max_cols == 0
1575            layout = (
1576                size // self.max_cols if full else size // self.max_cols + 1,
1577                self.max_cols,
1578            )
1579        else:
1580            layout = 1, size
1581            full = True
1582
1583        with plt.rc_context(self.options):
1584            # general figure setup
1585            if self.figure:
1586                fig = self.figure
1587                axes = self.axes
1588            else:
1589                fig = plt.figure(
1590                    clear=True,
1591                    figsize=(2 * layout[1], 2 * layout[0]),
1592                )
1593                gs = fig.add_gridspec(
1594                    nrows=layout[0],
1595                    ncols=layout[1],
1596                    hspace=self.hspace,
1597                    wspace=self.wspace,
1598                )
1599                axes = gs.subplots()
1600                if size == 1:
1601                    axes = np.array([axes])
1602
1603            for (index, name), latex_name in zip(
1604                enumerate(fisher.names),
1605                fisher.latex_names,
1606            ):
1607                ax = axes.flat[index]
1608
1609                bg_color = ax.get_facecolor()
1610
1611                _, __, handle = plot_curve_1d(fisher, name, ax, **kwargs)
1612
1613                if not added and kwargs.get("label"):
1614                    self.handles.append(handle)
1615                    self.labels.append(kwargs["label"])
1616                    added = True
1617
1618                for i in range(len(self.contour_levels) - 1, 0, -1):
1619                    _add_shading_1d(
1620                        fisher.fiducials[index],
1621                        fisher.constraints(name, marginalized=True),
1622                        ax,
1623                        level=self.contour_levels[i][0],
1624                        alpha=self.contour_levels[i][1],
1625                        zorder=2 - i / len(self.contour_levels),
1626                        **kwargs,
1627                    )
1628
1629                    _add_shading_1d(
1630                        fisher.fiducials[index],
1631                        fisher.constraints(name, marginalized=True),
1632                        ax,
1633                        level=self.contour_levels[i - 1][0],
1634                        alpha=1.0,
1635                        color=bg_color,
1636                        zorder=2 - i / len(self.contour_levels),
1637                    )
1638
1639                _add_shading_1d(
1640                    fisher.fiducials[index],
1641                    fisher.constraints(name, marginalized=True),
1642                    ax,
1643                    level=self.contour_levels[0][0],
1644                    alpha=self.contour_levels[0][1],
1645                    zorder=1.99,
1646                    **kwargs,
1647                )
1648
1649                ax.autoscale()
1650                ax.set_xlabel(latex_name)
1651                ax.relim()
1652                ax.autoscale_view()
1653
1654                # the y axis should start at 0 since we're plotting a PDF
1655                ax.set_ylim(0, ax.get_ylim()[-1])
1656
1657                ax.set_yticks([])
1658
1659                # marking the fiducials
1660                if not mark_fiducials is False:
1661                    if mark_fiducials is True:
1662                        mark_fiducials = dict(linestyle="--", color="black")
1663
1664                    _mark_fiducial_1d(
1665                        fisher,
1666                        fisher.names[index],
1667                        ax,
1668                        **mark_fiducials,
1669                    )
1670
1671            # remove any axes which are not drawn
1672            if not full:
1673                for index in range(
1674                    size,
1675                    layout[0] * layout[1],
1676                ):
1677                    # it's simpler to turn off the axis, than completely remove
1678                    # it
1679                    axes.flat[index].axis("off")
1680
1681        self._figure = fig
1682        self._axes = axes
1683        self._names = fisher.names

Plot the 1D curves of the Fisher objects.

Parameters
  • fisher: the Fisher object which we want to plot

  • mark_fiducials (bool or dict, optional): whether or not the fiducials should be marked on the plots (default: False). If set to True, uses linestyle='--' and color='black' as the default. If a dictionary, accepts the same keyword arguments as matplotlib.axes.Axes.axvline. If an empty dictionary, uses the default style (determined automatically).

    New in version 0.6.0.

  • **kwargs: any keyword arguments used for plotting (same as plot_curve_1d)
Returns
  • None
def legend( self, *args: matplotlib.artist.Artist, overwrite: bool = False, loc: Union[str, tuple[float, float]] = 'lower center', bbox_to_anchor: Any = (0.5, 1), **kwargs): 
1685    def legend(
1686        self,
1687        *args: Artist,
1688        overwrite: bool = False,
1689        loc: Union[str, tuple[float, float]] = "lower center",
1690        bbox_to_anchor: Any = (0.5, 1),
1691        **kwargs,
1692    ):
1693        """
1694        Create a legend on the figure.
1695
1696        Parameters
1697        ----------
1698        *args
1699            any positional arguments for the legend
1700
1701        overwrite : bool, optional
1702            whether to overwrite any "nice" options set by ``fitk`` (default:
1703            False)
1704
1705        loc : str or tuple of floats, optional
1706            which corner of the legend to use as the positioning anchor
1707            (default: 'lower center')
1708
1709        bbox_to_anchor : Any, optional
1710            the location of where to place the legend (default: ``[0.5, 1]``)
1711
1712        **kwargs
1713            any other keyword arguments for the legend
1714
1715        Returns
1716        -------
1717        Artist
1718            the legend that was drawn on the figure
1719
1720        Raises
1721        ------
1722        EmptyFigureError
1723            if ``figure`` is not set
1724        """
1725        if not self.figure:
1726            raise EmptyFigureError
1727
1728        with plt.rc_context(self.options):
1729            ax = self.axes.flat[0]
1730            if not overwrite:
1731                if ax.get_legend():
1732                    ax.get_legend().remove()
1733
1734                return ax.legend(
1735                    self.handles,
1736                    self.labels,
1737                    loc=loc,
1738                    bbox_to_anchor=bbox_to_anchor,
1739                    bbox_transform=self.figure.transFigure,
1740                    **kwargs,
1741                )
1742
1743            return ax.legend(
1744                *args,
1745                loc=loc,
1746                bbox_to_anchor=bbox_to_anchor,
1747                **kwargs,
1748            )

Create a legend on the figure.

Parameters
  • *args: any positional arguments for the legend
  • overwrite (bool, optional): whether to overwrite any "nice" options set by fitk (default: False)
  • loc (str or tuple of floats, optional): which corner of the legend to use as the positioning anchor (default: 'lower center')
  • bbox_to_anchor (Any, optional): the location of where to place the legend (default: [0.5, 1])
  • **kwargs: any other keyword arguments for the legend
Returns
  • Artist: the legend that was drawn on the figure
Raises
  • EmptyFigureError: if figure is not set
def set_title(self, *args, x: float = 0.5, y: float = 1.2, **kwargs): 
1750    def set_title(
1751        self,
1752        *args,
1753        x: float = 0.5,
1754        y: float = 1.2,
1755        **kwargs,
1756    ):
1757        """
1758        Draw a title on the figure.
1759
1760        Parameters
1761        ----------
1762        *args
1763            any positional arguments to ``figure.suptitle``
1764
1765        x : float, optional
1766            the x position of the title (default: ``0.5``)
1767
1768        y : float, optional
1769            the y position of the title (default: ``1.2``)
1770
1771        **kwargs
1772            any keyword arguments to ``figure.suptitle``
1773
1774        Returns
1775        -------
1776        Artist
1777            the title that was drawn on the figure
1778
1779        Raises
1780        ------
1781        EmptyFigureError
1782            if ``figure`` is not set
1783        """
1784        if not self.figure:
1785            raise EmptyFigureError
1786
1787        with plt.rc_context(self.options):
1788            return self.figure.suptitle(*args, x=x, y=y, **kwargs)

Draw a title on the figure.

Parameters
  • *args: any positional arguments to figure.suptitle
  • x (float, optional): the x position of the title (default: 0.5)
  • y (float, optional): the y position of the title (default: 1.2)
  • **kwargs: any keyword arguments to figure.suptitle
Returns
  • Artist: the title that was drawn on the figure
Raises
  • EmptyFigureError: if figure is not set

class FisherFigure2D(FisherMultipleAxesFigure): 
1791class FisherFigure2D(FisherMultipleAxesFigure):
1792    r"""
1793    Container for easy access to elements in the 2D plot.
1794
1795    Examples
1796    --------
1797    Define some Fisher matrices:
1798
1799    >>> m1 = FisherMatrix(
1800    ... [[3, -2], [-2, 5]],
1801    ... names=['a', 'b'],
1802    ... latex_names=[r'$\mathcal{A}$', r'$\mathcal{B}$'],
1803    ... )
1804    >>> m2 = FisherMatrix(
1805    ... [[4, 1], [1, 6]],
1806    ... names=['a', 'b'],
1807    ... latex_names=[r'$\mathcal{A}$', r'$\mathcal{B}$'],
1808    ... )
1809
1810    Instantiate a figure:
1811
1812    >>> fig = FisherFigure2D(show_1d_curves=True)
1813
1814    Draw a "triangle plot" with the previously defined Fisher matrix:
1815
1816    >>> fig.plot(m1, label='first')
1817
1818    Add a plot with a different color and style:
1819
1820    >>> fig.plot(m2, label='second', ls=':', color='green')
1821
1822    Draw some other stuff on it:
1823
1824    >>> artist, = fig.draw('a', 'b', 'plot', [-1, 0, 1], [-1, 0, 1], color='red', label='curve')
1825    >>> # alternatively, the below will accomplish the same thing
1826    >>> # artist, = fig['a', 'b'].plot([-1, 0, 1], [-1, 0, 1], color='red')
1827    >>> # note that in this case, due to certain limitations, you need to
1828    >>> # manually add the legend using a convenience function:
1829    >>> # fig.add_artist_to_legend(artist, label='curve')
1830
1831    Add a legend:
1832
1833    >>> _ = fig.legend()
1834
1835    Add a title:
1836
1837    >>> _ = fig.set_title('Example Fisher matrix 2D plotting')
1838
1839    Save it to a file:
1840
1841    >>> fig.savefig(
1842    ... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure2d_example1.png",
1843    ... dpi=150)
1844
1845    <img width="100%" gsee+wxLFmyxJFNJA5AYTEhDrRjxw4UFhaau/SlUimMRqODW0XIwHXmzBkAwJo1a3Dp0iXMnTsXgwYNwj//+U9ERkYiOjrawS0kjkDDcIQ4SGVlJeLj4/Hzzz8jLi4OABAZGYmamhqUl5c7uHWEDExeXl5QqVS4du0a9u3bh/LycuTm5mLbtm1ISUmBRCLBd999h5tvvtnRTSV2RMESIQ5y1113ISIiAq+88op53+jRo3HhwgXo9XowDOPA1hEy8Fy9ehWDBw/GY489hjfffLPFMY7j8Pjjj+Ptt99GUFAQ8vPzHdRK4gg0DEeIA3zyySc4d+4cnn/+eRiNRvN/bm5uMBqNqK6udnQTCRlw9u7dCwBt9hoxDIP169fDx8cHBQUF1Ps7wFCCNyF2dvbsWaxduxZKpRKurq5oq3M3JycHnp6eDmgdIQPX7t27oVKpMG3atDaPSyQShIeHo66uju7PAYaCJUJ6Gcdx5iG1qqoqLFq0CA8++CBWrlzZ6twNGzbgm2++QXJyMuLj4+3cUkIGLp1Oh0OHDuGOO+6AUChs8xyj0YisrCzcd9997Z5D+icahiOkF+Xl5WHKlCm4du0aCgsLsWDBAkRFReHtt99GQkJCq/8mTZoEAPj9998d3HJCBpaff/4ZDQ0NSExMxKZNm9rs8V2/fj1CQ0Oxfv16B7SQOBIleBPSi3766ScsXLjQvD1t2jTs2rULrq6ubZ5/4sQJTJo0CXK5HEuWLMHQoUPx9NNP26u5hAxYc+fORXl5OTIyMlBTU4PExESsXr0avr6+yM3Nxbfffgt/f3+89dZbUCgUjm4usTMKlgjpRXq9HqtWrcKuXbuwePFivPvuux2+0ZpMJowdOxbFxcV45plnsHbtWqoSTEgvS01Nxb333otPP/0UJSUl+Mc//oGzZ89CJBIhJiYGiYmJuO+++zBkyBBHN5U4CAVLhBBCCCEdoEdWQgghhJAOULBECCGEENIBCpYIIYQQQjpAwRIhhBBCSAcoWCKEEEII6QAFS4QQQgghHaBgiRBCCCGkAxQsEUIIIYR0gIIlQgghhJAOULBECCGEENIBCpYIIYQQQjpAwRIhhBBCSAcoWCKEEEII6QAFS4QQQgghHaBgiRBCCCGkAxQsEUIIIYR0gIIlQgghhJAOULBECCGEENKB/w8WxU9jGmY6VgAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==">
1846    """
1847
1848    def __init__(
1849        self,
1850        options: Optional[dict] = None,
1851        hspace: float = 0,
1852        wspace: float = 0,
1853        show_1d_curves: bool = False,
1854        show_joint_dist: bool = False,
1855        contour_levels: Optional[Sequence[tuple[float, float]]] = None,
1856        contour_levels_1d: Optional[Sequence[tuple[float, float]]] = None,
1857        contour_levels_2d: Optional[Sequence[tuple[float, float]]] = None,
1858    ):
1859        """
1860        Create an instance.
1861
1862        Parameters
1863        ----------
1864        options : dict, optional
1865            the dictionary containing the options for plotting. If the special
1866            key 'style' is present, it attempts to use that plotting style (can
1867            be one of the outputs of <a
1868            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/style_api.html#matplotlib.style.matplotlib.style.available"
1869            target="_blank" rel="noopener
1870            noreferrer">``matplotlib.style.available``</a>, or a path to a file.
1871            If using a file, does not use the default rc parameters).
1872
1873        hspace : float, optional
1874            The amount of height reserved for space between subplots, expressed
1875            as a fraction of the average axis height.
1876
1877        wspace : float, optional
1878            The amount of width reserved for space between subplots, expressed
1879            as a fraction of the average axis width.
1880
1881        show_1d_curves : bool, optional
1882            whether the 1D marginalized curves should be plotted (default:
1883            False)
1884
1885        show_joint_dist : bool, optional
1886            whether to plot the isocontours of the joint distribution (default:
1887            False)
1888
1889            .. note::
1890
1891                This argument specifies whether we wish to plot the p-value of
1892                the *joint* distribution, or the p-value of the probability of
1893                a single parameter lying within the bounds projected onto a
1894                parameter axis. For more details, see <a
1895                href="https://arxiv.org/abs/0906.0664" target="_blank"
1896                rel="noopener noreferrer">arXiv:0906.0664</a>, section 2.
1897
1898        contour_levels : array_like of 2-tuples, optional
1899            the points at which the sigma level should be shaded, along with
1900            the associated opacity (default: None). If not specified, defaults
1901            to ``[(1, 0.3), (2, 0.1)]``.
1902
1903        contour_levels_1d : array_like of 2-tuples, optional
1904            the points at which the sigma level should be shaded (on the 1D
1905            plots), along with the associated opacity (default: None). If not
1906            specified, defaults to ``[(1, 0.3), (2, 0.1)]``.
1907
1908            .. versionadded:: 0.6.1
1909
1910        contour_levels_2d : array_like of 2-tuples, optional
1911            the points at which the sigma level should be shaded (on the 2D
1912            plots), along with the associated opacity (default: None). If not
1913            specified, defaults to ``[(1, 0.3), (2, 0.1)]``.
1914
1915            .. versionadded:: 0.6.1
1916
1917        Notes
1918        -----
1919        For the style sheet reference, please consult <a
1920        href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/gallery/style_sheets/style_sheets_reference.html"
1921        target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">the matplotlib
1922        documentation</a>.
1923        """
1924        super().__init__(
1925            options=options,
1926            wspace=wspace,
1927            hspace=hspace,
1928            contour_levels=contour_levels,
1929        )
1930        self.show_1d_curves = show_1d_curves
1931        self.show_joint_dist = show_joint_dist
1932        self._ndim = 2
1933
1934        if contour_levels_1d is None:
1935            self.contour_levels_1d = self.contour_levels
1936        else:
1937            self.contour_levels_1d = _parse_contour_levels(contour_levels_1d)
1938
1939        if contour_levels_2d is None:
1940            self.contour_levels_2d = self.contour_levels
1941        else:
1942            self.contour_levels_2d = _parse_contour_levels(contour_levels_2d)
1943
1944    def __getitem__(
1945        self,
1946        key: tuple[str, str],
1947    ):
1948        if not self.figure:
1949            raise EmptyFigureError
1950
1951        if not isinstance(key, tuple):
1952            raise TypeError(
1953                f"Incompatible type for element access: expected `tuple`, got `{type(key)}`"
1954            )
1955
1956        name1, name2 = key
1957
1958        if name1 not in self.names:
1959            raise ParameterNotFoundError(name1, self.names)
1960        if name2 not in self.names:
1961            raise ParameterNotFoundError(name2, self.names)
1962
1963        # edge case
1964        if not self.show_1d_curves and name1 == name2:
1965            return None
1966
1967        index1 = np.where(self.names == name1)
1968        index2 = np.where(self.names == name2)
1969
1970        if index1 < index2:
1971            index1, index2 = index2, index1
1972
1973        return self.axes[index1, index2][0, 0]
1974
1975    def legend(
1976        self,
1977        *args: Artist,
1978        overwrite: bool = False,
1979        loc: Union[str, tuple[float, float]] = "upper right",
1980        bbox_to_anchor: Optional[Any] = None,
1981        **kwargs,
1982    ):
1983        """
1984        Create a legend on the figure.
1985
1986        Parameters
1987        ----------
1988        *args
1989            any positional arguments for the legend
1990
1991        overwrite : bool, optional
1992            whether to overwrite any "nice" options set by ``fitk`` (default:
1993            False)
1994
1995        loc : str or tuple of floats, optional
1996            which corner of the legend to use as the positioning anchor
1997            (default: 'upper right')
1998
1999        bbox_to_anchor : Any, optional
2000            the location of where to place the legend (default: None, picked by
2001            ``fitk`` based on information about the plot)
2002
2003        **kwargs
2004            any other keyword arguments for the legend
2005
2006        Returns
2007        -------
2008        Artist
2009            the legend that was drawn on the figure
2010
2011        Raises
2012        ------
2013        EmptyFigureError
2014            if ``figure`` is not set
2015        """
2016        if not self.figure:
2017            raise EmptyFigureError
2018
2019        with plt.rc_context(self.options):
2020            # this will always exist since we can't plot < 2 parameters
2021            ax = self[self.names[0], self.names[1]]
2022            if not overwrite:
2023                if self.show_1d_curves:
2024                    i, j = 0, -1
2025                else:
2026                    i, j = 1, -2
2027
2028                bbox_to_anchor = (
2029                    self.axes[0, j].get_position().xmax,
2030                    self.axes[i, 0].get_position().ymax,
2031                )
2032
2033                if ax.get_legend():
2034                    ax.get_legend().remove()
2035
2036                return ax.legend(
2037                    self.handles,
2038                    self.labels,
2039                    loc=loc,
2040                    bbox_to_anchor=bbox_to_anchor,
2041                    bbox_transform=self.figure.transFigure,
2042                    **kwargs,
2043                )
2044
2045            return ax.legend(
2046                *args,
2047                loc=loc,
2048                bbox_to_anchor=bbox_to_anchor,
2049                **kwargs,
2050            )
2051
2052    def set_title(
2053        self,
2054        *args,
2055        overwrite: bool = False,
2056        xscale: float = 0.5,
2057        yscale: float = 1.08,
2058        **kwargs,
2059    ):
2060        """
2061        Draw a title on the figure.
2062
2063        Parameters
2064        ----------
2065        *args
2066            any positional arguments to ``figure.suptitle``
2067
2068        xscale : float, optional
2069            the x position of the title (default: ``0.5``)
2070
2071        yscale : float, optional
2072            the y position of the title (default: ``1.08``)
2073
2074        **kwargs
2075            any keyword arguments to ``figure.suptitle``
2076
2077        Returns
2078        -------
2079        Artist
2080            the title that was drawn on the figure
2081
2082        Raises
2083        ------
2084        EmptyFigureError
2085            if ``figure`` is not set
2086        """
2087        if not self.figure:
2088            raise EmptyFigureError
2089
2090        with plt.rc_context(self.options):
2091            if not overwrite:
2092                if self.show_1d_curves:
2093                    i, j = 0, -1
2094                else:
2095                    i, j = 1, -2
2096
2097                x, y = (
2098                    self.axes[0, j].get_position().xmax,
2099                    self.axes[i, 0].get_position().ymax,
2100                )
2101
2102                return self.figure.suptitle(
2103                    *args,
2104                    x=x * xscale,
2105                    y=y * yscale,
2106                    **kwargs,
2107                )
2108
2109            return self.figure.suptitle(*args, **kwargs)
2110
2111    def draw(
2112        self,
2113        name1: str,
2114        name2: str,
2115        method: str,
2116        *args,
2117        **kwargs,
2118    ):
2119        """
2120        Implement drawing of other objects on the axis.
2121
2122        Parameters
2123        ----------
2124        name1 : str
2125            the name (label) of the first parameter where we want to draw
2126
2127        name2 : str
2128            the name (label) of the second parameter where we want to draw
2129
2130        method : str
2131            the name of the method which we want to plot (such as ``plot``,
2132            ``scatter``, etc.)
2133
2134        *args
2135            any positional arguments passed to the method (usually some data)
2136
2137        **kwargs
2138            any keyword arguments passed to the method (usually styling options)
2139
2140        Returns
2141        -------
2142        Artist
2143            the artist that was drawn on the axis
2144
2145        Raises
2146        ------
2147        EmptyFigureError
2148            if ``figure`` is not set
2149
2150        AttributeError
2151            if ``method`` is not a valid plotting method
2152
2153        Notes
2154        -----
2155        The parameters ``name1`` and ``name2`` have to have already been plotted.
2156        """
2157        if not hasattr(self[name1, name2], method):
2158            raise AttributeError(
2159                f"The method `{method}` is not a valid plotting method"
2160            )
2161
2162        # get the right color
2163        if "c" not in kwargs and "color" not in kwargs:
2164            kwargs["color"] = next(self.current_color)
2165            self.current_color = iter(self.current_color)
2166
2167        with plt.rc_context(self.options):
2168            # hopefully the return type should be some artist, or a collection
2169            # of artists
2170            handles = getattr(self[name1, name2], method)(*args, **kwargs)
2171            if is_iterable(handles):
2172                for handle in handles:
2173                    if isinstance(handle, Artist) and kwargs.get("label"):
2174                        self.labels.append(kwargs["label"])
2175                        self.handles.append(handle)
2176            else:
2177                if isinstance(handles, Artist) and kwargs.get("label"):
2178                    self.labels.append(kwargs["label"])
2179                    self.handles.append(handles)
2180
2181        self[name1, name2].autoscale()
2182        self[name1, name2].relim()
2183        self[name1, name2].autoscale_view()
2184
2185        return handles
2186
2187    def plot(
2188        self,
2189        fisher: FisherMatrix,
2190        *args,
2191        mark_fiducials: Union[bool, dict] = False,
2192        **kwargs,
2193    ):
2194        r"""
2195        Plot the 2D contours (and optionally 1D curves) of the Fisher objects.
2196
2197        Parameters
2198        ----------
2199        fisher : FisherMatrix
2200            the Fisher object which we want to plot
2201
2202        mark_fiducials : bool or dict, optional
2203            whether or not the fiducials should be marked on the plots
2204            (default: False). If set to ``True``, uses ``linestyle='--'`` and
2205            ``color='black'`` as the default. If a dictionary, accepts the same
2206            keyword arguments as <a
2207            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/_as_gen/matplotlib.axes.Axes.axvline.html#matplotlib.axes.Axes.axvline"
2208            target="_blank" rel="noreferrer
2209            noopener">``matplotlib.axes.Axes.axvline``</a>.  If an empty
2210            dictionary, uses the default style (determined automatically).
2211
2212            .. versionadded:: 0.6.0
2213
2214        **kwargs
2215            any keyword arguments used for plotting (same as ``plot_curve_2d``)
2216
2217        Returns
2218        -------
2219        None
2220
2221        Examples
2222        --------
2223        Define a Fisher matrix:
2224
2225        >>> m = FisherMatrix([[3, -2], [-2, 5]], names=['a', 'b'], latex_names=[r'$\mathcal{A}$', r'$\mathcal{B}$'])
2226
2227        Initiate a figure:
2228
2229        >>> fig = FisherFigure2D(show_1d_curves=True)
2230
2231        Draw a "triangle plot" with the previously defined Fisher matrix:
2232
2233        >>> fig.plot(m)
2234
2235        Save it to a file:
2236
2237        >>> fig.savefig(
2238        ... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure2d_plot_example.png",
2239        ... dpi=150)
2240
2241        <img width="100%" src="data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAksAAAIoCAYAAAB53a/2AAAAOXRFWHRTb2Z0d2FyZQBNYXRwbG90bGliIHZlcnNpb24zLjcuMSwgaHR0cHM6Ly9tYXRwbG90bGliLm9yZy/bCgiHAAAACXBIWXMAABcSAAAXEgFnn9JSAAB9vUlEQVR4nO3dd3hb5d0+8FvDkixPee+Z7STOIgkkBAJhlzACaVkN0BZCS6EtZZSO0L79UWiB8rbQEt4WApQ9CgFCSEKAQPay4zjTe8V7y5ascX5/yJKPEsdT0tGR7s91caEjydITJ5JuPc/3fB+FIAgCiIiIiGhQSqkHQEREROTPGJaIiIiIhsCwRERERDQEhiUiIiKiITAsEREREQ2BYYmIiIhoCAxLRERERENgWCIiIiIaAsMSERER0RAYloiIiIiGwLBERERENASGJSIiIqIhqKUeAI1cUlISjEYjMjIypB4KEZ2mqqoKYWFhqK+vl3ooRORhnFmSEaPRCIvFIvUwiGgQFosFRqNR6mEQkRdwZklGnDNKxcXFEo+EiE6Xl5cn9RCIyEs4s0REREQ0BIYlIiIioiEwLBERERENgWGJiIiIaAgMS0RERERDYFgiIiIiGgLDEhEREdEQ2GeJyMcEQcCXxxtRXNsJAIgN1+KqmcmICg2ReGRERDQYhiUiH6pp68Ej7xfh25Jmt+v/94sTeGLFTCydnCDRyIiI6Gy4DEfkI3srWnH5s9+cEZQAoKHTjDte3otnNh2XYGRERDQUhiUiH2jqMuPHrx9At9nqum5SYjjmZRqgVipc1/1tawk2Hj4lxRCJiOgsuAxH5GU2u4Cfv12Api4zAEClVOD2c7OwMCcGCoUCtW29+Oe2UtR3mAAAD753CNOSo5ARq5dy2ERE1I8zS0Re9n/flLktva2cm4Zzc2OhUDhmlFINobh36QRo1Y6XY5fJip++eQB2uyDJeImIyB3DEpEXtff04fmtJa7juZkGXDTlzCLupEgdVp2b5TourOnABi7HERH5BYYlIi/61zfl6OqvU9JrVPj+wkzXjNLp5mfHYG6mwXX87JaTsHF2iYhIcgxLRF7SauzDy9vLXceXTktEmHboMsHl+SlwRqmSxm58XFjnxRESEdFIMCwRecnabaUw9tkAAGEaFS6ekjjsz6RGh2J+dozr+H+/OAmrze61MRIR0fAYloi8oLfPhjd2V7mOL5+ehFCNakQ/e/XMFDhX6sqbjfjqeJM3hkhERCPEsETkBRuKTqHL5KhV0qqVo+rMnRSlw5yMgdqlt/ZWDXFvIiLyNoYlIi94e2+16/KC7BjoQkY2q+S0ZGKc6/LWY42uHkxEROR7DEtEHlba1I09Fa2u48Wi4DNSU5MjERumAQDYBeD9AzUeGx8REY0OwxKRh70jmlVKM4QiOzZs1I+hVCjcQtbbe6vZpJKISCIMS0QeZLXZ3WaBzp8Qd9a+SsNZlBvnKvSuau3BrvIWTwyRiIhGiWGJyIP2VLSiubsPgGMPuAU5sWN+rJgwDfKSI13HnxXVj3t8REQ0egxLRB70+eGBQDM1OQLhwzShHM68zIGeS58X13MpjohIAgxLRB5itwvYWDwQlsSn/49VfnoUlP1LcY1dZhysbhv3YxIR0egwLBF5SEFNOxo6zQAAhQKYnR497seM0IVgUmKE63jjYS7FERH5GsMSkYeIg8ykhAhE6EI88rhzRTNUnx2uhyBwKY6IyJcYlog8QBAEfHb4lOt4bub4l+CcZmdEuy7XtPWiuK7TY49NRETDY1gi8oATDd2obu11HYsDznhF6zXIjR/o1bTpSIPHHpuIiIbHsETkAV+faHRdzojRw6DXePTxZ4nqn7ad4Ma6RES+xLBE5AHbTjS7Lk9PjRzinmOTlxLlunyoph3tPX0efw4iIhocwxLROPX0WbGnfGAvuOmiYOMpaYZQROocPZvsAvBtSfMwP0FERJ7CsEQ0T
