GW24q7X9uOuJTn45aWTx3WijNwEz590nJqbm/HnP/8Z27dvxwsvvOB2m06nwxtvvAGbzYYVK1bg2LFj6O3txauvvorHH38cy5Ytwy9+8QuJRk5ENLjmbjN+9tZB/PDVfW5B6fbzsvD3m+YwKBFWzkvH2lvnQq8Z+Lfw4rYyfOfv32B/ZZuEI/OtoA1Ljz32GBQKBRQKBSorKwE4mkoqFApkZWWdcf/Y2FhcddVViI2NxYoVK864/bzzzsOBAweQkpKC888/HwaDAU888QQee+wxbNiwASEhLAImIv/Q22fDP78qxUVPfYUPC+pc14eGqPDsd2fhseV5XmviSvKzbFoi1t+7GJMSB7q2n2joxg0v7MDP3jqIqhbvnW3uLxQCe5rLhnPp72x9mIhIOjqdDrm5uX79+mzuNuON3VV4dWflGft/5adH46kbZmJi4tgaqlpsdrQaB2+f4mnlzUZ0i85ODQRTkiN8UhsW1n/W71j09Fnxpw3H8J/dlRAnB7VSgeX5Kbh9URZmpkV7ZqBeMJ7PUNYsEREFsC6TBV8db8L6wjp8dbzR1SPMKVyrxgOXTsL3z83ibBINSa9R43+unY5rZ6fg0Q8Ou84kttoFfHCwFh8crEVeSiSumZWCK6YnB1QDU4YlIqIA0t7Th0M1HdhX2YbdZS3YX9kGq/3MBQSNWolV52bingsnICZs8N0HiAYzNzMGG+4/H/89WIu/bj6B2vZe123FdZ0oruvE4xuOISc+DIsnxGFupgGz0w1IM4TKdqschiUiIpmw2wV091nR0t2H5m4zGjpNqGvvRXVrLypajDjZ0I36TtOQj5EQocVtCzNx04IMxIVrfTRyCjQqpQI3zE3DNbNS8Nnhery8vRwHq9rd7lPWZERZkxGv7nTUBYdr1ZiYGI7s2DBkxoYhJVqH5KhQxEdoERuuQXRoiN+2Z2FYIiLyoY2HT2FfRRtsggCb3fGf1SbAahdgsdnRZ7XDbLXBbLWj12JDb58N3WYrus1WdPZaMMgk0bCi9SG4aEoCrp2VivNyY/32A4nkJ0SlxPL8FCzPT0FJYxc+KqjDhqJTKG0ynnHfbrMVB6vazwhVYs6dFMJ1aug1KoSGqKALUUGrVkKjVkKjUkKtUkClVEKtVEDV/1+4Vo2fXzLJa39OFnjLSEREBCwWC3Jzue0Akb85cuQItFrtsK/Pxi4zOnosQ95nvJRKuD5k9BrH/71NAGAbS5IbA4vNDruPnstXtGoV4IMVKqVCAV+shFlsAnr6rOi12GCy2GCxevfvS6VUICd+6P3rSktLERISgq6uke3aIMaZJRkJCwuD0XhmWpdaaWkpADDEjRJ/b2Pnr7+7s22mLZYQoUVChPvyl7/+eUZDAcdZUb6gVvqm/1Mg/L1IJUSlQFRoiMf3zhzP30lISAjCwsa2ITBnlmjc2NJgbPh7G7tA+90F2p8nUPDvxf9I9XfChWsiIiKiITAsEREREQ2BYYmIiIhoCAxLRERERENgWCIiIiIaAs+GIyIiIhoCZ5aIiIiIhsCwRERERDQEhiUiIiKiITAsEREREQ2BYYmIiIhoCAxLRERERENgWCIiIiIaAsMSERER0RAYlsjjWlpa8PTTT2Pp0qWIjY1FSEgIEhIScMUVV2D9+vVSD09yJpMJf/jDHzB58mTodDokJyfjtttuQ3l5udRD81tbt27FD37wA0yaNAk6nQ56vR7Tpk3Dgw8+iKamJqmH53F8DUmHr0//4xevf4HIw+Li4gSFQiH87ne/EyoqKoTu7m5hx44dwjnnnCMAEH7+859LPUTJ9PT0COedd54QHh4uvPPOO4LRaBQKCgqE/Px8ISoqSigoKJB6iH7nueeeEwAIM2fOFL744guhs7NTqKmpEZ588kkhJCRESExMFI4fPy71MD2KryFp8PXpf/zl9c+wRB4XFhYmrF69+ozrGxoahMjISAGAsHPnTglGJr2HHnpIACA899xzbteXlJQIKpVKyMvLE6xWq0Sj809/+ctfBI1GI1RVVZ1x28MPPywAEC6//HIJRuY9fA1Jg69P/+Mvr38uw5HHzZkzB7fddtsZ1yckJGDBggUAgE2bNvl6WJLr6enB888/D41Gg1WrVrndlpubi2XLlqG4uBgbNmyQaIT+KSkpCTfddBPS09PPuG358uUAgC1btsBms/l6aF7D15Dv8fXpn/zl9c+wRB63bds2nHfeeYPeFhUV5ePR+I+tW7fCaDQiPz8f4eHhZ9y+ePFiAGBNymluvfVWrFu3btDbnP+eFAoFhADaE5yvId/j69M/+cvrn2GJfOrYsWMAgAsvvFDagUigsLAQAJCdnT3o7Tk5OW73o+E5/z0tXrwYarVa4tH4RjC/hryJr0/58eXrn2GJfObgwYM4fPgwLrzwQixZskTq4fhcfX09ACAmJmbQ2w0Gg9v9aHivvvoqFAoFfve730k9FJ8I9teQN/H1KT++fP0Hx1cxGpXrrrsOR48eHdXPvPrqq5g/f/5Zb7fb7bj33nthMBjwyiuvjHeIstTT0wMA0Gg0g96u1Wrd7kdD27hxI9avX48HHnjA72ZZ+BqSH74+5cXXr3+GJTpDeXk5jh8/PqqfGe4N5IEHHkBBQQE2b96MjIyM8QxPtvR6PQCgr69v0NvNZrPb/ejsTp48iVWrVmHFihV48sknpR7OGfgakh++PuVDitc/wxKdoaCgwKOP9/vf/x7//ve/8cknn5y1aDUYJCUlAQBaW1sHvb2trQ0AkJyc7LMxyVFlZSUuueQSLF68GG+88QZUKpXUQzoDX0Pyw9enPEj1+mdYIq969NFH8c9//hObN292nfIcrGbNmgUAZ+0EXFZWBgCYOXOmr4YkOyUlJbj44ouxZMkSrFu3zi+DkqfxNeQbfH36Pylf/yzwJq/52c9+hhdffBFbt251e5PfsWMH3n77bQlHJo2lS5ciLCwMhw4dgtFoPOP27du3AxjoHULujhw5giVLluDSSy/FK6+84vZG+dRTT6G6ulrC0XkHX0O+w9enf5P89e/1tpcUdOx2u3D33XcLiYmJQlFR0Rm3r1mzRrjgggt8PzA/4Ow4+/zzz7tdX1paKqjVanYIPouCggIhPj5euPfeewW73X7G7QCEL7/80vcD8xK+hqTB16d/8ofXP5fhyKMEQcDtt9/uOrPnj3/84xn3OXz4MOLi4iQYnfTWrFmDbdu24ZFHHkFiYiKuvPJKV7GiXq/H66+/HhRLS6Oxb98+XHrppTCbzWhqasJNN90k9ZC8iq8h6fD16X/85vXv1ShGQaetrU0AMOx/wfytuLe3V3jssceEiRMnClqtVkhISBBuueUWobS0VOqh+aX7779/RP+mAmVmia8hafH16V/85fWvEIQA2iOAiIiIyMNY4E1EREQ0BIYlIiIioiEwLBERERENgWGJiIiIaAgMS0RERERDYFgiIiIiGgLDEhEREdEQGJaIiIiIhsCwRERERDQEhiUiIiKiITAsEREREQ2BYYnIjzz44IOYMWOG1MMgClptbW149NFHkZub67pu27ZtWLlyJeLj46HT6XDBBRfg5MmTEo6SfI1hichPvPTSS3jqqafQ1dUl9VCIglJxcTFuu+02PP300wgPD0dXVxdWrVqFt956C6tXr8batWsxadIkbNu2DT/+8Y+lHi75kEIQBEHqQRAFu56eHsybNw9Hjx5FZmYmKioqpB4SUVDq6OhAdHQ0LrvsMrS1teGOO+7A6tWrXbfX1tYiLS0NM2fORGFhoYQjJV/izBKRH/jrX/+KO++8E0olX5JEUjpx4gQAYNOmTcjJyXELSmI33XSTL4dFEuPMEpHEqqurccUVV2D//v2IiopCUlISZ5aIJPL666/j1ltvhU6nQ2lpKVJSUly39fT04JZbbkF8fDxeeOEFfrkJImqpB0AU7O677z48+uij0Gq10Gg0Ug+HKKgdOnQIAHD77be7glJVVRVeffVVfPrpp/j5z3+OlStXSjlEkgBjMZGEPvroI9TV1bmm9LVaLaxWq8SjIgpe+/fvBwCsXr0axcXFuOyyy5CVlYXf/va3yM3NxcSJEyUeIUmBy3BEEmltbcWsWbPw8ccfIz8/HwCQm5uLjo4ONDc3Szw6ouAUExOD2NhYnDx5Eps3b0ZzczOqqqrw5ptvorCwEBqNBu+99x6uvvpqqYdKPsSwRCSR733ve8jJycHjjz/uum7OnDkoKipCX18fFAqFhKMjCj4nTpzA5MmT8fOf/xzPPPOM222CIOAXv/gFnn32WaSmpqKmpkaiUZIUuAxHJIF//etfOHjwIH7961/DarW6/ouMjITVakV7e7vUQyQKOps2bQKAQWeNFAoFnnzyScTHx6O2tpazv0GGBd5EPnbgwAHce++9CA8PR0REBAab3K2srITBYJBgdETBa+PGjYiNjcWSJUsGvV2j0SA7OxtdXV18fQYZhiUiLxMEwbWk1tbWhhUrVuBHP/oRVq1adcZ9n3rqKbz99tsoKCjArFmzfDxSouBlNpvx1Vdf4cYbb4RKpRr0PlarFeXl5bjzzjvPeh8KTFyGI/Ki6upqLF68GCdPnkRdXR2uuuoqTJgwAc8++yzmzZt3xn/nnXceAODLL7+UeOREweXjjz+G0WjEsmXL8PLLLw864/vkk08iIyMDTz75pAQjJCmxwJvIiz788ENcd911ruMlS5bgk08+QURExKD337lzJ8477zyEhoZi5cqVmDp1Kh5++GFfDZcoaF122WVobm5GaWkpOjo6sGzZMtx9991ISEhAVVUV3n33XSQlJeGvf/0r9Hq91MMlH2NYIvKivr4+3H777fjkk09www034LnnnhvyjdZms+Gcc85BfX09HnnkEdx7773sEkzkZUePHsUdd9yBf//732hoaMBvfvMbHDhwAGq1GpMmTcKyZctw5513YsqUKVIPlSTCsEREREQ0BH5lJSIiIhoCwxIRERHREBiWiIiIiIbAsEREREQ0BIYlIiIioiEwLBERERENgWGJiIiIaAgMS0RERERDYFgiIiIiGgLDEhEREdEQGJaIiIiIhsCwRERERDQEhiUiIiKiITAsEREREQ2BYYmIiIhoCAxLRERERENgWCIiIiIawv8HEInV5ooXfmAAAAAASUVORK5CYII=">
2242        """
2243        size = len(fisher)
2244
2245        if size < 2:
2246            raise ValueError("Unable to make a 2D plot with < 2 parameters")
2247
2248        if self.names is not None:
2249            # make sure they have the same names; if not, raise an error
2250            if set(self.names) != set(fisher.names):
2251                raise ValueError(
2252                    f"The Fisher object names ({fisher.names}) "
2253                    f"do not match those on the figure ({self.names})"
2254                )
2255
2256            # otherwise, we reshuffle them
2257            fisher = fisher.sort(key=self.names)
2258
2259        # in order to preserve colors for each object, we only use the
2260        # (default) cycler when the color is not explicitly set
2261        if "c" not in kwargs and "color" not in kwargs:
2262            kwargs["color"] = next(self.current_color)
2263            self.current_color = iter(self.current_color)
2264
2265        with plt.rc_context(self.options):
2266            # general figure setup
2267            if self.figure:
2268                fig = self.figure
2269                ax = self.axes
2270            else:
2271                fig = plt.figure(
2272                    figsize=(2 * size, 2 * size),
2273                    clear=True,
2274                )
2275                ax = fig.add_gridspec(
2276                    nrows=size,
2277                    ncols=size,
2278                    hspace=self.hspace,
2279                    wspace=self.wspace,
2280                ).subplots(
2281                    sharex="col",
2282                    sharey=False,
2283                )
2284
2285            # set automatic limits
2286            _set_limits_2d(ax=ax, size=size)
2287
2288            # flag for whether the current artist has already been added to the
2289            # legend handle
2290            added = False
2291            # loop over the parameters
2292            for i, j in product(range(len(fisher.names)), repeat=2):
2293                namey, latex_namey, namex, latex_namex = (
2294                    fisher.names[i],
2295                    fisher.latex_names[i],
2296                    fisher.names[j],
2297                    fisher.latex_names[j],
2298                )
2299
2300                # the color of the background of that axis
2301                bg_color = ax[i, j].get_facecolor()
2302
2303                # labels for 2D contours (increasing y)
2304                if i > 0 and j == 0:
2305                    ax[i, j].set_ylabel(latex_namey)
2306
2307                # labels for 2D contours (increasing x)
2308                if i == size - 1:
2309                    ax[i, j].set_xlabel(latex_namex)
2310
2311                # removing any unnecessary axes from the gridspec
2312                if i < j and self.figure is None:
2313                    # calling `remove()` is better than `axis("off")` because
2314                    # then we obtain the proper bounding box
2315                    try:
2316                        ax[i, j].remove()
2317                    except KeyError:
2318                        pass
2319
2320                # plotting the 2D contours
2321                elif i > j:
2322                    # we plot them from the largest to the smallest (excluding the top-most one)
2323                    for index in range(len(self.contour_levels_2d) - 1, 0, -1):
2324                        # the 2-sigma
2325                        plot_curve_2d(
2326                            fisher,
2327                            namex,
2328                            namey,
2329                            ax=ax[i, j],
2330                            scaling_factor=self.contour_levels_2d[index][0]
2331                            if not self.show_joint_dist
2332                            else np.sqrt(_get_chisq(self.contour_levels_2d[index][0])),
2333                            fill=False,
2334                            zorder=2,
2335                            **kwargs,
2336                        )
2337
2338                        # same thing, but shaded
2339                        plot_curve_2d(
2340                            fisher,
2341                            namex,
2342                            namey,
2343                            ax=ax[i, j],
2344                            scaling_factor=self.contour_levels_2d[index][0]
2345                            if not self.show_joint_dist
2346                            else np.sqrt(_get_chisq(self.contour_levels_2d[index][0])),
2347                            fill=True,
2348                            alpha=self.contour_levels_2d[index][1],
2349                            ec=None,
2350                            zorder=2 - i / len(self.contour_levels_2d),
2351                            **kwargs,
2352                        )
2353
2354                        # plotting the _smaller_ contour as an opaque "hole" so
2355                        # that the opacities are displayed properly
2356                        plot_curve_2d(
2357                            fisher,
2358                            namex,
2359                            namey,
2360                            ax=ax[i, j],
2361                            scaling_factor=self.contour_levels_2d[index - 1][0]
2362                            if not self.show_joint_dist
2363                            else np.sqrt(
2364                                _get_chisq(self.contour_levels_2d[index - 1][0])
2365                            ),
2366                            fill=True,
2367                            alpha=1.0,
2368                            ec=None,
2369                            fc=bg_color,
2370                            zorder=2 - i / len(self.contour_levels_2d),
2371                            **kwargs,
2372                        )
2373
2374                    # plot innermost contour (usually 1-sigma)
2375                    # NOTE this is the "68% of the probability of a
2376                    # single parameter lying within the bounds projected
2377                    # onto a parameter axis"
2378                    _, __, handle = plot_curve_2d(
2379                        fisher,
2380                        namex,
2381                        namey,
2382                        ax=ax[i, j],
2383                        scaling_factor=self.contour_levels_2d[0][0]
2384                        if not self.show_joint_dist
2385                        else np.sqrt(_get_chisq(self.contour_levels_2d[0][0])),
2386                        zorder=2,
2387                        fill=False,
2388                        **kwargs,
2389                    )
2390
2391                    if not added and kwargs.get("label"):
2392                        self.handles.append(handle)
2393                        self.labels.append(kwargs["label"])
2394                        added = True
2395
2396                    # same thing, but shaded
2397                    plot_curve_2d(
2398                        fisher,
2399                        namex,
2400                        namey,
2401                        ax=ax[i, j],
2402                        scaling_factor=self.contour_levels_2d[0][0]
2403                        if not self.show_joint_dist
2404                        else np.sqrt(_get_chisq(self.contour_levels_2d[0][0])),
2405                        fill=True,
2406                        alpha=self.contour_levels_2d[0][1],
2407                        ec=None,
2408                        zorder=1.99,
2409                        **kwargs,
2410                    )
2411
2412                if i == j:
2413                    # plotting the 1D Gaussians
2414                    if self.show_1d_curves is True:
2415                        plot_curve_1d(
2416                            fisher,
2417                            namex,
2418                            ax=ax[i, i],
2419                            **kwargs,
2420                        )
2421
2422                        for index in range(len(self.contour_levels_1d) - 1, 0, -1):
2423                            _add_shading_1d(
2424                                fisher.fiducials[i],
2425                                fisher.constraints(
2426                                    name=namex,
2427                                    marginalized=True,
2428                                )[0],
2429                                level=self.contour_levels_1d[index][0],
2430                                ax=ax[i, i],
2431                                alpha=self.contour_levels_1d[index][1],
2432                                zorder=2 - index / len(self.contour_levels_1d),
2433                                **kwargs,
2434                            )
2435
2436                            # shade the "hole" part of the previous contour
2437                            _add_shading_1d(
2438                                fisher.fiducials[i],
2439                                fisher.constraints(
2440                                    name=namex,
2441                                    marginalized=True,
2442                                )[0],
2443                                level=self.contour_levels_1d[index - 1][0],
2444                                ax=ax[i, i],
2445                                alpha=1.0,
2446                                zorder=2 - index / len(self.contour_levels_1d),
2447                                color=bg_color,
2448                            )
2449
2450                        # only the innermost contour does not have any "hole"
2451                        _add_shading_1d(
2452                            fisher.fiducials[i],
2453                            fisher.constraints(
2454                                name=namex,
2455                                marginalized=True,
2456                            )[0],
2457                            level=self.contour_levels_1d[0][0],
2458                            ax=ax[i, i],
2459                            alpha=self.contour_levels_1d[0][1],
2460                            zorder=1.99,
2461                            **kwargs,
2462                        )
2463
2464                    else:
2465                        if self.figure is None:
2466                            try:
2467                                ax[i, i].remove()
2468                            except KeyError:
2469                                pass
2470
2471            # set automatic limits
2472            _rescale_limits_2d(ax=ax, size=size)
2473
2474            # marking the fiducials
2475            _mark_fiducials(
2476                fisher=fisher,
2477                ax=ax,
2478                size=size,
2479                mark_fiducials=mark_fiducials,
2480            )
2481
2482        self._figure = fig
2483        self._axes = ax
2484        self._names = fisher.names

Container for easy access to elements in the 2D plot.

Examples

Define some Fisher matrices:

>>> m1 = FisherMatrix(
... [[3, -2], [-2, 5]],
... names=['a', 'b'],
... latex_names=[r'$\mathcal{A}$', r'$\mathcal{B}$'],
... )
>>> m2 = FisherMatrix(
... [[4, 1], [1, 6]],
... names=['a', 'b'],
... latex_names=[r'$\mathcal{A}$', r'$\mathcal{B}$'],
... )

Instantiate a figure:

>>> fig = FisherFigure2D(show_1d_curves=True)

Draw a "triangle plot" with the previously defined Fisher matrix:

>>> fig.plot(m1, label='first')

Add a plot with a different color and style:

>>> fig.plot(m2, label='second', ls=':', color='green')

Draw some other stuff on it:

>>> artist, = fig.draw('a', 'b', 'plot', [-1, 0, 1], [-1, 0, 1], color='red', label='curve')
>>> # alternatively, the below will accomplish the same thing
>>> # artist, = fig['a', 'b'].plot([-1, 0, 1], [-1, 0, 1], color='red')
>>> # note that in this case, due to certain limitations, you need to
>>> # manually add the legend using a convenience function:
>>> # fig.add_artist_to_legend(artist, label='curve')

Add a legend:

>>> _ = fig.legend()

Add a title:

>>> _ = fig.set_title('Example Fisher matrix 2D plotting')

Save it to a file:

>>> fig.savefig(
... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure2d_example1.png",
... dpi=150)

FisherFigure2D( options: Optional[dict] = None, hspace: float = 0, wspace: float = 0, show_1d_curves: bool = False, show_joint_dist: bool = False, contour_levels: Optional[collections.abc.Sequence[tuple[float, float]]] = None, contour_levels_1d: Optional[collections.abc.Sequence[tuple[float, float]]] = None, contour_levels_2d: Optional[collections.abc.Sequence[tuple[float, float]]] = None) 
1848    def __init__(
1849        self,
1850        options: Optional[dict] = None,
1851        hspace: float = 0,
1852        wspace: float = 0,
1853        show_1d_curves: bool = False,
1854        show_joint_dist: bool = False,
1855        contour_levels: Optional[Sequence[tuple[float, float]]] = None,
1856        contour_levels_1d: Optional[Sequence[tuple[float, float]]] = None,
1857        contour_levels_2d: Optional[Sequence[tuple[float, float]]] = None,
1858    ):
1859        """
1860        Create an instance.
1861
1862        Parameters
1863        ----------
1864        options : dict, optional
1865            the dictionary containing the options for plotting. If the special
1866            key 'style' is present, it attempts to use that plotting style (can
1867            be one of the outputs of <a
1868            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/style_api.html#matplotlib.style.matplotlib.style.available"
1869            target="_blank" rel="noopener
1870            noreferrer">``matplotlib.style.available``</a>, or a path to a file.
1871            If using a file, does not use the default rc parameters).
1872
1873        hspace : float, optional
1874            The amount of height reserved for space between subplots, expressed
1875            as a fraction of the average axis height.
1876
1877        wspace : float, optional
1878            The amount of width reserved for space between subplots, expressed
1879            as a fraction of the average axis width.
1880
1881        show_1d_curves : bool, optional
1882            whether the 1D marginalized curves should be plotted (default:
1883            False)
1884
1885        show_joint_dist : bool, optional
1886            whether to plot the isocontours of the joint distribution (default:
1887            False)
1888
1889            .. note::
1890
1891                This argument specifies whether we wish to plot the p-value of
1892                the *joint* distribution, or the p-value of the probability of
1893                a single parameter lying within the bounds projected onto a
1894                parameter axis. For more details, see <a
1895                href="https://arxiv.org/abs/0906.0664" target="_blank"
1896                rel="noopener noreferrer">arXiv:0906.0664</a>, section 2.
1897
1898        contour_levels : array_like of 2-tuples, optional
1899            the points at which the sigma level should be shaded, along with
1900            the associated opacity (default: None). If not specified, defaults
1901            to ``[(1, 0.3), (2, 0.1)]``.
1902
1903        contour_levels_1d : array_like of 2-tuples, optional
1904            the points at which the sigma level should be shaded (on the 1D
1905            plots), along with the associated opacity (default: None). If not
1906            specified, defaults to ``[(1, 0.3), (2, 0.1)]``.
1907
1908            .. versionadded:: 0.6.1
1909
1910        contour_levels_2d : array_like of 2-tuples, optional
1911            the points at which the sigma level should be shaded (on the 2D
1912            plots), along with the associated opacity (default: None). If not
1913            specified, defaults to ``[(1, 0.3), (2, 0.1)]``.
1914
1915            .. versionadded:: 0.6.1
1916
1917        Notes
1918        -----
1919        For the style sheet reference, please consult <a
1920        href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/gallery/style_sheets/style_sheets_reference.html"
1921        target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">the matplotlib
1922        documentation</a>.
1923        """
1924        super().__init__(
1925            options=options,
1926            wspace=wspace,
1927            hspace=hspace,
1928            contour_levels=contour_levels,
1929        )
1930        self.show_1d_curves = show_1d_curves
1931        self.show_joint_dist = show_joint_dist
1932        self._ndim = 2
1933
1934        if contour_levels_1d is None:
1935            self.contour_levels_1d = self.contour_levels
1936        else:
1937            self.contour_levels_1d = _parse_contour_levels(contour_levels_1d)
1938
1939        if contour_levels_2d is None:
1940            self.contour_levels_2d = self.contour_levels
1941        else:
1942            self.contour_levels_2d = _parse_contour_levels(contour_levels_2d)

Create an instance.

Parameters
  • options (dict, optional): the dictionary containing the options for plotting. If the special key 'style' is present, it attempts to use that plotting style (can be one of the outputs of matplotlib.style.available, or a path to a file. If using a file, does not use the default rc parameters).
  • hspace (float, optional): The amount of height reserved for space between subplots, expressed as a fraction of the average axis height.
  • wspace (float, optional): The amount of width reserved for space between subplots, expressed as a fraction of the average axis width.
  • show_1d_curves (bool, optional): whether the 1D marginalized curves should be plotted (default: False)

  • show_joint_dist (bool, optional): whether to plot the isocontours of the joint distribution (default: False)

    This argument specifies whether we wish to plot the p-value of the joint distribution, or the p-value of the probability of a single parameter lying within the bounds projected onto a parameter axis. For more details, see arXiv:0906.0664, section 2.

  • contour_levels (array_like of 2-tuples, optional): the points at which the sigma level should be shaded, along with the associated opacity (default: None). If not specified, defaults to [(1, 0.3), (2, 0.1)].

  • contour_levels_1d (array_like of 2-tuples, optional): the points at which the sigma level should be shaded (on the 1D plots), along with the associated opacity (default: None). If not specified, defaults to [(1, 0.3), (2, 0.1)].

    New in version 0.6.1.

  • contour_levels_2d (array_like of 2-tuples, optional): the points at which the sigma level should be shaded (on the 2D plots), along with the associated opacity (default: None). If not specified, defaults to [(1, 0.3), (2, 0.1)].

    New in version 0.6.1.

Notes

For the style sheet reference, please consult the matplotlib documentation.

def legend( self, *args: matplotlib.artist.Artist, overwrite: bool = False, loc: Union[str, tuple[float, float]] = 'upper right', bbox_to_anchor: Optional[Any] = None, **kwargs): 
1975    def legend(
1976        self,
1977        *args: Artist,
1978        overwrite: bool = False,
1979        loc: Union[str, tuple[float, float]] = "upper right",
1980        bbox_to_anchor: Optional[Any] = None,
1981        **kwargs,
1982    ):
1983        """
1984        Create a legend on the figure.
1985
1986        Parameters
1987        ----------
1988        *args
1989            any positional arguments for the legend
1990
1991        overwrite : bool, optional
1992            whether to overwrite any "nice" options set by ``fitk`` (default:
1993            False)
1994
1995        loc : str or tuple of floats, optional
1996            which corner of the legend to use as the positioning anchor
1997            (default: 'upper right')
1998
1999        bbox_to_anchor : Any, optional
2000            the location of where to place the legend (default: None, picked by
2001            ``fitk`` based on information about the plot)
2002
2003        **kwargs
2004            any other keyword arguments for the legend
2005
2006        Returns
2007        -------
2008        Artist
2009            the legend that was drawn on the figure
2010
2011        Raises
2012        ------
2013        EmptyFigureError
2014            if ``figure`` is not set
2015        """
2016        if not self.figure:
2017            raise EmptyFigureError
2018
2019        with plt.rc_context(self.options):
2020            # this will always exist since we can't plot < 2 parameters
2021            ax = self[self.names[0], self.names[1]]
2022            if not overwrite:
2023                if self.show_1d_curves:
2024                    i, j = 0, -1
2025                else:
2026                    i, j = 1, -2
2027
2028                bbox_to_anchor = (
2029                    self.axes[0, j].get_position().xmax,
2030                    self.axes[i, 0].get_position().ymax,
2031                )
2032
2033                if ax.get_legend():
2034                    ax.get_legend().remove()
2035
2036                return ax.legend(
2037                    self.handles,
2038                    self.labels,
2039                    loc=loc,
2040                    bbox_to_anchor=bbox_to_anchor,
2041                    bbox_transform=self.figure.transFigure,
2042                    **kwargs,
2043                )
2044
2045            return ax.legend(
2046                *args,
2047                loc=loc,
2048                bbox_to_anchor=bbox_to_anchor,
2049                **kwargs,
2050            )

Create a legend on the figure.

Parameters
  • *args: any positional arguments for the legend
  • overwrite (bool, optional): whether to overwrite any "nice" options set by fitk (default: False)
  • loc (str or tuple of floats, optional): which corner of the legend to use as the positioning anchor (default: 'upper right')
  • bbox_to_anchor (Any, optional): the location of where to place the legend (default: None, picked by fitk based on information about the plot)
  • **kwargs: any other keyword arguments for the legend
Returns
  • Artist: the legend that was drawn on the figure
Raises
  • EmptyFigureError: if figure is not set
def set_title( self, *args, overwrite: bool = False, xscale: float = 0.5, yscale: float = 1.08, **kwargs): 
2052    def set_title(
2053        self,
2054        *args,
2055        overwrite: bool = False,
2056        xscale: float = 0.5,
2057        yscale: float = 1.08,
2058        **kwargs,
2059    ):
2060        """
2061        Draw a title on the figure.
2062
2063        Parameters
2064        ----------
2065        *args
2066            any positional arguments to ``figure.suptitle``
2067
2068        xscale : float, optional
2069            the x position of the title (default: ``0.5``)
2070
2071        yscale : float, optional
2072            the y position of the title (default: ``1.08``)
2073
2074        **kwargs
2075            any keyword arguments to ``figure.suptitle``
2076
2077        Returns
2078        -------
2079        Artist
2080            the title that was drawn on the figure
2081
2082        Raises
2083        ------
2084        EmptyFigureError
2085            if ``figure`` is not set
2086        """
2087        if not self.figure:
2088            raise EmptyFigureError
2089
2090        with plt.rc_context(self.options):
2091            if not overwrite:
2092                if self.show_1d_curves:
2093                    i, j = 0, -1
2094                else:
2095                    i, j = 1, -2
2096
2097                x, y = (
2098                    self.axes[0, j].get_position().xmax,
2099                    self.axes[i, 0].get_position().ymax,
2100                )
2101
2102                return self.figure.suptitle(
2103                    *args,
2104                    x=x * xscale,
2105                    y=y * yscale,
2106                    **kwargs,
2107                )
2108
2109            return self.figure.suptitle(*args, **kwargs)

Draw a title on the figure.

Parameters
  • *args: any positional arguments to figure.suptitle
  • xscale (float, optional): the x position of the title (default: 0.5)
  • yscale (float, optional): the y position of the title (default: 1.08)
  • **kwargs: any keyword arguments to figure.suptitle

def draw(self, name1: str, name2: str, method: str, *args, **kwargs): 
2111    def draw(
2112        self,
2113        name1: str,
2114        name2: str,
2115        method: str,
2116        *args,
2117        **kwargs,
2118    ):
2119        """
2120        Implement drawing of other objects on the axis.
2121
2122        Parameters
2123        ----------
2124        name1 : str
2125            the name (label) of the first parameter where we want to draw
2126
2127        name2 : str
2128            the name (label) of the second parameter where we want to draw
2129
2130        method : str
2131            the name of the method which we want to plot (such as ``plot``,
2132            ``scatter``, etc.)
2133
2134        *args
2135            any positional arguments passed to the method (usually some data)
2136
2137        **kwargs
2138            any keyword arguments passed to the method (usually styling options)
2139
2140        Returns
2141        -------
2142        Artist
2143            the artist that was drawn on the axis
2144
2145        Raises
2146        ------
2147        EmptyFigureError
2148            if ``figure`` is not set
2149
2150        AttributeError
2151            if ``method`` is not a valid plotting method
2152
2153        Notes
2154        -----
2155        The parameters ``name1`` and ``name2`` have to have already been plotted.
2156        """
2157        if not hasattr(self[name1, name2], method):
2158            raise AttributeError(
2159                f"The method `{method}` is not a valid plotting method"
2160            )
2161
2162        # get the right color
2163        if "c" not in kwargs and "color" not in kwargs:
2164            kwargs["color"] = next(self.current_color)
2165            self.current_color = iter(self.current_color)
2166
2167        with plt.rc_context(self.options):
2168            # hopefully the return type should be some artist, or a collection
2169            # of artists
2170            handles = getattr(self[name1, name2], method)(*args, **kwargs)
2171            if is_iterable(handles):
2172                for handle in handles:
2173                    if isinstance(handle, Artist) and kwargs.get("label"):
2174                        self.labels.append(kwargs["label"])
2175                        self.handles.append(handle)
2176            else:
2177                if isinstance(handles, Artist) and kwargs.get("label"):
2178                    self.labels.append(kwargs["label"])
2179                    self.handles.append(handles)
2180
2181        self[name1, name2].autoscale()
2182        self[name1, name2].relim()
2183        self[name1, name2].autoscale_view()
2184
2185        return handles

Implement drawing of other objects on the axis.

Parameters
  • name1 (str): the name (label) of the first parameter where we want to draw
  • name2 (str): the name (label) of the second parameter where we want to draw
  • method (str): the name of the method which we want to plot (such as plot, scatter, etc.)
  • *args: any positional arguments passed to the method (usually some data)
  • **kwargs: any keyword arguments passed to the method (usually styling options)
Returns
  • Artist: the artist that was drawn on the axis
Raises
  • EmptyFigureError: if figure is not set
  • AttributeError: if method is not a valid plotting method
Notes

The parameters name1 and name2 have to have already been plotted.

def plot( self, fisher: fitk.tensors.FisherMatrix, *args, mark_fiducials: Union[bool, dict] = False, **kwargs): 
2187    def plot(
2188        self,
2189        fisher: FisherMatrix,
2190        *args,
2191        mark_fiducials: Union[bool, dict] = False,
2192        **kwargs,
2193    ):
2194        r"""
2195        Plot the 2D contours (and optionally 1D curves) of the Fisher objects.
2196
2197        Parameters
2198        ----------
2199        fisher : FisherMatrix
2200            the Fisher object which we want to plot
2201
2202        mark_fiducials : bool or dict, optional
2203            whether or not the fiducials should be marked on the plots
2204            (default: False). If set to ``True``, uses ``linestyle='--'`` and
2205            ``color='black'`` as the default. If a dictionary, accepts the same
2206            keyword arguments as <a
2207            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/_as_gen/matplotlib.axes.Axes.axvline.html#matplotlib.axes.Axes.axvline"
2208            target="_blank" rel="noreferrer
2209            noopener">``matplotlib.axes.Axes.axvline``</a>.  If an empty
2210            dictionary, uses the default style (determined automatically).
2211
2212            .. versionadded:: 0.6.0
2213
2214        **kwargs
2215            any keyword arguments used for plotting (same as ``plot_curve_2d``)
2216
2217        Returns
2218        -------
2219        None
2220
2221        Examples
2222        --------
2223        Define a Fisher matrix:
2224
2225        >>> m = FisherMatrix([[3, -2], [-2, 5]], names=['a', 'b'], latex_names=[r'$\mathcal{A}$', r'$\mathcal{B}$'])
2226
2227        Initiate a figure:
2228
2229        >>> fig = FisherFigure2D(show_1d_curves=True)
2230
2231        Draw a "triangle plot" with the previously defined Fisher matrix:
2232
2233        >>> fig.plot(m)
2234
2235        Save it to a file:
2236
2237        >>> fig.savefig(
2238        ... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure2d_plot_example.png",
2239        ... dpi=150)

0Sj809/+ctfBI1GI1RVVZ1x28MPPywAEC6//HIJRuY9fA1Jg69P/+Mvr38uw5HHzZkzB7fddtsZ1yckJGDBggUAgE2bNvl6WJLr6enB888/D41Gg1WrVrndlpubi2XLlqG4uBgbNmyQaIT+KSkpCTfddBPS09PPuG358uUAgC1btsBms/l6aF7D15Dv8fXpn/zl9c+wRB63bds2nHfeeYPeFhUV5ePR+I+tW7fCaDQiPz8f4eHhZ9y+ePFiAGBNymluvfVWrFu3btDbnP+eFAoFhADaE5yvId/j69M/+cvrn2GJfOrYsWMAgAsvvFDagUigsLAQAJCdnT3o7Tk5OW73o+E5/z0tXrwYarVa4tH4RjC/hryJr0/58eXrn2GJfObgwYM4fPgwLrzwQixZskTq4fhcfX09ACAmJmbQ2w0Gg9v9aHivvvoqFAoFfve730k9FJ8I9teQN/H1KT++fP0Hx1cxGpXrrrsOR48eHdXPvPrqq5g/f/5Zb7fb7bj33nthMBjwyiuvjHeIstTT0wMA0Gg0g96u1Wrd7kdD27hxI9avX48HHnjA72ZZ+BqSH74+5cXXr3+GJTpDeXk5jh8/PqqfGe4N5IEHHkBBQQE2b96MjIyM8QxPtvR6PQCgr69v0NvNZrPb/ejsTp48iVWrVmHFihV48sknpR7OGfgakh++PuVDitc/wxKdoaCgwKOP9/vf/x7//ve/8cknn5y1aDUYJCUlAQBaW1sHvb2trQ0AkJyc7LMxyVFlZSUuueQSLF68GG+88QZUKpXUQzoDX0Pyw9enPEj1+mdYIq969NFH8c9//hObN292nfIcrGbNmgUAZ+0EXFZWBgCYOXOmr4YkOyUlJbj44ouxZMkSrFu3zi+DkqfxNeQbfH36Pylf/yzwJq/52c9+hhdffBFbt251e5PfsWMH3n77bQlHJo2lS5ciLCwMhw4dgtFoPOP27du3AxjoHULujhw5giVLluDSSy/FK6+84vZG+dRTT6G6ulrC0XkHX0O+w9enf5P89e/1tpcUdOx2u3D33XcLiYmJQlFR0Rm3r1mzRrjgggt8PzA/4Ow4+/zzz7tdX1paKqjVanYIPouCggIhPj5euPfeewW73X7G7QCEL7/80vcD8xK+hqTB16d/8ofXP5fhyKMEQcDtt9/uOrPnj3/84xn3OXz4MOLi4iQYnfTWrFmDbdu24ZFHHkFiYiKuvPJKV7GiXq/H66+/HhRLS6Oxb98+XHrppTCbzWhqasJNN90k9ZC8iq8h6fD16X/85vXv1ShGQaetrU0AMOx/wfytuLe3V3jssceEiRMnClqtVkhISBBuueUWobS0VOqh+aX7779/RP+mAmVmia8hafH16V/85fWvEIQA2iOAiIiIyMNY4E1EREQ0BIYlIiIioiEwLBERERENgWGJiIiIaAgMS0RERERDYFgiIiIiGgLDEhEREdEQGJaIiIiIhsCwRERERDQEhiUiIiKiITAsEREREQ2BYYnIjzz44IOYMWOG1MMgClptbW149NFHkZub67pu27ZtWLlyJeLj46HT6XDBBRfg5MmTEo6SfI1hichPvPTSS3jqqafQ1dUl9VCIglJxcTFuu+02PP300wgPD0dXVxdWrVqFt956C6tXr8batWsxadIkbNu2DT/+8Y+lHi75kEIQBEHqQRAFu56eHsybNw9Hjx5FZmYmKioqpB4SUVDq6OhAdHQ0LrvsMrS1teGOO+7A6tWrXbfX1tYiLS0NM2fORGFhoYQjJV/izBKRH/jrX/+KO++8E0olX5JEUjpx4gQAYNOmTcjJyXELSmI33XSTL4dFEuPMEpHEqqurccUVV2D//v2IiopCUlISZ5aIJPL666/j1ltvhU6nQ2lpKVJSUly39fT04JZbbkF8fDxeeOEFfrkJImqpB0AU7O677z48+uij0Gq10Gg0Ug+HKKgdOnQIAHD77be7glJVVRVeffVVfPrpp/j5z3+OlStXSjlEkgBjMZGEPvroI9TV1bmm9LVaLaxWq8SjIgpe+/fvBwCsXr0axcXFuOyyy5CVlYXf/va3yM3NxcSJEyUeIUmBy3BEEmltbcWsWbPw8ccfIz8/HwCQm5uLjo4ONDc3Szw6ouAUExOD2NhYnDx5Eps3b0ZzczOqqqrw5ptvorCwEBqNBu+99x6uvvpqqYdKPsSwRCSR733ve8jJycHjjz/uum7OnDkoKipCX18fFAqFhKMjCj4nTpzA5MmT8fOf/xzPPPOM222CIOAXv/gFnn32WaSmpqKmpkaiUZIUuAxHJIF//etfOHjwIH7961/DarW6/ouMjITVakV7e7vUQyQKOps2bQKAQWeNFAoFnnzyScTHx6O2tpazv0GGBd5EPnbgwAHce++9CA8PR0REBAab3K2srITBYJBgdETBa+PGjYiNjcWSJUsGvV2j0SA7OxtdXV18fQYZhiUiLxMEwbWk1tbWhhUrVuBHP/oRVq1adcZ9n3rqKbz99tsoKCjArFmzfDxSouBlNpvx1Vdf4cYbb4RKpRr0PlarFeXl5bjzzjvPeh8KTFyGI/Ki6upqLF68GCdPnkRdXR2uuuoqTJgwAc8++yzmzZt3xn/nnXceAODLL7+UeOREweXjjz+G0WjEsmXL8PLLLw864/vkk08iIyMDTz75pAQjJCmxwJvIiz788ENcd911ruMlS5bgk08+QURExKD337lzJ8477zyEhoZi5cqVmDp1Kh5++GFfDZcoaF122WVobm5GaWkpOjo6sGzZMtx9991ISEhAVVUV3n33XSQlJeGvf/0r9Hq91MMlH2NYIvKivr4+3H777fjkk09www034LnnnhvyjdZms+Gcc85BfX09HnnkEdx7773sEkzkZUePHsUdd9yBf//732hoaMBvfvMbHDhwAGq1GpMmTcKyZctw5513YsqUKVIPlSTCsEREREQ0BH5lJSIiIhoCwxIRERHREBiWiIiIiIbAsEREREQ0BIYlIiIioiEwLBERERENgWGJiIiIaAgMS0RERERDYFgiIiIiGgLDEhEREdEQGJaIiIiIhsCwRERERDQEhiUiIiKiITAsEREREQ2BYYmIiIhoCAxLRERERENgWCIiIiIawv8HEInV5ooXfmAAAAAASUVORK5CYII=">
2242        """
2243        size = len(fisher)
2244
2245        if size < 2:
2246            raise ValueError("Unable to make a 2D plot with < 2 parameters")
2247
2248        if self.names is not None:
2249            # make sure they have the same names; if not, raise an error
2250            if set(self.names) != set(fisher.names):
2251                raise ValueError(
2252                    f"The Fisher object names ({fisher.names}) "
2253                    f"do not match those on the figure ({self.names})"
2254                )
2255
2256            # otherwise, we reshuffle them
2257            fisher = fisher.sort(key=self.names)
2258
2259        # in order to preserve colors for each object, we only use the
2260        # (default) cycler when the color is not explicitly set
2261        if "c" not in kwargs and "color" not in kwargs:
2262            kwargs["color"] = next(self.current_color)
2263            self.current_color = iter(self.current_color)
2264
2265        with plt.rc_context(self.options):
2266            # general figure setup
2267            if self.figure:
2268                fig = self.figure
2269                ax = self.axes
2270            else:
2271                fig = plt.figure(
2272                    figsize=(2 * size, 2 * size),
2273                    clear=True,
2274                )
2275                ax = fig.add_gridspec(
2276                    nrows=size,
2277                    ncols=size,
2278                    hspace=self.hspace,
2279                    wspace=self.wspace,
2280                ).subplots(
2281                    sharex="col",
2282                    sharey=False,
2283                )
2284
2285            # set automatic limits
2286            _set_limits_2d(ax=ax, size=size)
2287
2288            # flag for whether the current artist has already been added to the
2289            # legend handle
2290            added = False
2291            # loop over the parameters
2292            for i, j in product(range(len(fisher.names)), repeat=2):
2293                namey, latex_namey, namex, latex_namex = (
2294                    fisher.names[i],
2295                    fisher.latex_names[i],
2296                    fisher.names[j],
2297                    fisher.latex_names[j],
2298                )
2299
2300                # the color of the background of that axis
2301                bg_color = ax[i, j].get_facecolor()
2302
2303                # labels for 2D contours (increasing y)
2304                if i > 0 and j == 0:
2305                    ax[i, j].set_ylabel(latex_namey)
2306
2307                # labels for 2D contours (increasing x)
2308                if i == size - 1:
2309                    ax[i, j].set_xlabel(latex_namex)
2310
2311                # removing any unnecessary axes from the gridspec
2312                if i < j and self.figure is None:
2313                    # calling `remove()` is better than `axis("off")` because
2314                    # then we obtain the proper bounding box
2315                    try:
2316                        ax[i, j].remove()
2317                    except KeyError:
2318                        pass
2319
2320                # plotting the 2D contours
2321                elif i > j:
2322                    # we plot them from the largest to the smallest (excluding the top-most one)
2323                    for index in range(len(self.contour_levels_2d) - 1, 0, -1):
2324                        # the 2-sigma
2325                        plot_curve_2d(
2326                            fisher,
2327                            namex,
2328                            namey,
2329                            ax=ax[i, j],
2330                            scaling_factor=self.contour_levels_2d[index][0]
2331                            if not self.show_joint_dist
2332                            else np.sqrt(_get_chisq(self.contour_levels_2d[index][0])),
2333                            fill=False,
2334                            zorder=2,
2335                            **kwargs,
2336                        )
2337
2338                        # same thing, but shaded
2339                        plot_curve_2d(
2340                            fisher,
2341                            namex,
2342                            namey,
2343                            ax=ax[i, j],
2344                            scaling_factor=self.contour_levels_2d[index][0]
2345                            if not self.show_joint_dist
2346                            else np.sqrt(_get_chisq(self.contour_levels_2d[index][0])),
2347                            fill=True,
2348                            alpha=self.contour_levels_2d[index][1],
2349                            ec=None,
2350                            zorder=2 - i / len(self.contour_levels_2d),
2351                            **kwargs,
2352                        )
2353
2354                        # plotting the _smaller_ contour as an opaque "hole" so
2355                        # that the opacities are displayed properly
2356                        plot_curve_2d(
2357                            fisher,
2358                            namex,
2359                            namey,
2360                            ax=ax[i, j],
2361                            scaling_factor=self.contour_levels_2d[index - 1][0]
2362                            if not self.show_joint_dist
2363                            else np.sqrt(
2364                                _get_chisq(self.contour_levels_2d[index - 1][0])
2365                            ),
2366                            fill=True,
2367                            alpha=1.0,
2368                            ec=None,
2369                            fc=bg_color,
2370                            zorder=2 - i / len(self.contour_levels_2d),
2371                            **kwargs,
2372                        )
2373
2374                    # plot innermost contour (usually 1-sigma)
2375                    # NOTE this is the "68% of the probability of a
2376                    # single parameter lying within the bounds projected
2377                    # onto a parameter axis"
2378                    _, __, handle = plot_curve_2d(
2379                        fisher,
2380                        namex,
2381                        namey,
2382                        ax=ax[i, j],
2383                        scaling_factor=self.contour_levels_2d[0][0]
2384                        if not self.show_joint_dist
2385                        else np.sqrt(_get_chisq(self.contour_levels_2d[0][0])),
2386                        zorder=2,
2387                        fill=False,
2388                        **kwargs,
2389                    )
2390
2391                    if not added and kwargs.get("label"):
2392                        self.handles.append(handle)
2393                        self.labels.append(kwargs["label"])
2394                        added = True
2395
2396                    # same thing, but shaded
2397                    plot_curve_2d(
2398                        fisher,
2399                        namex,
2400                        namey,
2401                        ax=ax[i, j],
2402                        scaling_factor=self.contour_levels_2d[0][0]
2403                        if not self.show_joint_dist
2404                        else np.sqrt(_get_chisq(self.contour_levels_2d[0][0])),
2405                        fill=True,
2406                        alpha=self.contour_levels_2d[0][1],
2407                        ec=None,
2408                        zorder=1.99,
2409                        **kwargs,
2410                    )
2411
2412                if i == j:
2413                    # plotting the 1D Gaussians
2414                    if self.show_1d_curves is True:
2415                        plot_curve_1d(
2416                            fisher,
2417                            namex,
2418                            ax=ax[i, i],
2419                            **kwargs,
2420                        )
2421
2422                        for index in range(len(self.contour_levels_1d) - 1, 0, -1):
2423                            _add_shading_1d(
2424                                fisher.fiducials[i],
2425                                fisher.constraints(
2426                                    name=namex,
2427                                    marginalized=True,
2428                                )[0],
2429                                level=self.contour_levels_1d[index][0],
2430                                ax=ax[i, i],
2431                                alpha=self.contour_levels_1d[index][1],
2432                                zorder=2 - index / len(self.contour_levels_1d),
2433                                **kwargs,
2434                            )
2435
2436                            # shade the "hole" part of the previous contour
2437                            _add_shading_1d(
2438                                fisher.fiducials[i],
2439                                fisher.constraints(
2440                                    name=namex,
2441                                    marginalized=True,
2442                                )[0],
2443                                level=self.contour_levels_1d[index - 1][0],
2444                                ax=ax[i, i],
2445                                alpha=1.0,
2446                                zorder=2 - index / len(self.contour_levels_1d),
2447                                color=bg_color,
2448                            )
2449
2450                        # only the innermost contour does not have any "hole"
2451                        _add_shading_1d(
2452                            fisher.fiducials[i],
2453                            fisher.constraints(
2454                                name=namex,
2455                                marginalized=True,
2456                            )[0],
2457                            level=self.contour_levels_1d[0][0],
2458                            ax=ax[i, i],
2459                            alpha=self.contour_levels_1d[0][1],
2460                            zorder=1.99,
2461                            **kwargs,
2462                        )
2463
2464                    else:
2465                        if self.figure is None:
2466                            try:
2467                                ax[i, i].remove()
2468                            except KeyError:
2469                                pass
2470
2471            # set automatic limits
2472            _rescale_limits_2d(ax=ax, size=size)
2473
2474            # marking the fiducials
2475            _mark_fiducials(
2476                fisher=fisher,
2477                ax=ax,
2478                size=size,
2479                mark_fiducials=mark_fiducials,
2480            )
2481
2482        self._figure = fig
2483        self._axes = ax
2484        self._names = fisher.names

Plot the 2D contours (and optionally 1D curves) of the Fisher objects.

Parameters
  • fisher (FisherMatrix): the Fisher object which we want to plot

  • mark_fiducials (bool or dict, optional): whether or not the fiducials should be marked on the plots (default: False). If set to True, uses linestyle='--' and color='black' as the default. If a dictionary, accepts the same keyword arguments as matplotlib.axes.Axes.axvline. If an empty dictionary, uses the default style (determined automatically).

    New in version 0.6.0.

  • **kwargs: any keyword arguments used for plotting (same as plot_curve_2d)
Returns
  • None
Examples

Define a Fisher matrix:

>>> m = FisherMatrix([[3, -2], [-2, 5]], names=['a', 'b'], latex_names=[r'$\mathcal{A}$', r'$\mathcal{B}$'])

Initiate a figure:

>>> fig = FisherFigure2D(show_1d_curves=True)

Draw a "triangle plot" with the previously defined Fisher matrix:

>>> fig.plot(m)

Save it to a file:

>>> fig.savefig(
... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure2d_plot_example.png",
... dpi=150)

Inherited Members
FisherMultipleAxesFigure

set_minor_locator

FisherBaseFigure
options

handles

savefig
def plot_curve_1d( fisher: fitk.tensors.FisherMatrix, name: str, ax: Optional[matplotlib.axes._axes.Axes] = None, **kwargs) -> tuple[matplotlib.figure.Figure, matplotlib.axes._axes.Axes, matplotlib.artist.Artist]: 
2590def plot_curve_1d(
2591    fisher: FisherMatrix,
2592    name: str,
2593    ax: Optional[Axes] = None,
2594    **kwargs,
2595) -> tuple[Figure, Axes, Artist]:
2596    r"""
2597    Plot a 1D curve (usually marginalized Gaussian) from a Fisher object.
2598
2599    Parameters
2600    ----------
2601    fisher : FisherMatrix
2602        the Fisher matrix which we want to plot
2603
2604    name : str
2605        the name of the parameter which we want to plot
2606
2607    ax : matplotlib.axes.Axes, optional
2608        the axis on which we want to plot the contour (default: None). If None,
2609        plots to a new figure.
2610
2611    **kwargs
2612        any keyword arguments passed to <a
2613        href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/_as_gen/matplotlib.pyplot.plot.html"
2614        target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">``matplotlib.pyplot.plot``</a>.
2615
2616    Returns
2617    -------
2618    A 3-tuple ``(Figure, Axes, Artist)``
2619        The figure and the axis on which the artist was drawn on, as well as
2620        the artist itself.
2621
2622    Examples
2623    --------
2624    Define a Fisher matrix:
2625
2626    >>> m = FisherMatrix(
2627    ... [[3, -2], [-2, 5]],
2628    ... names=['a', 'b'],
2629    ... latex_names=[r'$\mathcal{A}$', r'$\mathcal{B}$'],
2630    ... )
2631
2632    Draw the marginalized parameter ``a``:
2633
2634    >>> fig, ax, artist = plot_curve_1d(m, name='a', ls='--', color='red')
2635
2636    Save it to a file:
2637
2638    >>> fig.savefig(
2639    ... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "plot_curve_1d_example1.png",
2640    ... dpi=100)
2641

UpJSdHy5curTvTYuXOnwo86+7R///6aN2+e/ud//kf333+/unbtqkWLFjEGIAAAcDzHjANoA+MIAQAQevj8dsgxgAAAAKg7CiAAAIDLUAABAABchgIIAADgMhRAAAAAl6EAAgAAuAwFEAAAwGUogAAAAC5DAQQAAHAZx0wFZ4NvEpXS0lLLSQAAQF35PrfdPBkaBbARDhw4IElKSkqynAQAANTXgQMHFBcXZzuGFcwF3Agej0d79uxRTEyMwsLCbMcJSaWlpUpKStKuXbtcOx+jv/Bc+hfPp3/xfPoPz2Xjeb1eHThwQB07dlR4uDuPhmMLYCOEh4erc+fOtmM4QmxsLG9kfsJz6V88n/7F8+k/PJeN49Ytfz7urL0AAAAuRgEEAABwGQogrIqKitKECRMUFRVlO0rI47n0L55P/+L59B+eS/gDJ4EAAAC4DFsAAQAAXIYCCAAA4DIUQAAAAJehAAIAALgMBRBB4auvvtLNN9+sM844Qy1atNDPfvYzTZgwQRUVFbajhaw//OEP6t+/v1q2bKnWrVvbjhNSpk2bpuTkZEVHRystLU1r1qyxHSlkvfPOO7ryyivVsWNHhYWFadGiRbYjhay8vDz16dNHMTExSkhI0NChQ7V582bbsRCiKIAICps2bZLH49Fzzz2nzz77TE8//bSmT5+u+++/33a0kFVRUaFrrrlGo0aNsh0lpCxYsEA5OTmaMGGC1q9fr169eikzM1N79+61HS0klZWVqVevXpo2bZrtKCHv7bff1ujRo/XBBx9o5cqVOnz4sAYPHqyysjLb0RCCGAYGQeuJJ57Qn//8Z23bts12lJA2e/Zs3XXXXfr+++9tRwkJaWlp6tOnj6ZOnSrJzPmdlJSkMWPGaNy4cZbThbawsDAtXLhQQ4cOtR3FEfbt26eEhAS9/fbbuuiii2zHQYhhCyCCVklJidq2bWs7BlykoqJC69atU0ZGRtVt4eHhysjIUEFBgcVkwLFKSkokifdJNAgFEEFp69atevbZZ3XrrbfajgIXKS4uVmVlpRITE2vcnpiYqMLCQkupgGN5PB7dddddGjBggHr27Gk7DkIQBRBNaty4cQoLCzvhZdOmTTUes3v3bl1++eW65pprNHLkSEvJg1NDnk8AzjN69Gj961//0vz5821HQYhqZjsAnO2ee+7RTTfddML7dOnSpWp5z549uuSSS9S/f3/NmDGjidOFnvo+n6if+Ph4RUREqKioqMbtRUVFat++vaVUQE233367li5dqnfeeUedO3e2HQchigKIJtWuXTu1a9euTvfdvXu3LrnkEqWmpuqFF15QeDgbqH+qPs8n6i8yMlKpqanKz8+vOlHB4/EoPz9ft99+u91wcD2v16sxY8Zo4cKFWr16tc444wzbkRDCKIAICrt379bAgQN1+umn68knn9S+ffuq/o8tLw2zc+dO7d+/Xzt37lRlZaU2bNggSTrzzDPVqlUru+GCWE5OjkaMGKHevXurb9++mjJlisrKypSdnW07Wkg6ePCgtm7dWvXv7du3a8OGDWrbtq1OO+00i8lCz+jRozVv3jwtXrxYMTExVcelxsXFqUWLFpbTIdQwDAyCwuzZs4/7Acsq2jA33XST5syZc8ztb731lgYOHBj4QCFk6tSpeuKJJ1RYWKiUlBQ988wzSktLsx0rJK1evVqXXHLJMbePGDFCs2fPDnygEBYWFlbr7S+88MJJDw0BfooCCAAA4DIcZAUAAOAyFEAAAACXoQACAAC4DAUQAADAZSiAAAAALkMBBAAAcBkKIAAAgMtQAAEAAFyGAggAAOAyFEAAAACXoQACAAC4DAUQAADAZSiAAAAALkMBBAAAcBkKIAAAgMtQAAEAAFyGAggAAOAyFEAAAACXoQACAAC4DAUQAADAZSiAAAAALkMBBAAAcBkKIAAAgMtQAAEAAFyGAggAAOAyFEAAAACXoQACAAC4DAUQAADAZSiAAAAALkMBBAAAcBkKIAAAgMv8P85CP7JqleVcAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC">
2643    """
2644    if ax is None:
2645        _, ax = plt.subplots()
2646
2647    fid = fisher.fiducials[np.where(fisher.names == name)]
2648    sigma = fisher.constraints(name, marginalized=True)
2649
2650    return _add_plot_1d(fid, sigma, ax=ax, **kwargs)

Plot a 1D curve (usually marginalized Gaussian) from a Fisher object.

Parameters
  • fisher (FisherMatrix): the Fisher matrix which we want to plot
  • name (str): the name of the parameter which we want to plot
  • ax (matplotlib.axes.Axes, optional): the axis on which we want to plot the contour (default: None). If None, plots to a new figure.
  • **kwargs: any keyword arguments passed to matplotlib.pyplot.plot.
Returns
  • A 3-tuple (Figure, Axes, Artist): The figure and the axis on which the artist was drawn on, as well as the artist itself.
Examples

Define a Fisher matrix:

>>> m = FisherMatrix(
... [[3, -2], [-2, 5]],
... names=['a', 'b'],
... latex_names=[r'$\mathcal{A}$', r'$\mathcal{B}$'],
... )

Draw the marginalized parameter a:

>>> fig, ax, artist = plot_curve_1d(m, name='a', ls='--', color='red')

Save it to a file:

>>> fig.savefig(
... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "plot_curve_1d_example1.png",
... dpi=100)

def plot_curve_2d( fisher: fitk.tensors.FisherMatrix, name1: str, name2: str, ax: Optional[matplotlib.axes._axes.Axes] = None, scaling_factor: float = 1, **kwargs) -> tuple[matplotlib.figure.Figure, matplotlib.axes._axes.Axes, matplotlib.artist.Artist]: 
2653def plot_curve_2d(
2654    fisher: FisherMatrix,
2655    name1: str,
2656    name2: str,
2657    ax: Optional[Axes] = None,
2658    scaling_factor: float = 1,
2659    **kwargs,
2660) -> tuple[Figure, Axes, Artist]:
2661    r"""
2662    Plot a 2D curve (usually ellipse) from two parameters of a Fisher object.
2663
2664    Parameters
2665    ----------
2666    fisher : FisherMatrix
2667        the Fisher matrix which we want to plot
2668
2669    name1 : str
2670        the name of the first parameter which we want to plot
2671
2672    name2 : str
2673        the name of the second parameter which we want to plot
2674
2675    ax : matplotlib.axes.Axes, optional
2676        the axis on which we want to plot the contour (default: None). If None,
2677        plots to a new figure.
2678
2679    **kwargs
2680        any keyword arguments passed to <a
2681        href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/_as_gen/matplotlib.patches.Ellipse.html"
2682        target="_blank" rel="noopener
2683        noreferrer">``matplotlib.patches.Ellipse``</a>.
2684
2685    Returns
2686    -------
2687    A 3-tuple ``(Figure, Axes, Artist)``
2688        The figure and the axis on which the artist was drawn on, as well as
2689        the artist itself.
2690
2691    Examples
2692    --------
2693    Define a Fisher matrix:
2694
2695    >>> m = FisherMatrix(
2696    ... [[3, -2], [-2, 5]],
2697    ... names=['a', 'b'],
2698    ... fiducials=[1, -2],
2699    ... latex_names=[r'$\mathcal{A}$', r'$\mathcal{B}$'],
2700    ... )
2701
2702    Draw the 1$\sigma$ contour of the parameter combination ``a``, ``b``:
2703
2704    >>> fig, ax, artist = plot_curve_2d(m, name1='a', name2='b', ls='--', color='red', fill=False)
2705
2706    Rescale the view a bit:
2707
2708    >>> _ = ax.autoscale()
2709    >>> _ = ax.relim()
2710    >>> _ = ax.autoscale_view()
2711
2712    Save it to a file:
2713
2714    >>> fig.savefig(
2715    ... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "plot_curve_2d_example1.png",
2716    ... dpi=100)
2717

PpIRkaGli5dqosvvvjwfdHR0br44ou1aNGi477uwQcfVIUKFdSnT59QlBlyJ3Nepk+frubNm6tfv36qWLGizjjjDD366KPKysoKVdkF7mTOS4sWLbR06dLD3cRr1qzRzJkzddlll4Wk5nC2aNGio86lJLVv3/6E/+8FUXZ2tnbv3q0yZcq4LsW5CRMmaM2aNRo2bJjrUsLK9OnTde655+rxxx/Xqaeeqrp16+ruu+/W/v37XZcWKIVdF4Cc2759u7KyslSxYsWj7q9YsaJWrlx5zNcsXLhQL7/8spYvXx6CCt04mfOyZs0azZ07V9dff71mzpyppKQk3XbbbcrMzIyYN+uTOS89evTQ9u3bdcEFF8jzPB08eFC33HJLRHYB51ZKSsoxz2VaWpr279+vuLg4R5WFl5EjR2rPnj3q2rWr61Kc+uWXXzR48GD997//VeHCXGr/aM2aNVq4cKGKFi2qadOmafv27brtttu0Y8cOTZgwwXV5gUELYATbvXu3evbsqRdffFHlypVzXU5Yyc7OVoUKFfTCCy+ocePG6tatm4YOHarx48e7Ls2p+fPn69FHH9Wzzz6rb7/9Vu+9954++ugjPfTQQ65Lgw+88cYbGj58uN555x1VqFDBdTnOZGVlqUePHho+fLjq1q3rupywk52draioKL3++utq0qSJLrvsMo0aNUqTJk2iFTCE+FjiI+XKlVOhQoW0ZcuWo+7fsmWLKlWq9Kfn//rrr1q3bp2uuOKKw/dlZ2dLkgoXLqxVq1apVq1aBVt0COT2vEhS5cqVVaRIERUqVOjwfaeddppSUlKUkZGhmJiYAq05FE7mvNx3333q2bOnbrrpJknSmWeeqb1796pv374aOnSooqOD+5mxUqVKxzyX8fHxtP7JVhm46aabNGXKlD91lQfN7t279c0332jZsmW6/fbbJdl7r+d5Kly4sGbPnq02bdo4rtKdypUr69RTT1VCQsLh+0477TR5nqfffvtNderUcVhdcAT33dyHYmJi1LhxY82ZM+fwfdnZ2ZozZ46aN2/+p+fXr19fP/zwg5YvX374uPLKKw/PYkxMTAxl+QUmt+dFks4//3wlJSUdDsSStHr1alWuXDkiwp90cudl3759fwp5h0KyF/Btw5s3b37UuZSkTz/99LjnMkjefPNN3XjjjXrzzTfVsWNH1+U4Fx8f/6f33ltuuUX16tXT8uXL1bRpU9clOnX++ecrOTlZe/bsOXzf6tWrFR0drSpVqjisLGDczkFBbr311ltebGysN3HiRO/nn3/2+vbt65UqVcpLSUnxPM/zevbs6Q0ePPi4r4/UWcC5PS8bNmzwSpYs6d1+++3eqlWrvA8//NCrUKGC9/DDD7v6JxSI3J6XYcOGeSVLlvTefPNNb82aNd7s2bO9WrVqeV27dnX1Tygwu3fv9pYtW+YtW7bMk+SNGjXKW7Zsmbd+/XrP8zxv8ODBXs+ePQ8/f82aNV6xYsW8QYMGeStWrPDGjRvnFSpUyPv4449d/RMKRG7Py+uvv+4VLlzYGzdunLd58+bDx65du1z9EwpEbs/L/4rkWcC5PTe7d+/2qlSp4l177bXeTz/95C1YsMCrU6eOd9NNN7n6JwQSAdCHxo4d61WtWtWLiYnxmjRp4n311VeHH2vZsqXXq1ev4742UgOg5+X+vHz55Zde06ZNvdjYWK9mzZreI4884h08eDDEVRe83JyXzMxM74EHHvBq1arlFS1a1EtMTPRuu+02b+fOnaEvvIDNmzfPk/Sn49D56NWrl9eyZcs/vaZRo0ZeTEyMV7NmTW/ChAkhr7ug5fa8tGzZ8oTPjxQn8/fyR5EcAE/m3KxYscK7+OKLvbi4OK9KlSrewIEDvX379oW++ACL8ryA9+sAAAAEDGMAAQAAAoYACAAAEDAEQAAAgIAhAAIAAAQMARAAACBgCIAAAAABQwAEAAAIGAIgAABAwBAAAQAAAoYACAAAEDAEQAAAgIAhAAIAAAQMARAAACBgCIAAAAABQwAEAAAIGAIgAABAwBAAAQAAAoYACAAAEDAEQAAAgIAhAAIAAAQMARAAACBgCIAAAAABQwAEAAAIGAIgAABAwBAAAQAAAoYACAAAEDAEQAAAgIAhAAIAAAQMARAAACBgCIAAAAABQwAEAAAImP8DRx0aJ3sVAw0AAAAASUVORK5CYII=">
2719
2720    Notes
2721    -----
2722    The limits of the plot are not updated automatically.
2723    """
2724    if ax is None:
2725        _, ax = plt.subplots()
2726
2727    fidx = fisher.fiducials[np.where(fisher.names == name1)]
2728    fidy = fisher.fiducials[np.where(fisher.names == name2)]
2729
2730    a, b, angle = _get_ellipse(fisher, name1, name2)
2731
2732    patch = ax.add_patch(
2733        Ellipse(
2734            xy=(fidx, fidy),
2735            width=2 * a * scaling_factor,
2736            height=2 * b * scaling_factor,
2737            angle=angle,
2738            **kwargs,
2739        ),
2740    )
2741
2742    return (ax.get_figure(), ax, patch)

Plot a 2D curve (usually ellipse) from two parameters of a Fisher object.

Parameters
  • fisher (FisherMatrix): the Fisher matrix which we want to plot
  • name1 (str): the name of the first parameter which we want to plot
  • name2 (str): the name of the second parameter which we want to plot
  • ax (matplotlib.axes.Axes, optional): the axis on which we want to plot the contour (default: None). If None, plots to a new figure.
  • **kwargs: any keyword arguments passed to matplotlib.patches.Ellipse.
Returns
  • A 3-tuple (Figure, Axes, Artist): The figure and the axis on which the artist was drawn on, as well as the artist itself.
Examples

Define a Fisher matrix:

>>> m = FisherMatrix(
... [[3, -2], [-2, 5]],
... names=['a', 'b'],
... fiducials=[1, -2],
... latex_names=[r'$\mathcal{A}$', r'$\mathcal{B}$'],
... )

Draw the 1$\sigma$ contour of the parameter combination a, b:

>>> fig, ax, artist = plot_curve_2d(m, name1='a', name2='b', ls='--', color='red', fill=False)

Rescale the view a bit:

>>> _ = ax.autoscale()
>>> _ = ax.relim()
>>> _ = ax.autoscale_view()

Save it to a file:

>>> fig.savefig(
... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "plot_curve_2d_example1.png",
... dpi=100)

Notes

The limits of the plot are not updated automatically.
